loans.name: Helena Maria

texts.pt:
Helena Maria I. é natural da cidade de Maputo, tem 59 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos com idade entre 40, 38, 35, 30 e 27 anos respectivamente,  apenas dois deste é que continuam a viver com ela na mesma casa. Para alem destes sustenta 3 netos que também vive com eles.

Helena estudou até 8ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, até aos 28 anos vivia na cidade de Maputo e depois passou para o distrito de Boane na Localidade de massaca na companhia do seu marido em missão de serviço e por la fixaram onde moram até data hoje. Vive numa casa própria.

Helena para alem de criadora de frangos também é uma funcionaria de uma creche a 10 anos como coordenadora, trabalha das 6:30 as 17:00h , tem um salário mensal de 5000,00mt e nao poupa nada por enquanto alegando que esta investindo neste projecto.

Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, com o primeiro conseguiu adquiri pintos e respectivos circulantes no total de 200 pintos e agora vai adquiri 400 pintos e respectivos alimentos assim para ela vai aumentar as receitas e abastecera os seus cliente segundo as suas vontades. pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de ampliar as instalações.
texts.en:
Helena Maria I. is from the city of Maputo. She is 59 years old, married and she had 5 children. Their ages now are 27, 30, 35, 38 and 40 respectively. Two of them still live with her. She also provides supports to three grandchildren that live with her as well. Helena dropped out of school when she was on the 8th grade due to financial difficulties. She lived in the city of Maputo until she was 28 years old and had to relocate to Massaca, a district of Boane, when her husband was transferred -- they still live at their own home in that location. Besides raising chickens, she has been also working at a daycare facility as a supervisor for the past 10 years. Her shift there is from 6:30am to 5:00pm. She gets a monthly salary of 5000,00mt which she cannot save anything from for she invests it entirely into her business. This will be her second loan from Hluvuku and the first from Kiva. With her first loan she purchased 200 chicks and this time she wants to purchase 400 and enough feed for them. This will cause an income increase that will enable her to fulfill clients' orders. She wants to pay it back in advance so she can request another loan that will be used to expand her business location.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chicken raising

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
Asha has been selling food products in Zanzibar since 2006. Two of her staple products are chilli peppers (known as "pilipili" in Swahili) and maize (known as "bisi" in Swahili). Both are used frequently for cooking in Tanzania. Asha works every day from 8:00am to 6:00pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $20 from the sale of her food ingredients.

Asha will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kaye A.. Kaye also owns a shop in Zanzibar. Both women are hoping that this loan will allow them to increase the profits they earn at their respective shops.

loans.use: To buy more food products for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Aïssa

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssa G. est âgée de 33 ans et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et ses 2 enfants dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Malgré ses obligations professionnelles (Professeur de son état) elle mène parallèlement des activités génératrices de revenu. Son apprentissage s’est effectué auprès de sa mère une grande commerçante très connue au niveau de la ville de Ségou. Ainsi elle a su concilier ses activités professionnelles et ses activités commerciales à savoir l’achat vente du charbon de bois, et du bois de chauffe.
En relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans, elle a bénéficié de 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et un prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau pour acheter, 200 sacs de charbon et 1 chargement de camion en bois de chauffe. 
Elle s’approvisionne généralement dans les villages environnants (tel Bananida dans la préfecture de Konobougou) et quelques fois sur place à Ségou, auprès des paysans officiellement reconnus dans la profession.
Madame Aïssa G. vend à domicile au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée de ménagères et de boulangers (qui sont ravitaillés sur commande et. servis à leurs lieux de travail). 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA, qui lui permettra de supporter les charges familiales et d’augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Aïssa G. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a traditional family in the Bagadadji neighborhood of the town of Ségou (Fourth Administrative Region, Mali). In addition to her regular job as a government-employed teacher, Aïssa engages in some income-generating activities. She learnt her craft from her mother, an excellent business woman, well-known throughout Ségou. Aïssa has managed to reconcile her professional endeavors with her commercial activities, the buying and selling of charcoal and firewood. In the past four years of her business relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, Aïssa has been the recipient of four group loans and one individual loan, all duly repaid. This would be her second individual loan, and she intends to use it to purchase 200 bags of charcoal and one truckload of firewood. Normally, she buys her merchandise from recognized professionals, rural people in surrounding villages (Bananida, Konobougou for example), and sometimes in Ségou itself. Aïssa G. sells out of her home, on a cash or credit basis, to a clientele consisting of housewives and bakers. She takes orders and delivers to their place of work. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of $83 (40,000 West African frances), which would enable her to discharge her family responsibilities and to put money back into the business.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Benkadi (Cooperation Is Good) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix (10) femmes du groupe Benkadi (1 veuve et 9 mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans avec 5 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des grandes familles polygamiques au quartier Kirango dans la sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Liées par des relations de voisinage, d’affinité (même association traditionnelle d’entraide) et professionnelle, ces femmes exercent les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et d’habits.
C’est après avoir vu des cas de réussite d’autres femmes de Markala (collaborant avec Soro Yiriwaso) qu’elles ont décidé de rejoindre cette institution avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Les deux précédents ayant été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 17 sacs de mil, 10 sacs de riz et 8 sacs d’haricot. En plus de la vente des céréales, certaines font le petit commerce d’habits dans les périodes de rupture de stock dans le marché journalier de kirango. Elles s’approvisionnent en céréales au marché hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou, à Niono et à Siribala auprès des producteurs ou des commerçants grossistes. Elles effectuent leurs ventes exclusivement en détails au marché de Kirango à une clientèle constituée généralement de femmes et de quelques hommes. Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utiliseront généralement pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter des matériels agricoles (charrues et boeufs de labour) afin de devenir productrices.
texts.en:
The 10 women of the Benkadi group (1 widow and 9 married women) have an average age of 49 and, on average, 5 children. They live for the most part in big polygamist families in the Kirango neighborhood of the Sous-prefecture of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Linked together by neighborhood as well as by similar interests (same traditional mutual aid association) and work, these women buy and re-sell cereals and clothing. It is after having seen the successes of other Markala women (working with Soro Yiriwaso) that they decided to join this institution with whom they are now on their third group (solidarity) loan. The two preceding ones were reimbursed in a timely manner.

This loan will be used to buy 17 sacks of millet, 10 sacks of rice, and 8 sacks of dried beans. Besides selling cereals, some of the women also sell clothing when the daily market at Kirango is out of the products they usually buy there for re-sale. They buy their cereals at the weekly market in Diamarabougou, at Niono and at Siribala, from the producers or from wholesale merchants. They do their selling exclusively retail, at the Kirango market to a clientele made up generally of women and a few men.

They each expect to make an average profit of 25,000 F CFA every month, money that they will use in general for pay their children's school fees. Their ambition is to buy agricultural necessities (plows and oxen) so as to become producers themselves.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals (millet, rice, dried beans)

loans.name: Naima's Group

texts.en: Naima has had a genge stand in Zanzibar for two years. A genge stand sells fruits and vegetables. They vary in size and can be as small as just a wooden plank with a handful of tomatoes or as large as a platform with a huge variety of fruits and vegetables. She currently earns approximately $60 each month from her genge stand. She is single and has no children. Naima will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mariam. Mariam also has a shop in Zanzibar.  Both women are hoping that this loan allows them to expand their businesses and increase their profits.

loans.use: Naima would like to purchase more vegetables for her shop and Mariam would like to improve her business.

loans.name: Djekafo (Let's Be Together) Group

texts.fr:
Composé de sept (7) femmes (une veuve et six mariés) les membres du groupe Djèkafo ont en moyenne 44 ans avec 4 enfants. Vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies (avec beaux parents, beaux frères, soeurs, nièces, fils, cousins, petits fils etc), ils habitent dans le quartier bamanan kin (quartier bamanan) de kirango sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative du Mali).
Unies par des liens économique et social, elles ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer l’institution Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Les deux précédents prêts ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Elles comptent acheter, 16 paniers de poisson et 5 sacs de condiments alimentaires composés d’oignon, des choux pommés, du piment et du gombo. Elles s’approvisionnent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à kirango auprès des pêcheurs. Quant aux condiments elles se ravitaillent auprès des forains fréquentant les marchés de NioN. et de Sikasso une fois par semaine (chaque dimanche) dans la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou Markala. Les produits ainsi achetés sont ensuite vendus au marché journalier de Kirango Markala à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 16.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour aider à la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille et des soins de santé des enfants.
 NB : la 7ème femme du groupe la nommée Fatoumata B. ayant perdu son mari est dans la chambre de veuvage donc absente sur la photo de groupe.
texts.en:
Made up of 7 women (a widow and 6 married women), the members of Djèkafo group have an average age of 44 and, on average, 4 children. Living in big traditional extended families (with parents-in-law, brothers- and sisters-in-law, nieces, sons, cousins, grandsons, etc.) they have homes in the Bamanan Kin neighborhood of Kirango, Sous-préfecture of Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali).

United by bonds of both economic and social nature, they have decided to become members of the institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are currently on their third group (solidarity) loan. The two preceding ones were reimbursed without difficulty.

They intend to buy 16 baskets of fish and 5 sacks of condiments including onions, cabbage, hot peppers, and okra. They get their fish along the Niger River in Kirango, direct from the fishermen. As for the condiments, they buy them from merchants who come to the markets at NioN. and Sikasso once a week (every Sunday) in the weekly fair of Diamarabougou Markala. The products bought there are re-sold at the daily market of Kirango Markala to a clientele composed mainly of women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 16,000 F CFA which they will use essentially to help with family expenses and healthcare for their children. Please note: the 7th woman in the group, Fatoumata B., who has recently lost her husband, has withdrawn for her period of mourning and is thus absent from the group photo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish and condiments for re-sale

loans.name: Sothoeun

texts.en: Mr. Sothoeun R., and his wife, Mrs. Saing-Eng Cheab, live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Sothoeun and his wife have been fishing for almost ten years. They do fishing from Mekong River and from a lake in the village to sell to a middle man and sell to villagers. Sothoeun is requesting a loan of 350 to purchase bamboo and other materials to make fish traps for his fishing business.

loans.use: Sothoeun would like to purchase bamboo and other materials to make fish traps for his fishing business.

loans.name: Thiudura

texts.en: Thiudura has had a shop selling soaps in Zanzibar for 3 years. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  She currently earns a monthly profit of approximately $85 but she is hoping that this loan will help her to increase her profit. She lives in the Jang'ombe region of Zanzibar which is just east of Stone Town.

loans.use: Thiudura would like to buy more soap for her business.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Mrs. Tong S., 60, and her husband, Mr. Phat Chey, 60, live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1960 and have six children; three sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. One son raises cows and another son is a construction worker. Two daughters are silk weavers. Tong has been a silk weaver since 1979, a skill she learned from her mother in law. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Phat does farming and raises cows. Tong is requesting a loan of 400 to purchase silk materials for her two daughters and her weaving business.

loans.use: Tong would like to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sabougnouman (Porte Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouman est un regroupement de neuf (9) femmes (constitué de 3 veuves et de 6 mariés) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames traditionnelles dans le quartier bamanan kin de kirango dans la sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative du Mali).
Appartenant toutes à la même association traditionnelle d’entraide et à la une même activité génératrice de revenu à savoir l’achat vente du poisson et des céréales, les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman décidèrent ensemble de rejoindre l’institution depuis maintenant deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés les deux prêts précédents, le groupe est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 50 paniers de poisson, 5 barres de glace, 12 sacs de mil, 4 sacs de riz et 2 sacs d’haricot. Tandis qu’elles s’approvisionnent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à l’entrée du barrage de Markala auprès des pêcheurs,  les céréales quant à elles au marché hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou les dimanches auprès des forains grossistes. Si une partie du poisson est vendue à l’état frais (à une clientèle féminine), l’autre partie est fumée à domicile sur des foyers traditionnels conçus spécialement pour cette activité, pour ensuite être vendus en détail parfois au marché journalier de Kirango Markala, à Ségou et à Bamako (capitale du Mali) à des grossistes. Les grains de céréales sont vendus au marché de Diamarabougou à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes et généralement en détail et au comptant.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 32.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants et aider les époux à subvenir aux charges familiales. Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter une maison à usage d’habitation surtout pour les orphelins.
texts.en:
Sabougnouman (meaning 'good luck charm') is a group of nine women (of whom three are widows and six are married). The group members average 41 years of age and five children. They live in traditional polygamous families in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango, in the sub-prefecture of Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). Each belonging to the same traditional mutual-aid association and doing the same income-generating work, namely buying and selling fish and grain, the women of the Sabougnouman group decided jointly to sign up with the institution two years ago. After having correctly repaid their two preceding loans, the group is on its third solidarity loan (group loan). They intend to use this new loan to buy: 50 baskets of fish, 5 slabs of ice, 12 sacks of millet, 4 sacks of rice, and 2 sacks of beans. While they get their supplies of fish from fishermen on the River Niger at the entrance of the Markala Dam, the grain is gotten from wholesale vendors at the weekly marketplace of Diamarabougou on Sundays. If a portion of the fish is sold fresh (to women customers), the rest is smoked at home over traditional hearths designed especially for this, in order to be sold retail to bulk merchants, sometimes at the daily marketplace of Kirango Markala, in Ségou and in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The grain is sold at the Diamarabougou marketplace to customers composed of women and men and generally in cash at the retail level. They each hope to realize an average profit of 32,000 francs CFA each month that will be used for covering the children's school fees and to help their husbands meet family expenses. Their ambition is to buy a house in which to live, especially for the orphans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and grain

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mrs. Hak C. is a silk weaver in Kor Village in Kandal Province. Hak is 56 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a silk weaver while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Steuy Yon, is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. C. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Mrs. C. does not have free time to take the loan but her husband is so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: Hak would like to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Mrs. Muth S. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a 58-year-old widow with seven children; two are employed in a garment factory while four others are employed in different businesses and the youngest one is attending the local school. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to resell.

loans.use: Muth would like to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell.

loans.name: Badeya (La Fraternité) Group

texts.fr:
Les six (6) femmes du groupe Badeya (toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Banconi de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Uni essentiellement par des liens professionnel et de voisinage ce groupe mène l’activité de vente de tissus, de poissons, de condiments alimentaires, de bois de chauffe, de sucre etc.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, ce groupe décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elles acheteront, 30  mètres de  tissus, 3 cartons de poissons fumés, 5 sacs de sucre, 5 chargements de charrette en  bois de chauffe et une grande  quantité de condiments (aubergines, gombos, oignons, etc). Leurs principales sources d’approvisionnement sont  en plus de la ville de Sikasso (au Mali), les villes de Bobo Dioulasso(Burkina Faso) et Bouaké respectivement (Côte d’Ivoire) en Afrique de l’Ouest.  Elles effectuent leurs ventes de façon ambulante dans les différentes entreprises, dans les quartiers de la ville et à domicile où les voisins viennent s’y ravitailler nuit et jour.
La clientèle est  composée généralement de femmes et de quelques hommes. Les membres du groupe Badeya espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six women of the Badeya group (all married) have an average age of 32, three children and live in traditional large, extended families in the Banconi district of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Brought together mainly through professional and neighborhood connections, the group sells cloth, fish, condiments, firewood, sugar, etc. All previous loans were repaid successfully. The women will use this loan to purchase 30 meters of cloth, 3 boxes of smoked fish, 5 bags of sugar, 5 bundles of firewood and a large quantity of vegetables for condiments (e.g. eggplant, okra and onions). They obtain their supplies mainly from the West African towns of Sikasso in Mali, Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso and Bouaké in Ivory Coast. Sales are conducted door-to-door at various businesses or around the town’s neighborhoods, or at their homes to neighbors who come to buy supplies day and night. Their customers are mainly women but some men. The members of the Badeya group each hope to make an average profit of CFA 35,000 per month, which will be used to pay the loan interest and provide for their families’ needs. The remainder will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items to sell (cloth, smoked fish, sugar, firewood and condiments).

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha has been cooking and selling chapati and maandazi in Zanzibar since 2006. Chapati is a flat pancake that is eaten for breakfast or lunch, either plain or rolled up with fruit or vegetables inside. Maandazi are a fried semi-sweet dough, similar to a plain donut, usually in the shape of a leavened square or triangle. Sabiha prepares both foods on her iron skillet over a fire and sells them to her neighbors.

Sabiha is 45 years old, married, and has one 14-year-old child. She prepares and sells the foods from 7:00am to 7:00pm every day. She is currently able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $25, but she hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her profit.

loans.use: Sabiha would like to buy more ingredients to expand her cooking business.

loans.name: Belles-Dames Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (4) femmes du groupe Belles-dames (toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 2 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Unies par des liens de voisinage, professionnel et de parenté, elles font majoritairement le commerce de bois de chauffe, de savons, de tissus et d’huile alimentaire.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin sans cesse croissant de sa clientèle, ce groupe décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 6ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, les membres du groupe comptent acheter, 8 chargements  de charettes en bois de chauffe, 10 cartons de savons, 45 mètres de tissus et 5 bidons d’huile alimentaire. Elles s’approvisionnent exclusivement sur place à Sikasso auprès des grossistes de grand marché (pour les tissus, les huiles alimentaires et le savon). Quant au bois de chauffe, c’est auprès des paysans (ayant un permis de coupe) ravitaillant la ville. Elles mènent généralement leurs activités à domicile et de façon ambulante et vend à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes. .         
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt, un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Belles-Dames group (all married) have an average age of 35 and two children, and live in traditional large, extended families in the Hamdallaye district of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Brought together through neighborhood, professional and family connections, they sell mainly firewood, soap, cloth and vegetable oil. In order to meet the continually growing demand of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are now on their 6th solidarity (group) loan. All previous loans were repaid successfully. The members of the group plan to use this loan to purchase 8 loads of firewood, 10 boxes of soap, 45 meters of cloth and 5 drums of vegetable oil. They buy their supplies of cloth, vegetable oil and soap only in Sikasso, from local wholesalers at the main market. With respect to firewood, they buy this from the peasants (holding a cutting permit) who supply the town. Typically they run their business from home or by walking around, and sell mainly to women. They each hope to make from this loan an average profit of CFA 20,000 per month, which will be used to pay the loan interest and provide for their families’ needs. The remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, soap, cloth and vegetable oil

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mrs. Mi Y. is a villager in Vihea Village in Kandal Province and she has a hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder who raises two pigs. Her husband, Mr. Suth Seung, is a fisherman who can gather a little fish to support his family. Although Mrs. Y. and her husband have different businesses, they still do not have enough money to build a new house so Mrs. Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to achieve her goal. Mrs. Y. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to study or attend school because that child is five years old.

loans.use: Mi would like to add to her savings to build a new house for her husband and four children.

loans.name: Danaya (Confidence) Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les quatre (4) femmes du groupe Danaya ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 2 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et mènent les mêmes activités génératrices des revenus à savoir la préparation et la vente des galettes, de la bouillie de mil, de l’haricot et de l’attièkè (semoule de d’igname). En plus de cette activité, elles font la vente  des fruits et légumes.
Ce groupe est en collaboration avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis bientôt 5 ans. Après avoir bouclé 5 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) tous correctement remboursés, il est à son 6eme prêt de groupe.   
Avec ce nouveau  prêt, les membres du groupe comptent acheter,  5 sacs de haricot, 6 sacs de manioc, 5 sacs farine de blé et 4 sacs de sucre pour des fins de restauration.
Elles s’approvisionnent exclusivement sur place au niveau du marché de Sikasso en matières premières. Elles vendent leurs plats au marché du quartier (où chacune a une place et une table) en détail et au comptant, soit devant leurs domiciles (la nuit). Les jours de foire sont les périodes propices pour réaliser des ventes importantes avec la venue des forains.(des grandes villes telle Bougouni, Ségou, Bobo et les villages environnants). La clientèle est généralement constituée de voisins, de forains et d’employés travaillant au niveau des marchés.        
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya group, all of them married, have an average age of 36 and, on average, 2 children. They live in big traditional extended families in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met because they are neighbors and are engaged in similar businesses, i.e., preparing and selling cookies, millet porridge, dried beans and "attièkè" (a sort of couscous made of yams). Moreover, they sell fruit and vegetables.

This group has been working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for almost 5 years. After having repaid 5 group loans in a timely manner, the group is on their 6th loan. With this new loan, the members of the group intend to buy 5 sacks of dried beans, 6 sacks of manioc, 5 sacks of wheat flour, and 4 sacks of sugar for the preparation of cooked food to sell.

They buy their raw materials exclusively right where they live, at the Sikasso open-air market. They sell their food in the local neighborhood market (where each has a table for use as a stand), retail and for cash, or else in front of their homes in the evenings.

Weekly marketdays provide a good chance to make more sales since a lot of people come to town (from the big towns such as Bougouni, Ségou, Bobo and the surrounding villages. Their clientele is generally made up of neighbors, of folks who come to sell at the weekly market, and of people working at the markets.

They hope to make an average profit of 50,000 F CFA each every month which will be used to make repayments on the loan and to cover family expenses, with the remainder invested back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wheat flour, manioc, dried beans, and sugar

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
T. Rahimjon applied for his first loan from MicroInvest in 2008. His business stability helped him to repay the previous loan on time and to take the next loan step. 

Mr. T. Rahimjon lives in the Spitamen region and he is the loving father of 4 children. Mr. T. Rahimjon is the toastmaster for many wedding parties and receptions. He is very educated and is an interesting guest at the parties. He knows many good toasts and jokes. People enjoys his company. 

Mr. T. Rahimjon is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 TJS ($1200 USD) for 5 months to open a specialized toastmaster's office and to provide toastmaster services. In addition to this business, he raises livestock to supplement the family income. Mr. T. Rahimjon thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To open a specialized toastmaster's office

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon Y. is a farmer in Ank Doung Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Y. is 31 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Aside from this business of farming, she also is a breeder who raises two pigs. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phat, is a fisherman. Even though they have different businesses, they still do not have enough money to build a new house so Mrs. Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: Lon would like to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en: Mrs. Sarita M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband and three children; one son and two daughters. Her daughters are studying in grade 3 and12, and her son is in grade 10. Sarita and her husband Mr. Rup Raj M. are engaged in making various items of bakery foods. They have nearly 10 years of experience in this business. They make all kinds of birthday cakes as well as ordinary cakes and cookies. They supply these goods to bakery shops. Mrs. M. requests a loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy food materials for her baked goods and also to expand their business. They want to upgrade the living standard of their family.

loans.use: Sarita and her husband would like to buy raw materials for their bakery.

loans.name: Fotemogoban (La Grandeur Humaine Dépasse Tous Les Qualificatifs) Group

texts.fr:
Composé de (5) femmes toutes mariées, les membres du groupe Fotemogoban  ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Banconi de Sikasso (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Liées par des relations de voisinage et de parenté, elles mènent des activités d’achat et de vente de bois de chauffe, de pâte d’arachide et de condiments alimentaires.
Le groupe est à son 6ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 sacs d’arachide, 18 chargements de charette en bois de chauffe et un stock important de condiments alimentaires tels les aubergines, les chalottes, les épices etc. 
Elles grillent l’arachide pour ensuite les amener au moulin pour en faire des pâtes d’arachide. Elles se ravitaillent généralement auprès des paysans producteurs qui fréquentent le marché hebdomadaire de Sikasso. Elles vendent en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché journalier de leur quartier. La clientèle est constituée essentiellement de femmes (ménagères, restauratrices etc.).       
Elles espèrent  réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 17.500FCFA par mois qu’elles envisagent utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.Dans l’avenir , elles ambitionnent ouvrir une boutique afin de faire le grosssiste dans la vente de la pâte d’arachide.
texts.en:
The group Fotemogoban is composed of (5) women all married, who have an average age of 40, and on average 3 children. They live in large traditional extended families in the neighborhood of Banconi in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

United by ties of neighborhood and kinship, they run activities related to the purchase and sale of firewood, peanut butter, and condiments.

The group is on their sixth solidarity loan (group loan). All the previous loans have been fully reimbursed. With this loan they hope to buy 10 bags of peanuts, 18 cartloads of firewood, and an important stock of condiments such as eggplants, shallots, spices etc.

They roast the peanuts and then take them to the mill to make peanut butter. They usually get their supplies from farmer producers who attend the weekly market of Sikasso. They sell retail for cash and often on credit at the daily market in their neighborhood. The customers are mostly women (homemakers and restaurant owners).

They hope to each make a profit of 17,500 FCFA per month, which they will use to repay their loan and to contribute to the families' daily expenses. In the future their ambition is to open a store in order to be wholesale sellers of peanut butter.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various goods

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en: Semeni has been selling sambusa in Zanzibar for eight years. Sambusa are a snack commonly sold in Tanzania. They consist of a fried outer shell with a meat or vegetable filling. Each one is sold for between $0.10 and $0.15. Semeni is 31 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 4 and 12. She works daily from 7:00am to 2:00pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $85. She is hoping that this loan allows her to increase her profit and expand her business.

loans.use: Semeni would like to buy more ingredients to prepare sambusas to sell.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Mrs. Bina M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single (ie. not extended) family with her husband Chakra and five daughters. Her husband is a farmer and works on his own land. All five daughters are now studying. 

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop one year ago to raise the living standard of her family. Their financial condition is not good, so they can't provide better education for their daughters, as the cost of education is very high in Nepal. To overcome this problem, Mrs. M. opened her grocery shop. 

Due to a lack of capital, she can't keep stocks of grocery items for her shop. She is asking for her first loan of Rs10000.00 to buy goods like rice, utensils, noodles, etc. She plans to spend her income to provide better education for their daughters and wishes to help her husband to upgrade the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Niru

texts.en: Niru M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Niru lives in a single family home with her husband Mr. Jiban M. and one daughter, who is studying in grade four. Three years ago, both Mr. and Mrs. M. opened their small restaurant in Sadobato, Lalitpur. Sadobato is nearly 30 minutes far from Thecho. They especially make newari foods in their restaurant because majority of people living in this region are newars and newari food is very tasty and delicious to eat. Now Mrs. M. requests for first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy food materials for their business.

loans.use: Niru would like to buy food materials for her business.

loans.name: Yeredon (To Know Oneself) Group

texts.fr:
Yeredon est un regroupement de cinq (5) femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Banconi de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de collaboration au niveau du marché où elles opèrent toutes. Elles font généralement l’achat et la vente du bois de bois de chauffe, des jus de  boissons en poudre, des condiments alimentaires et des  tissus.
Le groupe est à son 6ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, les membres du groupe comptent acheter, 10 paquets de jus de boissons en poudre, 6 chargements de charrette en  bois de chauffe, 30 mètres  de tissus et un important stock de condiments alimentaires (aubergine, oignons, gombo, etc.). Elles achètent les marchandises au marché de Sikasso auprès  des grossistes.Quant au bois de chauffe, il est acheté auprès des paysans ayant une autorisation de vente de bois. Les produits ainsi acheteés sont revendus à domicile et au marché du quartier de Médine où elles ont chacune, une place et une grande table sur laquelle elles étalent leurs marchandises.
Avec une clientèle  composée généralement de femmes, les membres du groupe Yeredon effectuent leurs ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit.         
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Yeredon is a group of five married women who, on average, are 50 years old and have 3 children. They live in large extended traditional families in the Banconi neighborhood in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met each others through neighboring ties and collaborations in the market where they all work. They typically buy and sell firewood, powdered drinks, condiments and fabrics. The group is seeking its sixth solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems. With this new loan, the women intend to buy 10 packs of powered drinks, 6 cartloads of firewood, 30 meters of fabric and a large quantity of condiments (eggplants, onions, okra, etc). They purchase goods from wholesalers in the market of Sikasso. Firewood gets purchased from farmers having an authorization to sell wood. The products are then resold at home and in the market of the Médine quarter where each woman has an emplacement with a table to display their wares. Having a mostly female clientele, the members of the Yeredon group retail their goods for cash and on credit. They hope to turn a monthly profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40) on average, to be used to provide for their families, and to invest the remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy powdered drinks, firewood, condiments, and fabrics

loans.name: Sihaba

texts.en: Sihaba has had a shop selling dresses, charcoal, and bananas in Zanzibar since 2004. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 10. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm which allows her to earn a profit of approximately $65 each month. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: Sihaba would like to buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en: Mrs. Sunita S., resident of Sanepa, lives in a single family home with her husband Mr. Surendra S. and their two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 4 and her son is in primary school. Both Mr. and Mrs. Maharjan are engaged in business in a small restaurant. They opened their restaurant 3 months ago. They make different items of Nepali food in their restaurant, and they prefer to make dal bhat in their shop. They also serve tea and coffee to their customers. Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00  to buy various types of foods materials for their business.

loans.use: Sunita would like to buy food materials for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Santa Evangelina would like to purchase women's clothing and beauty products for her clothing store and beauty shop.

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru: Худаёров Фахриддин, 1977 года рождения. Он женат и у них 3 детей. Он выбрал для себя особое направление в бизнесе – производство. Он считает, что нет лучшего бизнеса чем производство, и если ты производишь товар на который есть спрос, то он приносит большие доходы. Фахриддин занимается производством деревянных окон и дверей. Производимые им товары уже имеют своих покупателей, так как у Фахриддина много клиентов. Его товары имеют как национальный фасон, так и европейский. С наступлением зимы обостряется процесс строительства и спрос на товары производимые им увеличивается. Недавно Фахриддин получил заказ на изготовление 2000 шт ящиков для фруктов и чтоб выполнить этот заказ он хочет закупить сырья (древесины) и ему нужен займ в сумме 4000 сомони.
texts.en:
Fahriddin K. was born in 1977. He is married with three children. He has chosen a certain direction in business - manufacturing. He thinks that there's no better business than manufacturing and if you can produce goods which have demand then your business can make good profits. Fahriddin is in the business of manufacturing wooden windows and doors. They are in demand and have buyers because Fahridding has a lot of clients. His products are made in Tajik style and also in European style. With the arrival of winter the construction gets intense and the demand for his products increases. Not very long ago Fahriddin has received an order for production of 2,000 boxes for fruits and to fulfill this order he needs to buy raw materials (wood) and for this he needs a loan for 4,000 somoni (USD$1,200).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials - wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Sarakhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarakhoun Thaugn, 49, and her husband, Mr. Hoeun Chea, 51, live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children; five sons and two daughters. Two of their children have full time employment. Two children study in the local school.

Mrs. Thaugn has been a grocery seller for one year. She buys grocery items from the Korky market to resell to villagers at her home. Her husband has been a fisherman for ten years. Sarakhoun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a stock of more grocery items to resell.

loans.use: Sarakhoun would like to purchase grocery item for her shop.

loans.name: Mengchin

texts.en: Mr. Mengchin T., 34, and his wife, Mrs. Veasna Mao, 36, who live along National Road Number Six about fifteen Kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have one daughter who studies in the local school. Mr. T. and his wife have been in the business of selling ice for over one year. He buys ice from a factory near his village and carries it by his truck to sell along national road number six. Before starting this business he used to be a construction worker. Currently his truck is broken and he lacks the money to repair it. Therefore, Mengchin is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair his truck to continue his business.

loans.use: Mengchin would like to repair his truck so he can continue his business selling ice.

loans.name: Rindy

texts.en: Mrs. Rindy M., 40, is a widow with six children; two sons and four daughters. Two of her daughters have full time employment and the other four children study in the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh Rindy has been farming since she was young. She grows many types of vegetables in her farmland not so far from home. The main income for her family is from her farm's business and her two daughters' jobs. She is requesting a loan of $700 to build a new staircase, pillars, and repair other parts of her house.

loans.use: Rindy would like to build a new staircase, pillars, and repair other parts of her house.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn N., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Srey Long, 32, who live along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have seven children; five sons and two daughters. Their first son is a construction worker and the second son raise cows. Three of their children study in the local school.

Sorn and his wife have been selling sugar palm juice and fruit for over ten years. Every morning, Sorn climbs up sugar palm trees to collect palm juice and palm fruit to sell in his village and a nearby village by his bicycle. Currently he needs to buy a motorbike to carry his palm fruit and juice to sell. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $400.

loans.use: Sorn would like to purchase a motorbike for carrying sugar palm fruits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Jovid

texts.ru: Джумаев Джовид живет со своей семьей в районе Джилликуль. Он живет с родителями и еще не женат. Возраст 26 лет. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того уже пять лет занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот , он планирует получить кредит. Таким образом он сможет увеличить прибыль , необходимую для его семьи. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jovid J. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Jillikul region of Tajikistan. He works as a school teacher. In addition, for the past five years he has been growing livestock. In order to increase cash flow and profit that his family needs, Jovid would like to obtain a loan. He plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Махмадалиев Бахтиер житель Джилликульского района. Работает мясником на рынке Района. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот . Получив кредит он сможет купить еще одного бычка . Это поможет ему получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить условия жизни семьи. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor M. lives in the Jillikuli region. He is married and has four children. Bahtiyor works as a butcher at the regional market. He wants to take out this loan in order to buy an additional calf and thus increase his future sales. This loan will help him get additional revenue and improve the living conditions of his family. Bahtiyor is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
A. Islom is 26 years old. He lives in the town of Isfara; he is married and has two children His wife is a housekeeper. Islom processes and sells dried apricots in the central local market. He is experienced in drying apricots. Usually, he purchases dried apricots in the market and processing them himself. Because he buys dried apricots at wholesale prices, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means. Islom has a quite successful business, and he earns a stable income for the family.

Islom requests a loan for 2500 Somoni ($750). He plans to purchase dried apricots, process them, and then sell them in the market. He would like to increase his income and give his children a good education. Islom expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase more apricots and process them for reselling

loans.name: Karamatullo

texts.ru: Муминов Караматулло  проживает в Джилликуле. Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет четверых детей.Занимается животноводством. Покупает  бычков , и сразу перепродает на тех же рынках. Бизнес приносит доход . Для того . чтобы увеличить бизнес он планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Karamatullo M. loves in Jillikul. He is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. He raises livestock. He buys bull calves and resells them at the same market. The business is profitable. In order to expandit, Karamatullo would like to obtain a loan that he plants to repay in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Lutfiddin

texts.en:
F. Lutfiddin is 39 years old. He is married and has 2 children – a 16-year-old daughter and a 14-year-old son. He and his family live in the town of Isfara. Lutfiddin rents a minivan and offers transportation services. His business is the only source of income for the family. Lutfiddin’s usual itinerary is the Isfara-Khujand-Isfara route. Lutfiddin has been in this business for 4 years.

Currently, he earns about $20 per day. Lutfiddin’s minivan needs repairing. That is the reason that he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600). One of his long-term plans is to buy his own minivan and continue to be self-employed. Lutfiddin promises to repay this loan in 12 months without any delay.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to repair his minivan taxi

loans.name: Savrinisso

texts.ru: Эгамбердыева Савриниссо жительница района Джиликуль. Возраст 52 года. Работает учителем в средней школе района.Кроме того имеет хозяйство , где разводит домашний скот. Планирует получить кредит для покупки молодой породистой  коровы для разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Получение возможного кредита даст возможность развивать животноводческий сектор , а так же обеспечить население мясом и молочными продуктами.
texts.en:
Savrinisso E. lives in the Jillikul region of Tajikistan. She is 52 years old and works as a school teacher. In addition, she raises livestock. Savrinisso plans to obtain a loan for purchasing a young cow of good breed. She would be able to repay the loan in the next 12 months. The loan would contribute to the development of the animal husbandry sector and supply the local population with meat and dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a young cow

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
K. Sharofat is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has 3 adorable children. Three years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She has a sewing machine at her house where she produces national dresses for women. Now her daughter is grown up and helps her mother with her business, but unfortunately they have only one sewing machine.

Sharofat wants to purchase another sewing machine in order to expand her business. That is the reason she is asking for a loan of 1800 Somoni ($550). She plans to buy an additional sewing machine to increase her production and meet her customers' requests. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months.

From money she earns from the additional sales, she wants to fix the house and pay for her children’s education. Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Sharofat’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Purchasing another sewing machine for sewing women national dresses

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en:
N. Marifat is 30 years old. She is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her three children and provide for their education. For 8 years, Marifat has been preparing and selling dried apricots. Marifat always uses her capital productively, increasing her inventory of apricots so she can meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she earns more each month.

Marifat requests a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750). She plans to purchase dried apricots and process them to increase the range of the goods that she sells. With your help this will be possible. Marifat expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Гоибова Зухро жительница Джиликульского района. Возраст 38 лет, замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Уже четыре года занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Бизнес приносит доход , но ей необходимо улучшить условия в магазине. Поэтому она решила получить кредит для того , чтобы купить стройматериалы для ремонта в помещении. Это поможет ей привлечь клиентов , а так же улучшить условия хранения продуктов питания. Погасить кердит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zuhro G. lives in the Jillikuli region. She is 38 years old, married and has five children. For the last four years Zuhro has been working in retail - she owns and manages the grocery store next to her house. Her business is profitable but she needs to improve the building in which the store is located. Zuhro wants to take out a loan in order to purchase construction supplies for the remodeling of her store. This will not only attract new clients but also improve the storage conditions of groceries she offers for sale. Zuhro is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store remodelling

loans.name: Dilovarjon

texts.en:
Dilovarjon O. is 20 years old. He is not married and despite his young age, he runs his own business. He decided to dedicate himself to raising livestock two years ago, after gaining experience working on a livestock ranch. He added everything he learned to the education his parents instilled in him since he was a child. 

Dilovarjon plans to keep raising livestock and to acquire even more. This is why he is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) that would allow him to purchase more food for the normal development and competitiveness of his cattle. He promises to repay the loan in 15 months. He thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.ru: Махмадиев Мухаммад житель района Джиликул. Проживает со своей семьей. Ему 23 года и у него уже есть четверо детей. С юнных лет он занимается живоотноводством. Разводит бычков для продажи. Планирует получить кредит для покупки телят. После откормки он сможет их выгодно продать. Это принесет ему неплохой доход . Кроме того развитие животноводства является необходимой задачей каждого фермера. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhamad M. lives in the Jilikul region. He lives with his family. He is 23 years old and already has 4 children. Muhamad has been raising livestock since he was young. He raises bulls for sale. Muhamad plans to take out a loan in order to purchase calves. After fattening them, he will be able to sell them for a profit. This will bring him a good income. In addition, raising livestock is a necessary challenge for every farmer. Muhamad can pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Abubacar Taju

texts.pt:
Abubacar Taju I. é natural do distrito de Matola província do Maputo e tem 71 anos de idade, casado, nunca teve filhos e vive com sobrinhos, e sua esposa. Desde a sua infância, vive na cidade da Matola. 

Abubacar é comerciante a mais de 10 anos, gerindo um estabelecimento comercial abrindo das 7:00h e fecha as 18:00h, tem um empregado. Destaca como bom produto a Cerveja que adquira a caixa por 230,00mt e vende por 300,00mt. E tem um rendimento diário de 1500,00mt e consegue poupar algum no fim do mes. Vive numa casa própria.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca teve empréstimo noutras instituições, assim pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro de forma a tornar mais atractivo o estabelecimento colocando produtos diversificados.
texts.en:
Abubacar Taju I. is from the district of Matola, a province of Maputo. He is 71 years old, married and he's never had any children. He lives with a few nephews and his wife. He's lived in the city of Matola ever since he was a child. For over 10 years Abubacar has worked in the retail business by running a commercial establishment from 7:00am until 6:00pm. He has one employee. He notes that beer is a good product because he can buy a case of it for 230,00mt and sell it for 300,00mt. His store generates 1500,00mt daily and he is able to save a certain amount from that at the end of every month. He lives in his own home. This will be his first loan from Hluvuku and he has never requested loans from any other financial institution. He intends to pay it off in advance so he can request a second loan that will be invested in making his place of business more attractive by offering a better selection of goods.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchae additional basic goods

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
S. Zuhra is 35 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Difficult living conditions for the family forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn a living. For 8 years, she has had a small business drying and processing apricots. Dried fruit, especially dried apricots, is very popular in Tajikistan. Apricots are also very healthy. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Zuhra is quite successful and earns a steady and stable income for the family. Her business allows Zuhra to contribute significantly to the household and education of her dearest children.

Zuhra requests a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750). She plans to purchase more apricots to dry and process to sell. Zuhra expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her, so she can keep working.

loans.use: Purchase more apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
U. Nodira is a dynamic and ambitious 25-year-old lady. She is married and has 3 children. For 2 years she has had a small business processing dried apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown. This income allows Nodira to contribute significantly to the household.

Nodira requests a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600). She plans to purchase dried apricots and then process and resell them. Nodira hopes that she will continue providing her children with education so they will be able to receive an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Haidarali

texts.ru: Азизов Хайдарали житель Джиликульского района. Возраст 24 года. Имеет двоих детей. Обеспечивает семью путем торговли. Торгует на центральном рынке.Привозит товар из города Душанбе, который покупает у оптовых реализаторов. Привозит товар к себе и продает в розницу. Его бизнес приносит доход ему лично, а так же население , покупая  у него товар выигрывает в том , что им не приходится ехать за покупками в город Душанбе и тратить деньги на дорогу. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Haidarali A. lives in the Jillikuli region. He is 24 years old and has two children. Haidarali provides for his family by selling goods at the central market. He purchases clothes from wholesalers in Dushanbe and brings them to his region where they can be sold for a profit. Haidarali's business is beneficial not only to him but to other people in the region who don't need to spend money traveling to Dushanbe in order to buy clothes. Haidarali would like to take out this loan in order to buy more seasonal goods wholesale. He will be able to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal goods wholesale

loans.name: Akumu Mary, Bugolo Group

texts.en: Mary A. sells "mukene" (a small silvery fish) wholesale to both her local community and business people from Lugazi and the neighbouring towns. Mary received a previous Kiva loan with which she was able to buy a boat and fishing net, and is now part of this group loan request. With her share of the loan, together with the contribution from her husband, she plans to continue with the construction of her family house, as well as complete payments for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To continue construction of the family home as well as pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Flavio Jaime

texts.pt:
Flavio Jaime M.  é Natural de Maputo cidade, tem 31 anos de idade .     Casado e pai de 3 filhos de 04, 06 e 03 anos de idade respectivamente, o de 06 anos estuda. não tem mais ninguém sob sua responsabilidade.

Flávio  estudou ate 5ª classe, parou porque ficou orfao de pais, vivia com avo e não tinha condições para continuar. Sempre viveu na Massaca uma zona agrícola razão pela qual ele é  Agricultor e dono da machamba ha 13 anos . trabalha das 06:00h/ 10:00h as 16:00h/18:00h. Tem 04 empregados . Aprendeu trabalhando como empregado da machamba nesta zona.

Pela produção consegue aproximadamente 48000,00mt de vendas de horticulas diversas e faz poupança de algum, vive numa casa própria, para Flávio este é o segundo empréstimo na vida já teve um na Pró-credito no valor de 30000,00mt. 

Flávio conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que já era cliente, tem como planos para futuro e conta com ajuda do credito para sua realização que consistira na construção de um estabelecimento comercial para vender os seus produtos agrícola como retalhista.
texts.en:
Flavio Jaime M. is from the city of Maputo. He is 31 years old, married and has 3 children -- they are 3, 4 and 6 years old respectively. He is not responsible for anybody else. Flavio went to school only up until the 5th grade because he became an orphan at an young age and could not continue his education because he had to move in with his grandparents. He has always lived in the agricultural region of Massaca where he owns a smallholding and, for the last 13 years, has worked as a farmer. He works a split shift from 6:00am - 10:00am and 4:00pm - 6:00pm and he has 4 employees. He learned this skill by working on others smallholdings around the same area. The smallholding's monthly production may reach approximately 48000,00mt in horticulture trade -- a part of which gets saved away. He lives in his own home. This will be Flavio's second loan request. He previously obtained a loan of 30000,00mt from Pro-Credito. Flavio became aware of Hluvuku through a friend who was already a member. In the future, he wishes to build a loan-sponsored commercial establishment to sell agricultural products.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mamazoir

texts.ru: Хазраткулов Мамазоир житель города Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 26 лет , женат и имеет одного ребенка. Кроме своей семьи , живет с родителями , семья очень большая , а кормильцем является только он. Поэтому ему приходится много работать. Имеет точку , где реализует услуги ксерокопии и денежные  переводы за телефоны различных провайдеров. Дело приносит доход, так как точка находится в центре города. Планирует получить кредит и использовать его на приобретение тонеров и бумаги. Это даст возможность сохранить цены на паредлагаемые услуги. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mamazoir H. lives in the city of Kurgan-Tube. He is 26 years old, married and has one child. Aside from his own family Mamazoir also lives with his parents, so his family is very large, but he is currently the sole provider. Mamazoir works a lot to provide for everyone. He owns and manages a copy and cell phone card shop, which has been a profitable business, especially due to the store's central location. Mamazoir would like to take out a loan in order to purchase toner and paper wholesale in advance, allowing him to keep his prices low despite the rising costs on paper. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper and toner

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Исомаддинова Барно жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Проживает в одном из отдаленных поселков города. Работает на центральном рынке города. Занимается торговлей женской одежды и национальными тканями. Опыт в бихзнесе уже 8 лет. Планирует получить кредит и использовать его в целях развития бизнеса. Хочет привезти сезонный товар. Это поможет привлечь клиентов и увеличить прибыль. Барно замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Семья не большая , но очень дружная. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Barno I. lives near the city of Kurgan-Tube, in one of the remote suburbs. She is married and has one child. Barno's family is small but they all love each other very much. She works at the central market where she sells women's clothes and fabric for national costumes. Barno has been working in retail for the last 8 years. She want to take out this loan in order to develop her business and bring in seasonal goods. This will allow Barno to attract new clients and increase revenue from the store. Barno is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal goods

loans.name: António Zablona

texts.pt:
Antonio nasceu em morrumbene na provincia de inhambane, é solteiro de 31 anos de idade, pai de 4 filhos, o primeiro rapaz de 9 anos, a 2ª rapariga de 8 anos, o 3º rapaz de 4 anos e o ultimo bebe de 4 meses apenas, só o primeiro  vai a escola.
 
Antonio depois de ter frequentado o ensino primario em morrumbene teve que passar para o ensino secundario em maxixe,  já não contava com a ajuda dos seus pais então resolve abrir um negocio de venda de refrescos e cervejas. Sai de morrumbene para  passar ferias em casa do seu tio em maputo,durante as ferias decide ficar por lá e praticar negócio com o fundo o fundo colectado na venda de ferescos em morrumbende, dcomeça comvenda  venda de refrigerantes na praia da costa do sol. Em 2000 tenta diversificar o seu negocio e começa com a venda de lencois e dovetes que eram adquiridos na swazilandia e revendidos em namaacha,  e para facilitar o negócio aluga uma casa e passa a viver em namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Swasilândia.O negócio deu lhe bons resultados, Antonio conseguiu comprar um terreno e construiu a sua propria casa no mesmo Distrito,anos depois esse neg’ocio já não era rentavel pois o governo começou a ser muito rigoroso na coprança dos direitos Alfandigarios, assim ele disiste e começa com negocio de venda de material electrico diverso peles ruas do mesmo Distrito negocio esse que exerce até então, tem como melhor produto antenas de televisores que adquire a 300.00.00MT e revende a 450.00.00MT,  trabalha das 7h as 15h tem tido um lucro de 4.000.00.00MTmensalmente, e consegue poupar 1000.00mtn, pois para além da sua familia responsabilisa se pelas sua duas cunhadas que vivem com ele.

Esta é o segundo emprestimo de antonio na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro de 7.000.00MT,usou para comprar material electrico para revenda, e pede este segundo de 10,000.00mtn para o mesmo fim. Ta confiante que vai pagar antes do prazo e adquirir um outro emprestimo para construir uma mercearia e deixar de ser vendedor ambulante
texts.en:
Antonio was born in Morrumbene, in Inhambane Province. He is 31 years old, single, and the father of four children. His first son is 9 years old, the second 8, the third 4, and the youngest is a baby only 4 months old. Only the oldest child goes to school.

Antonio attended primary school in Morrumbene and then had to go to Maxixe to attend secondary school. No longer depending on the help of his parents, he decided to open a business selling soft drinks and beer. He left Morrumbene to spend his holiday at his uncle’s house in Maputo. During his holiday, he decided to stay there and do business with the capital that he had accumulated from selling drinks in Morrumbene. He started by selling sodas on the Costa do Sol beach. In 2000 he tried diversifying his business with the sale of bed linens, which he purchased in Swaziland and resold in Namaacha. To facilitate running his business, he rented a house in Namaacha, a village on the border of Swaziland. The business did well, and Antonio was able to buy a plot of land and build his own house on it.

Years later this business was not profitable, as the government became very strict about collecting customs duties. Thus, Antonio quit this business and began another selling various electrical materials in the streets of the same district. The best selling items of this business, which Antonio has continued through today, are television antennas which he buys for 300 meticais (MTn) and resells for 450MTn. He works from 7am to 3pm. He earns 4,000MTn monthly, and is able to save 1,000MTn. In addition to providing for his family, he takes care of two sister-in-laws who live with him.

This is Antonio’s second loan with Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. He used his first loan of 7,000MTn to purchase electrical materials to resell. He requests this second loan of 10,000MTn to use for the same purpose. He is confident that he will repay this loan early and take out another loan to build a grocery shop and quit being a street vendor.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical materials to resell

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Kokouvi A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il réside à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise.  Il exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans et espère avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto, étant donné que la première est usée et les frais de réparations ne lui permettent pas d’économiser afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokouvi A., 39, is married and the father of 4 children. He lives in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He has been working at this business for 3 years and would like to use this loan to buy a new motorcycle, since his present one is expended and the costs for repairs do not allow him to save with a view to better providing for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing a new motorcycle

loans.name: Rokiya

texts.en:
Rokiya T. is 42 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Difficult living conditions and low wages forced her husband to leave for Russia for earnings. Considering that, she started a business two years ago. Rokiya breeds cattle, and buys small cattle at the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them at the same market at a more profitable price. Her eldest son also tends to this business. Rokiya works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family. 

Today, Rokiya is planning to purchase cattle for her household to raise and resell. For this purpose, she requests 1500 Somoni (US $450) for the term of 9 months. Rokiya would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Nelson Alexandre

texts.pt:
Nelson nasceu em Mafavuca numa localidade do distrito de Namaacha uma vila  que faz fronteira com a Swazilândia, solteiro de 35 anos de idade. e pai de 5 filhos: com idades compriendidas entre os 16 aos 2 anos. Os 3 mais velhos já frequentam o ensino primario.

Nelson estudou ate a 7ªclasse devido a perca do pai, concequentimente ele teve que ocupar o lugar do seu pai no serviço na africa do sul para poder sustentar a familia. Trabalhou durante 8 anos e terminou o contrato.dai volta a terra natal, com o fundo colectado compra um carro e abre uma barraca em casa da sua mae onde vendia produtos de primeira necessidade, assim nelson conseguiu construir a sua propria casa. Anos depois junta se com a sua esposa e sai da casa da mãe, mas continuava a trabalhar na barraca,e aos poucos construia uma barraca na sua residência. Em 2007 consegue concluir com a obra mas já não tinha fundo para comprar  a mercadoria.Atrves duma conversa com os amigos teve conhecimento dos serviços da hluvuku, assim solicitou um emprestimo e conseguiu comprar a mercadoria.Seu melhor produto e o( acucar, arroz, sabão e sal) compra o kilo a 20.00.Mt e revende a 25.00.MT,o saco a 500.00.MT revende a 600.00MT,a caixa 200.00mt e revende a 275.00.MTconsecutivamente pois na região onde se encontram vivem mais de produtos agricolas. Trabalha das 7h as 18h tem rendido um valor de 7.000.00MT pois não tem muitas barracas na zona e poupa por mês 2.000.00MT,para além dos filhos nelson responsabiliza-se pela mãe e seus irmãos mandando lhes uma mesada no valor de 1000.00mt por mês.			 

Este é o segundo empréstimo de nelson na HLUVUKU e primeiro com KIVA. O primeiro empréstimo de 10.000.00MTN usou para comprar produtos da barraca, e pede este segundo de 25.000.00MT para o mesmo fim, ele está comfiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo determinado, pretende solicitar mais emprestimos e iniciar com o negoco de crição e venda de gado bovino.
texts.en:
Nelson was born in Mafavucas, in a village in the Namaacha district, which borders Swaziland. Single and 35 years old, he is the father of five children, between the ages of 2 and 16 years old. The oldest three attend primary school.

Nelson studied through seventh grade, until the loss of his father. Then he had to take his father’s place in service in South Africa to support the family. He worked for eight years and completed the contract. Returning to his native land, with the capital he had collected he bought a car and opened a small shop in his mother’s house, where he sold basic necessities. Through this business, Nelson was able to build his own house. Years later, he got married and left his mother’s house, but continued to work at the shop. Little by little, he built a shop in his own house. In 2007 he was able to complete its construction but did not have funds to buy merchandise. Through a conversation with his friends, he learned of the services of Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner]. So he requested a loan and was able to buy inventory. His best products are sugar, which he buys for 20 meticais (MTn) per kilogram and resells for 25MTn; rice, buying for 500MTn and reselling for 600MTn per sack; soap, buying at 200MTn and reselling for 275MTn per box; and salt. In this region, people mostly live off agricultural products. Nelson works from 7am to 6pm and makes 7,000MTn monthly. As there are not a lot of shops in the area, he saves 2,000MTn per month. In addition to providing for his children, Nelson takes care of his mother and his siblings, sending them 1,000MTn each month.

This is Nelson’s second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He used the first loan of 10,000MTn to buy products for his shop, and he requests this second loan of 25,000MTn for the same purpose. He is confident that he will repay the loan early, and he plans to request more loans in the future to start a business of raising and selling oxen.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on basic necessity items for his store

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Гурезов Фарход живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Имеет высшее образование . По специальности экономист. Работает председателем дехканского хозяйства. Кроме того имеет участок земли и использует его для посева различного рода продукции. К осеннему сезону планирует подготовить землю для посева картофеля. Поэтому он решил получить кредит и использовать его на приобретение ГСМ и семян. Срок кредита на который он решил взять кредит 12 месяцев. Этот кредит поможет его семье своевременно засеить землю и получить качественный урожай
texts.en:
Farhod G. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region. He is married and has five children. Farhod has a college degree in economics and works as the president of a farming co-op. On the side he also owns a plot of land where he grows various crops. For the fall season Farhod is planing to prepare the soil for potato planting and he wants to take out this loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He is planning to pay back the loan within the next 12 months. This loan will allow Farhod's family to plant the crops in a timely fashion and collect a quality harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Arlindo Alfredo

texts.pt:
