Arlindo nasceu em Gaza, tem 28 anos de idade estudou ate 3 classe vive maritalmente  e  pai de 5 filhos: com idades compriendidas entre os 9 aos 2 anos de idade so o mais velho e que vai a escola. mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia  a procura de emprego deixando a sua familia em Gaza.

Arlindo após de concluir a 3ª classe teve que interroper os estudos devido a má condição financeira dos pais pois eram camponêses. Assim teve que começar a trabalhar nas residencias como cozinheiro, anos depois foi contratado por alguns alfândegarios que trabalhavam na fronteira de Namaacha assim ele mudou se para essa vila, e recebia mensalmente 1.850,00.mt trabalhava como cozinheiro. Anos depois os seus patrões foram transferidos, e Arlindo consegue um emprego no hotel 5 estrelas da vila(Hotel Libombos)onde trabalha ate hoje entrando as 7h as 15h no periodo da manhã e as 15h as 22h no periodo da tarde auferindo um salrio mansal de 1.800.00.mt. Mas porque o salário não consegue sustentar todas suas necessidades resolve abrir o seu próprio negócio adquirindo uma banca no mercado central da vila onde roupa comprada na swazilândia os seus melhores produtos são camisolas, calções, e calsas que compra a a 55.00.mt , 120.00.mt e 220.00.mt  vende a 180.00.mt, 250.00.mt e 450.00.mt consecutivamente. Tem um lucro mensal de 4.000.00mt , consegue poupar 1.500.00mt e envia 3.500.00mt para a familia e ele gasta 800.00.mt. para alem da familia responsabiliza se pelos 3 sobrinhos que vivem com a sua esposa em gaza pois estes perderam o pai. 


Etse e o segundo empréstimo de arlindo na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 9.200.00mt usou para comprar mercadorias e pede este segundo empréstimo de 15.500.00mt para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do prazo e pedir outro empréstimo para concluir a sua obra em Gaza.
texts.en:
Arlindo is 28 years old and was born in Gaza. He went to school through third grade. He is married and the father of five children, ages two to nine years old. Only the eldest goes to school. In pursuit of work, Arlindo left his family in Gaza and moved to Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland.

Arlindo had to interrupt his studies after finishing third grade because of the meager financial situation of his parents, who were poor country folk. As such, he had to start working as a cook in people’s houses. Years later he was contracted by some customs employees who worked at the border in Namaacha, where he moved to take the job. He received 1,850 meticais (MTn) per month while working as a cook. Years later his employers were transferred, and he found employment at a five-star hotel in the village (Hotel Libombos), where he has worked until now. He works 7am to 3pm on the morning shift and 3pm to 10pm on the afternoon shift, earning a monthly salary of 1,800MTn. But because this salary was not enough to cover all his necessities, he decided to open his own business. He acquired a stall at the central market in the village, where he sells clothes he purchases in Swaziland. His best-selling items are nightgowns, shorts, and shirts, which he buys for 55MTn, 120MTn, and 220MTn and sells for 180MTn, 250MTn, and 450MTn respectively. He makes a monthly profit of 4,000MTn. He is able to save 1,500MTn, sends 3,500MTn to his family, and spends 800MTn. In addition to supporting his family, he takes care of three nephews, who live with his wife in Gaza because they lost their father.

This is Arlindo’s second loan with Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. He used his first loan of 9,200MTn to buy merchandise and requests this second loan of 15,000MTn for the same end. He is confident that he will repay before the due date and will ask for another loan to complete his work in Gaza.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear and clothing

loans.name: Godwin

texts.fr: Godwin A. est un conducteur de taxi moto depuis 2 ans à Womé , un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 42 ans, Godwin est marié te père de 4 enfants. La moto qu’il conduit n’étant pas de sa propriété, il désire avec ce crédit s’acheter son propre engin afin de mieux gagner et épargner pour satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Godwin A. has been a driver of motorcycle taxi for 2 years in Womé, a village located about 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Godwin is 42 years old, married and the father of 4 children. The motorcycle he drives is not his own, he wishes, with this loan, to buy his own machine in order to earn more, and to save, to meet the needs of his family.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Kossi-Doh Agbémavi

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Kossi-Doh Agbémavi est né en 1961 à Tsévié. Infirmier de profession, il est marié et père de six enfants.

Fonctionnaire moyen , il arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille étant donné que le salaire est insuffisant. Après les soins médicaux, les patients sont obligés de faire d’autres distances avant de pouvoir acheter leur prescription, ce qui les fatigue. Pour  cela, une mini pharmacie à côté du dispensaire serait un atout pour ces patients.

 Ainsi, Monsieur A. sollicite un crédit pour réaliser ce projet dont la réalisation sauvera beaucoup de vies humaines.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossi-Doh Agbémavi A. was born in Tsévié in 1961. He's a trained medical assistant, he is married and the father of six children. His position as mid-level public servant does not enable him to provide for his family due to an insufficient salary. After being treated, patients have to travel to buy their prescription, which weary them. To this effect, a pharmacy near the dispensary would be very useful. Mr. A. is thus seeking a loan to realize this project, which will save many human lives.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a pharmacy to sell generic medicines

loans.name: Belmiro Fabião

texts.pt:
Belmiro nasceu em Gaza, tem 25 anos de idade estudou ate 7ªclasse vive maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos: a primeira de 5 anos e o segundo de 1 ano. A mais velha é que vai a escola, mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia com a sua tia devido a doênças frequentes que o atacavam naquela região.
Belmiro chega a Namaacha e não consegue vaga para continuar com os estudos, no ano seguinte  a tia da-lhe um fundo para ele poder iniciar o seu próprio negócio, começa com a venda de bolos adquiridos na swazilândia e revendidos ao lado de uma barraca de refrigerantes na fronteira, o seu negócio teve um impacto positivo quando os alfandegarios decidem retirar a barraca de refrigerantes e consequêntimente além de bolos passa também a vender refrigerantes e a fazer câmbio de divisas, assim Belmiro conseguiu contruir a sua própria casa. Anos depois junta se com a sua esposa e sai da casa da tia e aos poucos construia sua própria barraca na sua residência para aumenter a renda familiar, seu melhor produto e a( farinha de trigo, arroz, peixe e massa) compra o kilo a 20.00.mt e revende a 28.00.mt, o saco a 500.00.mt e revende a 625.00.mt, a lámina a 350 e revende a 700.00.mt e a caixa de massa 200.00.mt e revende a 350.00.mt consecutivamente. Trabalha das 7h as 20h tem rendido um valor de 6000.00.mt mensalmente consegue poupar 2.000.00mt por mês, para além dos filhos Belmiro responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que se encontram em Gaza mandando lhes uma sesta básica de 1.000.00mt.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Belmiro na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro empréstimo de 15.000.00mt usou para reforçar o negócio de bolos e refrigerante, conseguiu pagar o emprestimo dentro do prazo determinado e pede este segundo de 12.000.00mt para comprar mercadoria da sua barraca. Tem como objectivo ampliar a sua barraca e pedir um novo empréstimo para comprar uma viatura que lhe possa facilitar nos negócios do seu dia –dia.
texts.en:
Belmiro was born in Gaza, is 25 years old, and studied through seventh grade. He is married and the father of two children: the first is a 5-year-old daughter who goes to school, and the second is a 1-year-old son. Belmiro moved with his aunt to Namaacha, a village on the border of Swaziland, to avoid the frequent illnesses to which he had been subject in the Gaza area.

Belmiro arrived in Namaacha and was unable to get a spot in school to continue his studies. The next year, his aunt gave him money to enable him to start his own business. He began by selling cakes he bought in Swaziland and reselling them next to a soft drink stand at the border. His business benefited when customs agents decided to shut down the soft drink stand; consequently he started selling soft drinks in addition to cakes and started exchanging currency. Through this, Belmiro was able to build his own house. Years later he got together with his wife and left his aunt’s house.

Little by little he built his own shop in his house to augment the family’s income. His biggest products are wheat flour, which he buys at 20 meticais (MTn) and resells for 28MTn per kilogram; rice, buying at 500MTn and reselling for 625MTn per sack; fish, buying at 350MTn and reselling for 700MTn per plate; and pasta, buying at 200MTn and reselling for 350MTn per box. He works from 7am to 8pm and earns 6,000MTn monthly. He is able to save 2,000MTn per month. In addition to his children, Belmiro takes care of his parents in Gaza, sending them 1,000MTn for basic goods each month.

This is Belmiro’s second loan with Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. He used the first loan, of 15,000MTn, to strengthen his cakes and drinks business and repaid the loan on time. He is asking for this second loan, of 12,000MTn, to buy merchandise for his shop. His goal is to grow his shop and request a new loan to purchase a vehicle to facilitate his day-to-day business.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: King Of Kings Group

texts.es: LOS SOCIOS DEL GRUPO REY D. REYES  REPRESENTADA POR LA PRESIDENTA SRA ROSA. LA SRA. DUNIA Y ELIZABETH SON HERMANAS E HIJAS D. HERMOSINDA AMBAS CUENTAN CON NEGOCIOS INDEPENDIENTES POR LO QUE FUERON CONSIDERADAS PARA CONFORMAR EL PRESENTE GRUPO. LAS INTEGRANTES MUJERES SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. COMIDA, ROPA, PROMOTORAS D. AVON, YAMBAL, SASTRERIA, SERIGRAFIA, ABARROTES, PANADERIA, PEINADORAS. EN CASO D. LOS VARONES SE DEDICAN A LA SERIGRAFIA Y A LA SOLDADURA, TAMBIÉN CUENTAN CON AUTO PROPIO DESD. HACE MÁS D. 1 AÑO. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA. SEGÚN EXPRESIONES D. TODOS LOS SOCIOS(AS) EL CREDITO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN ES PARA LA AMPLIACION D. SUS NEGOCIOS.LA MAYORIA D. LAS SOCIAS HAN TRABAJADO CON FUNDACIONES O ORGANIZACIONES FINANCIERAS POR LO CUAL CUENTAN CON EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDAR.. POR LO QUE RESPECTA A AGROPITAL LAS SOCIAS PERTENECEN AL PRIMER CICLO.
texts.en:
The members of the King of Kings Group are represented by the president, Mrs. Rosa. Mrs. Dunia and Elizabeth are sisters and the daughters of Hermosinda. Both of them have independent business, so they were considered for this group. These integral women sell food and clothes, promote Avon and Yambal beauty products, are tailors and screen painters, sell groceries, own a bakery, and are hairdressers. The men are screen painters and welders. They have also had their own car for over a year. As in the entire commercial field, there always exists the competition of supply and demand. According to all of the members, the loan granted to them by the foundation will be used to expand their businesses. The majority of the members have worked with foundations or financial organizations, from which they have experience in supportive groups. With respect to Agropital, the members belong to the first cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their operations

loans.name: Kupaysin

texts.ru:
Абдуллоева Купайсин, 1951 года рождения. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи женских платьев. Сейчас ее ассортимент товаров увеличился, это разновидность токи (национальные головные уборы), махси (национальные сапоги). Свой товар она закупает у поставщиков из Коканда и продает на Центральном рынке Гисарского района.
С помощью программы Кива хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для закупа головных уборов.
texts.en:
Kupaysin A. was born in 1951. She started her own business by selling women's dresses. Right now she has a wider selection of merchandise she offers such as different types of toka (Tajik national headdresses) and mahsi (national boots). She buys the merchandise from suppliers in Kokand and sells on the Central market of the Gisar region. With the help of Kiva she wants to get a loan for 3,000 somoni (USD$900) to buy more headdresses.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy headdresses

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es: Magnolia de 50 años, es madre de 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 de ellos ya se independizaron y tiene su propia familia, quedando solo los dos últimos a su cargo, estudiantes y la razón de su esfuerzo y de seguir adelante, esperando que en un mañana  sean hombres de bien ante la sociedad. Magnolia se dedica a la venta de comida y de frutas de la región, teniendo como principales clientes a los funcionarios D. hospital regional, por lo que ella se siente satisfecha, lo más importante para ella, es surgir en su negocio, con el tiempo ampliar  su kiosco para la venta de comida y frutas, y desde luego brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, para ello necesita de un capital, para implementar su negocio y cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Magnolia is 50 years old and is the mother of 7 children, of whom 5 are independent and have their own families, leaving only 2 children in her care. These 2 children are students, and they are the reason for her efforts and of going forward. She hopes that they will be good men in the society. Magnolia sells food and fruit in the area. Her main clients are the officials of the regional hospital. She feels satisfied with this. The most important thing for her is to grow her business, with time, expand her kiosk for the sale of food and fruit, and later, offer a better reception to her clients. For this, she needs capital to supply her business and achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and supply his business for the sale of fruit

loans.name: Jaffet

texts.es: Jaffet es una mujer muy trabajadora y colaboradora, se dedica a la venta de panes y dulces, los mismos que lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de su zona y en un puesto del mercado. A sus 28 años, es muy dedicada, por eso que trabaja duro para seguir creciendo y llegar a tener lo que realmente quiere, su panadería, ella es madre de un hijo  que está estudiando y tiene el deseo de seguir apoyándolo hasta verlo profesional. Su conviviente Rodiel, se dedica al aserrío de madera, ambos hacen de todo por seguir adelante. Jaffet quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio de venta de panes y dulces y para ello necesita de un capital para cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jaffet is a hard-working and collaborative woman, who sells bread and sweets, which she takes to different places in her area and to a stand in the market. She is 28 years old and is very dedicated, so she works hard to continue growing and to come to have what she really wants – her bakery. She is the mother of a son, who is studying. She wants to continue supporting him until he is a professional. Her partner Rodiel saws wood. Both of them do all they can to go forward. Jaffet wants to continue growing her business, which sells bread and sweets, and for this she needs capital to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the capital for investment for her business, which sells bread and sweets

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 39 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de seguir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales, por su buena atención y la acogida que brinda, cuenta con una concurrida clientela que degustan de estos productos naturales. Rosa se levanta muy temprano para ir a comprar los mejores productos, ya que sus consumidores son muy especiales y exigentes, mediante su negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, esperando que en un futuro sean profesionales y útiles a la sociedad.  Rosa quiere ampliar el espacio donde vende su fruta, y con un techo de ramas protegerse de la lluvia y el sol, y así sentirse cómoda y  desde luego dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, para esto necesita de un capital para lograr lo que desea. Con tu  ayuda, harás posible el objetivo de esta madre activa y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old. She is a single mother and has three children who are in school and who provide her the reason to succeed. She dedicates herself to the sale of regional fruits and, because of the service she provides, her business is popular with clients who enjoy these natural products. Rosa gets up very early to purchase the best products because her clients are demanding. She wants to use her business to help her children succeed as she hopes that in the future they will become professionals and useful members of society. Rosa wants to expand the space where she sells fruits and to install a thatched roof to provide protection from the rain and the sun. This will allow her to feel comfortable and to provide a better environment for her clients. This is why she needs this loan. With your help, you will make this hard working mother's goal possible.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business and add a thatched roof to offer protection from the rain and the sun.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Kokou est né en 1973 à Tékponou dans la préfecture de Vo. Tailleur de profession, il est marié et père de deux enfants. Pour survivre, il s’est adonné à l’agriculture car le métier de tailleur ne l’occupe pas en plein temps.

Mais les terres de sa localité étant généralement très pauvres, il a besoin d’y mettre du fertilisant afin d’avoir un rendement acceptable. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit. Ceci va lui permettre d'augmenter ses revenus et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in 1973 in Tékponou in the Vo Prefecture. A trained tailor, he is married and the father of 2 children. In order to survive, he has begun to work in agriculture since he is not fully employed in tailoring.

Unfortunately, the earth in his area is generally very poor, so he needs to use fertilizer to have an acceptable harvest. To this end, he is requesting a loan. This will permit him to increase his earnings and better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de fruta, desde ya hace mucho tiempo. Vende de acuerdo a la temporada, por ahora esta son frutas, sin embargo, su negocio fijo es el pescado y el aguaje, pero como no es la temporada de estos productos, vende sus frutas, las lleva a vender en su triciclo por diferentes lugares de su zona. Tiene 43 años, es madre de 6 hijos, 5 de ellos ya independientes y de familia, quedando el último, de 14 años que estudia y es su razón de seguir adelante, para darle lo necesario. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo Geiner quien es trabajador independiente y está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. Para seguir creciendo en su negocio, y lograr lo que desea, necesita de un préstamo, para así sentirse animada y preparada para continuar. Apoya a esta madre trabajadora.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hardworking woman. She is dedicated to the sale of fruits and has been for a long time now. She sells according to what's in season, and for now these are fruits. However, her business also focuses on fish, but as this is not the fishing season, she sells her fruits. She carries them on her tricycle to different places in her region. She is 43 years old, a mother of six children, five of whom are already independent and have a family, which leaves her last son, who is 14 years old and studies; he is her reason for moving forward, to give him what he needs. She works with the support of her husband, Geiner, who is an independent worker and agrees with her business plans. To continue growing in her business, and achieve what she desires, she needs a loan. With this she will feel encouraged and ready to continue. Support this hardworking mother.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase capital for her fruit business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 39 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, que son su razón de ser y de seguir adelante, 3 de ellos estudian, siendo el mayor está enfermo y no puede estudiar. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, la lleva a vender por distintos lugares, trabaja para apoyar a su esposo Jaime, quien trabaja en una institución de su zona y quien la apoya mucho en sus propósitos trazados. Para seguir viendo crecer en este negocio, ya que le es muy rentable, ha decidido alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa, pero para esto, estima de un capital para lograr su objetivo. Ayudemos a la Señora Ana con su propósito.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and she has 4 children, and they are her reason to keep going. Three of them are going to school and the eldest is ill and cannot study. She sells clothing, taking it to different places to be sold. She works to support her husband Jaime who works in a neighbourhood company. He supports her in everything that she takes on. To keep seeing her business prosper, especially because it is very profitable, she has decided to rent a stand where she can set up her clothing business. But to do this she needs to count on certain capital funds. Let's all help Ana with her endeavor.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her clothing business, especially to rent a proper stand for the business.

loans.name: Dolis

texts.es: Dolis, mujer dedicada a la venta de golosinas desde hace mucho tiempo, quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio, a razón de ser un negocio rentable por su zona y por encontrarse ubicada en un buen lugar. Tiene 44 años, es madre de 3 hijos, a los mismos que los hace estudiar a base de mucho esfuerzo. Dolis es madre soltera y la responsabilidad grande que carga no le impide salir adelante, muy aparte de tener este negocio, trabaja en una casa como empleada domestica, y a pesar de eso, se da tiempo para atender a sus hijos y su negocio. Dolis quiere seguir adelante, para ello requiere de un capital para lograr su deseo de ampliar y modificar su negocio para implementarlo con otros productos. Apoya a esta madre que demuestra sus ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dolis, a woman who has been selling candy for a long time, would like to expand and restock her business. Hers is a lucrative business because of its location in an optimum spot in her area. She is a 44-year-old mother of 3 children, whom she provides with an education after much effort. Dolis is a single mother, but the great responsibility she bears does not prevent her from getting ahead in life. Aside from running her business, she also works as a housekeeper. Despite this job, however, she always makes time to look after her children and her business. Dolis wants to keep moving forward, but for this she needs some capital so that she may reach her goal of expanding and modifying her business, restocking it with other products. Support this mother who demonstrates the desire to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and restock her candy business

loans.name: Sintia

texts.es: Sintia tiene 20 años, es una mujer sorprendente, a su corta edad es propietaria de 3 motocarros, los mismos que le generan ingresos económicos muy rentables. Ella administra sus herramientas de trabajo con el solo fin de ahorrar, para poner su tienda ropa y zapatos. Sintia tiene su pareja, Jesús, con quien vive y quien la apoya mucho, sobre todo con sus motocarros. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, pero por la temporada y los cambios climatológicos ha dejado esta actividad por un tiempo. Sintia quiere ver en buen estado a sus motos, es por eso que necesita de un capital para mandar a repararlas y así trabajen bien, sin complicaciones. Apoyemos a Sintia, joven con grandes visiones de negocio.
texts.en:
Sintia is 20 years and a surprising woman. At her young age she is an owner of three motocarts, which generate a very profitable income for her. She managers her work equipment with the only goal of saving up, so that she can start her clothing and shoe shop. Sintia has her husband, Jesús, with whom she lives and who supports her a lot, especially with her motocarts. Additionally, she is dedicated to raising chickens, but because of the season and the climate changes, she has left this activity for a time. Sintia wants to have her motocarts in good condition, which is why she needs capital to send them for repairs so they'll work well and without complications. Let's support Sintia, such a young woman with grand business visions.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts and send her motocarts for repair.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 34 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos que estudian y profesora de educación inicial, es una mujer muy trabajadora, por las tardes vende diferentes platos de comida rápida en el trabajo de su esposo Nilo, quien es mecánico y cuenta con su taller propio. Edith en su propia vivienda ha implementado un wawasi (una guardería, parte de un programa gubernamental)  en el cual cuenta con buena cantidad de niños, a los mismos que atiende y enseña. El objetivo de Edith es mandar a construir un kiosco para vender sus platillos, y así brindar una mejor acogida  a sus consumidores, para esto, estima de un préstamo para lograr lo que quiere. Con tu ayuda, se hará posible el objetivo de esta madre trabajadora.
texts.en:
Edith is a 34-year-old mother of 4 school age children. She is a hard-working pre-school teacher who also sells fast food at her husband’s workplace in the evenings. Her husband, whose name is Nilo, is a mechanic who has his own garage. Edith has set up a wawasi—a type of nursery established by a government program—in her own home in which she teaches and looks after a fair amount of children. Edith’s goal is to have someone build her a stand in which she can sell her fast food meals, thus she can better welcome her patrons. In order to get what she wants, she needs a loan. With your help, this industrious mother will reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business and have a kiosk made

loans.name: Sodohoin

texts.fr:
Madame A. Sodohoin est née en 1958 dans le village de Tékponou où elle vit actuellement avec sa famille. Elle est mère de huit enfants dont elle arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins malgré ses activités.

En effet, elle fait l'elevage de porcs et le commerce de l’huile rouge de palme. Son principal problème reste le manque de fonds de roulement. Elle sollicite un crédit.
Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et les conditions de vie de sa famille toute entière
texts.en:
Ms. Sodohoin A. was born in 1958 in the village of Tékponou, where she currently lives with her family. She is the mother of eight children, so she has trouble supporting the family despite the work she does. In fact, she raises pigs and does commerce in red palm oil. The main problem is still the lack of working capital. She is requesting a loan, and this will enable her to improve her income and the living conditions of the whole family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and commerce in red palm oil

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es: Ivonne, mujer de armas tomar, se dedica a la venta de juanes y tamales (platos regionales de la selva peruana) en un puesto del mercado de su zona, debido a su buena sazón y atención cuenta con una clientela muy selecta que degustan de sus platos. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar los juanes y tamales, para luego llevarlos a vender en su puesto. Ivonne tiene 45 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de salir adelante. Posteriormente quiere alquilar un local para vender comida regional y desde luego dar una buena acogida a sus clientes, por el momento, requiere de un préstamo para implementar su negocio con todo lo necesario para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Ivonne is someone who does not mess around. She is dedicated to selling juanes and tamales (regional dishes from the Peruvian jungle) in a stand at the market in her region. Due to her good flavor and service, she works with an exclusive clientele who eat her dishes. She gets up very early to prepare the juanes and tamales and later carries them to sell at her stand. Ivonne is 45 years old and a single mother. She has two children who study and they are her reason for moving forward in her work. Eventually she wants to rent a permanent place to sell her regional dishes and then give her clients a good reception. She now requires a loan to stock her business with everything necessary to make her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business with everything necessary to make "juanes" and "tamales."

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est un acheteur de produits café et cacao à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 52 ans, Kossi est marié et père de 6 enfants. Son activité consiste à acheter les produits auprès des agriculteurs et les revendre aux exportateurs internationaux. Il espère avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant beaucoup plus de marchandises pour la revente. Ce qui augmentera ses gains, conséquence de l’augmentation des ventes.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is a buyer of coffee and cocoa products in Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Kossi is 52 years old, married, and the father of six. His work involves buying goods from farmers and reselling them to international exporters. He hopes to use this loan to expand his commerce by buying much more merchandise for resale. This will increase his sales and consequently his profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee and cooca for resale

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Jeune dynamique et très entreprenant, Monsieur H. Kodjo s’est lancé très tôt dans une profession qui attire de plus en plus les jeunes sans emploi c’est à dire la conduite de taxi moto reconnu comme le moyen  le plus rapide et disponible à tout bout de champs pour nos déplacements.

Mais pour une meilleure prestation de service, il faut un engin solide et en bon état. Ceci dit, il sollicite un appui financier pour s’acquérir une moto à l’état neuf pour une meilleure prestation de service.

La réalisation de ce rêve lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’autosuffisance financière.
texts.en:
Young, energetic, and very enterprising, Mr. Kodjo H. started off very early on working in a profession that attracts more and more unemployed young people; that is to say, driving a motorbike taxi, which is acknowledged as the fastest and most available means of travel to anywhere within range. But to provide better service performance, a dependable engine in good condition is needed. That said, he is requesting financial support to acquire a new motorbike. Realizing this dream will be highly beneficial to him, notably with regards to being financially self-sufficient.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 38 años de edad, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo. Anteriormente trabajaba en una compañía de su zona, pero perdió ese trabajo, con lo ahorrado, se compró un motocarro, herramienta de trabajo que le es de mucha utilidad. Él es padre de 4 hijos, los mismos que estudian y son su inspiración de seguir adelante, su esposa Orfelina lo apoya mucho, pues gracias a los ingresos que le brinda el transporte, ella vende por las noches comida.   El deseo de  José es tener en buenas condiciones su motocarro, sin embargo, necesita de una cantidad de dinero para comprar repuestos y mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo. Apoyemos a este padre trabajador y luchador.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and has been dedicated to transporting passengers for a long time. Previously, he worked for a company in his region, but he lost that job. With the money saved, he bought a motocart, a piece of work equipment that is very useful to him. He is a father of four children who study and they are his inspiration to move forward. His wife, Orfelina, supports him a lot. His transportation business offers them a good income and she sells food at night. José's desire is to have his motocart in good condition; he needs a quantity of money to buy spare parts and send it in for repair. Let's support this hardworking and fighting father.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts and send his motocart in for repair.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Vender ropa es su mayor satisfacción, gracias a este negocio está sacando adelante a sus 4 hijos, Maria se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años atrás. Sus hermanos, que residen en la capital, le envían las prendas a un precio muy cómodo y en su ciudad obtiene buenas ganancias con la venta. Adicionalmente, comercializar remedios vegetales, que también le generan buenos ingresos, a razón de asociarse con una persona que la apoya en con este otro negocio. Su deseo es ver crecer su negocio de la venta de ropas, y poner más adelante su propia tienda, para lograr lo que desea necesariamente requiere de un capital. Apoyemos a la señora Maria a concretar su sueño en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Selling clothing is Maria's great satisfaction. Thanks to this business she is improving the lifestyles of her four children. Maria has been dedicated to this activity since several years ago. Her brothers, who reside in the capital, send her clothes at a very affordable price, and in her city Maria obtains good earnings by selling them. Additionally, she sells vegetable remedies, which also generate a good income for the reason that she has a partnership with someone who supports her in this other business. Her desire is to see her clothing sales business grow and improve her own shop, and to achieve what she desires she needs some capital. Let's support Señora Maria to fulfill her dream in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise for clothing sales to someday further her own shop.

loans.name: Hoevi

texts.fr:
Née en 1959 à Séwatsikopé, madame H. Hoevi est une veuve très active. Après le décès de son mari, elle compte à sa charge deux personnes. La vente du maïs est son activité. Elle achète le maïs dans la partie centrale du Togo et revient le revendre à Kpémé.

Possédant tous les rouages de son commerce, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter de maïs qu’elle mettra sur le marché. Après la vente, les bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins des personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
Born in 1959 in Séwatsikopé, Ms. Hoevi H. is a widow who is very active. With her husband having passed away, she counts two persons in her care. Her work involves selling corn. She buys the corn in central Togo and comes back to resell it in Kpémé. Knowing all the ins and outs of her business, she is requesting this loan to buy corn, which she will offer in the marketplace. After the sales are made, the profit will enable her to meet the needs of those in her care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell corn

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es propietario de un motocarro, el mismo que maneja y con el que trabajar para una distribuidora de agua de mesa. Se siente muy contento de contar con este oficio. Tiene 47 años de edad y es padre de 3 hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de seguir adelante. Posteriormente quiere dedicarse a esta actividad, pero como un negocio propio, para ello quiere comprar envases y otros materiales necesario, por ello solicita este préstamo, para poder lograr su propósito. Con tu ayuda, harás posible el sueño de este padre empeñoso y trabajador.
texts.en:
Fernando owns a motorcycle and he himself is the driver. He works as distributer of potable water and he feels very happy to have this job. He is 47 years old and he is the father of 3 children, all of whom are attending school. They are his reason to keep going. He wants to keep doing the same activity but he wants to run his own business. To set up he wishes to purchase empty containers and other necessary items. For this he is requesting a loan, so that he can achieve his goal. With your help, you will make the dreams of this hard working father possible.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire the necessary items to set up his own business selling potable water.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
Maria una persona emprendedora, entusiasta y muy trabajadora. Tiene 3 hijos: Gustavo de 22 años, casado, Andrés de 20 años, trabaja y Edith de 18 años, casada. Su esposo trabaja como operador de grua.Ella inició el negocio porque siempre le han gustado las ventas y también la elaboración de manualidades, decidio aprovechar esas habilidades que tiene para iniciar su propio negocio. Comenzó en el mes de Enero de 2000 en un mercado rodante, con la venta de ropa usada ya que a su cuñada le iba bien y fue ella quien la convenció, ya que a ella, le mandaban pacas de ropa y a muy buen precio de las ciudades fronterizas de Reynosa y Matamoros. Tambien se dedica a hacer manualidades, tiene mucho mas tiempo, desde que era jovencita, su abuelita le enseñó a hacer flores y coronas de papel encerado para el día de muertos, y después ella fue aprendiendo a hacer otro tipo de adornos, sobre todo navideños, guiándose por revistas que compraba, así que ahora elabora todo ese tipo de manualidades dependiendo la época del año en que este, como Navidad, día de muertos, día de las madres, etc. El crédito anterior que recibio a través de KIVA le ayudó muchísimo ya que pude comprar ropa y materiales para sus manualidades y pude tener buenas ventas en la época de navidad de 2007.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $325 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar más pacas de ropa usada y materiales para elaborar manualidades navideñas y tener una mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a los clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising, enthusiastic, and hard-working woman. She has 3 children; Gustavo, who is 22 years old and married, Andrés, who is 20 years old and works, and Edith, who is 18 years old and is married. Maria's husband works as a crane operator. She began her business because she she has always liked sales and making crafts, and she decided to take advantage of these two abilities. In January of 2000 she began selling used clothing in a traveling market, because her mother-in-law did the same, and had experienced success in doing so. This same mother-in-law sent Maria clothing at a good price from the border cities of Reynosa and Matamoros. Maria also makes crafts, and has been doing so since she was a little girl. Her grandmother taught her how to make paper flowers and crowns for the Day of the Dead and later Maria went on to learn to make other types of adornments, mostly Christmas ornaments, which she learned from magazines. She made all types of adornments depending on the season, for holidays such as Christmas, Day of the Dead, Mother's day, etc. The previous loan that she received through KIVA helped her to purchase clothing and materials to make crafts, and to have good sales during the 2007 Christmas season. Maria needs a $325 loan which she will repay in 5 months to purchase more clothing and materials to make Christmas ornaments, so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make Christmas ornaments to sell

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.es: Katiuska, de 25 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas preciosas, que son su razón de seguir adelante, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de jugos al paso, en su propio domicilio y le va muy bien, trabaja para sus hijas, a quienes en un futuro quiere ver profesionales y mujeres útiles a la sociedad.  Katiuska pertenece a un banco comunal, y se siente muy feliz, porque gracias al apoyo que le dan está saliendo a delante, por lo que se trazó una meta, la de construir una ramada (estructura con columnas de palos y techo de ramas) para la venta de sus jugos y desde luego comprar fruta e ingredientes para los jugos, para lograr este objetivo, esta joven madre necesariamente requiere de un capital. Ayudemos a Katiuska, madre que tiene deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Katiuska, 25 years of age, has two precious daughters who are her reason to carry on. She is a single mother and dedicated to selling juices on the streetside from her own home. It is going very well for her. She is working for her daughters, who she wants to see in the future become professionals and useful women to society. Katiuska is a member of a community bank and she feels very happy because thanks to the support that they give her she is able to advance her business. This is why she has a goal to construct a "ramada" (a structure made with wooden posts and a roof of branches) for selling her juices and also buy fruit and ingredients for the juices. She is a young mother who necessarily requires more capital. Let's support Katiuska, a mother with desires of moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business and improve the space where she sells her juices.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Madame T. Kossiwa est née à Tétékou en 1947. Actuellement elle vit à Aného avec dix personnes à charge. Mariée, elle a pour activité principale, le maraîchage. 

Ne disposant plus de moyen pour acheter les semences, Madame T. sollicite un crédit  pour acheter les graines afin de semer cette saison agricole. 

Après vente de ses produits, les revenus lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Kossiwa T. was born in Tétékou in 1947. She currently lives in Aného with ten persons she has to support. She's married and her main activity is market gardening. Lacking financial means to purchase seeds, Mrs. T. is seeking a loan to buy seeds to sow during the coming agricultural season. After selling her production, she will use the revenues to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for market gardening

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, dedicada la venta de bebidas, quiere mandar a reparar algunas partes de su negocio y de su vivienda, se dedica a esta actividad, a razón de encontrarse en un lugar turístico y muy transitado. Aparte de vender estas bebidas, también vende abarrotes y otros productos de primera necesidad. Ella tiene 31 años, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y tiene que darles lo necesario para que salgan adelante. Su esposo Roger, la apoya mucho en su negocio, aunque mayormente está en su bote a motor dedicado el transporte fluvial de pasajeros. Para mejorar los ambientes de su negocio, es que solicita este préstamo.  Apoya a Luz, promete ser puntual y cumplida con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luz, who sells soft drinks, wants to repair some parts of her business and her house. She has this business because she is located in a busy tourist area. Apart from selling soft drinks, she also sells groceries and other basic goods. She is 31 years old and is the mother of 3 children who are studying. She has to give them what they need to get ahead in life. Her husband, Roger, helps her a lot in her business, even though he spends most of his time in his motor boat, which he uses to transport people on the river. In order to improve the atmosphere of her business, she is requesting this loan. Please help Luz, who promises to be punctual and to follow through on her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her business and to begin selling a greater variety of drinks.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerzas Group

texts.en:
La Union Hace La Fuerzas is a group of 15 women looking to receive their second small loans. All the women used their first loans to start very small businesses, and so far all member have tasted a little success. With their second loans, they all plan to grow their businesses and hope to increase their incomes.

Daphne D. is the leader of this group. She was chosen because of her work ethic, and everyone in the group trusts her leadership. She started a very small clothing business and is hoping to eventually earn enough to open her own small clothing store. Daphne is the proud mother of 5 children, and she dreams of being able to travel with them. She feels that these loans are the tools that will help her reach her dreams.

On behalf of Daphne, the group, and Esperanza International: Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To expand her clothing business

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es: Fermina tiene 55 años, es soltera, vive en su casa sola, ya que no tuvo pareja ni hijos.  Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace 10 años, trabajando para el negocio familiar, pero hace 5 años decidió independizarse y poner tu propio negocio.  Fermina vende su ganado en la plaza del distrito de Taraco, los años de experiencia, hacen que realice su trabajo con muchas ganas y alegría, pero en su calidad de mujer, a veces el trabajo se le hace muy fuerte, ya que hay que trasladar a los animales, y eso se le hace complicado, pero eso no le importa, porque ella quiere mucho su trabajo.  Su deseo es ser una mujer exitosa y por eso trabaja arduamente.  Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de animales para la mejor productividad de su negocio, espera en el futuro que su negocio crezca, así como sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Fermina is 55-years-old, is single, and lives alone since she doesn't have a husband or children. She buys and sells livestock, an activity that she has done for 10 years as part of the family business. Five years ago, she decided to become independent and start her own business. Fermina sells her livestock in the plaza in the district of Taraco. Her years of experience make her carry out her job with a lot of eagerness and happiness. Sometimes her work makes her strong as a woman since she has to transfer the animals, and this is complicated. But it doesn't matter because she loves her job. Her dream is to be a successful woman, so she works very hard. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase a larger quantity of animals to improve the productivity of her business. She hopes in the future that her business will grow along with her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her quantity of livestock

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
Madame G. Amélé est née en 1954 à Aklakou. Actuellement, elle vit à Kpémé où elle fait ses activités de maraîchage. Elle compte en sa charge, un total de cinq personnes qu’elle supporte à partir du revenu de son métier.

Elle a réussi à étendre son espace maraîcher pourtant, les matériels de travail lui manquent. Elle pense passer par ce canal pour solliciter un crédit afin de pouvoir acheter une motopompe. Ceci lui faciliterait le travail et augmentera sa production.

Avec le revenu de la vente des produits, elle réussira à améliorer ses conditions de travail et celles de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amélé G. was born in 1954 in Aklakou. She currently lives in Kpémé where she is involved in vegetable farming. She is responsible for a total of five people, whom she supports with the income she makes from her trade. She has managed to extend the area she cultivates, but lacks the equipment she needs. She wants to use this channel to request a loan to purchase a motor-pump. This would make her work easier and increase production. With the income from selling her produce, she will be able to improve her working conditions as well as the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor-pump for vegetable farming

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica una persona sincera, amable y muy trabajadora, madre de 4 hijos: Fernando de 18 años, trabaja, Karina de 14 años, estudiante de Secundaria, Nayeli de 7 años, estudiante de primaria y Miriam Lizeth de 5 años, estudiante de Pre-escolar. Inició el negocio porqué el papá de sus hijos los abandonó y ella tenía que trabajar en lo que fuera para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante y por eso fue que decidió poner un negocio. Comenzó en el mes de Abril de 2001, una amiga le aconsejó que se dedicara a vender ropa usada ya que una actividad que sí dejaba ganancias, fue así como inicio, luego se empezó a poner afuera de un motel que estaba en un crucero del ferrocarril, en donde se pone un mercado rodante, pero la quitaron de ese lugar y tuvo que reinstalarse mas adelante, donde se ponen todos los que se dedican a vender ropa usada y hasta la fecha le ido muy bien en ese lugar. Además, de esto ahora se dedica a elaborar manualidades, que le funcionan muy bien sobre todo en las epocas de fiesta.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar material de trabajo para poder seguir elaborando sus arreglos y asi ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Angélica is a sincere, kind and hard-working mother of 4: Fernando is 18 years old and works, Karina is 14 years old and is in high school, Nayeli is 7 years old and is in elementary school and Miriam Lizeth is 5 years old and is in pre-school. Angélica began her business because her former husband abandoned her and she had to work to be able to support her children. She began the business in April of 2001. A friend advised Angélica to sell used clothing, as this is a monetizing activity, so she began doing so. Later, she began selling outside of a motel that was located at the cross roads of a rail-road, where there was also a market. She was unfortunately kicked out of this location and was forced to set up shop where the other used clothing salespeople are located. Since then she has been operating from this location. Also, Angélica makes crafts, which do well for her especially during the holiday season. Now Angélica needs a $325 loan which she will repay in 4 months to purchase material which she will use to repair the used clothing that she sells, and thus be able to offer her clients more variety.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair used clothing

loans.name: Marga

texts.es: Marga tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y su bebe.  Se dedica a la venta de licores en su pequeño local, desde hace ya tres años, para ayudar a la economía familiar, dado que su pareja trabaja en una zona alejada y no permanece mucho tiempo en casa.  Marga se dedica a su local desde las 6 de la tarde hasta la madrugada, ya que es en este lapso, donde existen mayor cantidad de clientes.  En el negocio, le ayudan dos jóvenes que se dedican a la atención, ya que ella por las noches debe atender a su pequeño bebe, siendo esta la parte más difícil, ya que debe dividirse entre su labor de madre y su negocio.    Marga quiere forjarse un mejor porvenir para poder ofrecerle a su bebé mejores oportunidades en la vida.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará licores, para poder aumentarla su stock de venta en su local.  En el futuro, quiere que su negocio sea mucho más grande y  que genere muchos más ingresos.
texts.en:
Marga is 22 years old and lives with her husband and their baby. She has been selling liquors from her small store for the past three years in order to help with the family expenses. Her husband works far away and doesn’t spend much time at home. Marga tends to her store from 6 in the evening until the early hours of the morning, since this is the time when there are the most customers. She has two employees who help her with the business, since at night she needs to take care of her baby. This is the most difficult part because she must divide her efforts between her duties as a mother and her business. Marga wants to create a better future so that she can offer her baby the best opportunities in life. With the money from the loan, she will buy liquors to augment the stock she has for sale in her store. In the future, she wants her business to be much bigger and for it to generate much more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incrementar el stock de licores para su negocio.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La señora Paulina, es una muy buena cliente de Emprender, trabaja desde hace bastantes años con la institución, es de clase sencilla, humilde y trabajadora. Se dedica por un lado a la compra y reventa  de material de construcción, y  paralelamente, recupera menudencias del matadero municipal para luego venderlas en el mercado campesino, dichas menudencias sirven como alimento para las familias más pobres de la ciudad. Gracias a estas actividades es que saca adelante a sus hijos,quienes estan en edad escolar, es madre soltrera y vive con sus hijos en una pequeña casa en alquiler, trabaja muy duro con el objetivo de poder comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paulina is a good client of Emprendedor Microlending, and has worked with the institution for many years. She is a simple, humble and hard-working person. On one hand, she is engaged in the purchase and re-sale of construction material and on the other hand she collects articles from the municipal slaughterhouse to sell in the country market. Thanks to these activities, she has been able to support her children, who are school-aged. Paulina is a single mother and lives with her children in a small rented house. She is working very hard so that she can purchase her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de una hija de 10 años, llamada Luz..  Tiene una pequeño puesto de golosinas de forma ambulatoria desde hace ya 5 años, con este negocio a podido mantener a su pequeña, la cual la apoya incondicionalmente en su trabajo.  Vende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta promediar las 6 de la tarde, para ganar lo necesario para el gasto diario, el trabajo es difícil, ya que tiene que pasar casi todo el día vendiendo, soportando muchas veces el calor imperante y en otras ocasiones el frío que hace por las tardes, a pesar de esos inconvenientes, le agrada su trabajo, el cual ejerce con mucha alegría y entereza.  Virginia trabaja en bien de su hija, a quien quiere brindar todas las comodidades y estudios superiores, para que pueda ser en un futuro una buena profesional.  Con el dinero que se le brinde como préstamo, comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para mejorar sus ingresos, en el futuro, sueña con tener pequeña tiendita que ella sola pueda administrar.
texts.en:
Virginia is 32 years old and she is the single mother of a 10 year-old daughter named Luz. She has had a small business selling sweets as a street vendor for the past 5 years. With this business she has been able to provide for her daughter, who supports her unconditionally in her work. Virginia sells from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the afternoon in order to earn enough for the daily expenses. The work is difficult, since she has to spend almost the whole day selling, many times tolerating excessive heat and other times the cold that comes in the afternoons. Despite these difficulties, she likes her job, which she does with much joy and determination. Virginia works for the benefit of her daughter, whom she hopes to provide with all the comforts of life and superior studies, so that she can one day be a good professional. With the money from the loan, she will buy a larger quantity of sweets so that she can improve her income. For the future, she dreams of having a small store that she can run by herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increas the quantity of sweets that she sells.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de un pequeño niño de 2 años llamado Juan Carlos.  Se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante desde hace 5 años, trabaja mucho para mantener a su pequeño hijo, que al estar creciendo requiere de mayores cuidados.  Usualmente empieza su labor diaria desde las 6 de la mañana, para preparar  el desayuno que vende  hasta aproximadamente las 9, desde esa hora empieza con la preparación del almuerzo, el cual ofrece hasta las 2 de la tarde, horas después inicia la preparación de la cena, que vende hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche dependiendo de cómo vaya la venta.  Lo más difícil del trabajo de Ana es tener que abastecerse en atender a la clientela, a veces es mucha y demanda atención, pero lo bueno es que le gusta su trabajo y eso compensa cualquier inconveniente.    Trabaja en bien de su pequeño Juan Carlos, el cual es la luz de su vida y desea brindarle un prospero futuro.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará algunos muebles, para brindar una mejor atención a la clientela y así expandir su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 26 year old single mother of a two year old son named Juan Carlos. For the last five years, Ana has managed a restaurant, with the goal of improving the well being of her son, who needs more care as he gets older. Usually she begins working at 6 AM to prepare breakfast which she sell until 9 AM. At that hour, she begins working on lunch which will be served at 2 PM. A few hours later she begins working on dinner which will begin at around 7 or 8 PM depending on how sales are going. The most difficult part of the work is that clients demand a lot of her time and attention, but overall Ana likes her job and that compensates for any inconvenience. She is working with the well being of her son, who is the light of her life, in mind and would like to give him a brighter future. With the money from this loan, she will buy new furniture for the restaurant to better attend to her clientele, expand her business, and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new furniture to improve the comfort of her restaurant for customers

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 28 años, convive con su pareja Elvo, de también 28 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a atención de restaurantes desde hace 8 años, su buena sazón la motivó a ahorrar y decidir poner su propio restaurante hace 1 año y medio, tiempo en el cual se ha dedicado íntegramente a esta labor.  Margarita alquiló un local donde puso su restaurante, trabajando duro todo el día para lograr mejores ingresos económicos, le dedica todo su tiempo y esta labor, que siente que a veces la ata sin poder salir, pero el gusto por la cocina y la atención a la clientela es mucho mayor, haciendo que pueda vencer cualquier dificultad. Margarita se esfuerza mucho cada día para poder conformar una familia en el futuro, y poder brindarles una buena estabilidad económica. Con el dinero que obtenga del préstamo comprará más cantidad de comestibles para poder elaborar sus ricos platos.  En el futuro, quiere agrandar su restaurante, consiguiendo un local propio y contratando personal para la atención.
texts.en:
Margarita is 28 years old and she lives with her partner Elvo, who is also 28 years old. She has devoted her attention to restaurants for 8 years, her good food motivated her to save and she decided to have her own restaurant one and a half years ago, during which time she has been devoted entirely to this work. Margarita rented a place where she put up her restaurant, working hard all day to achieve better economic returns. She devotes all her time to this work, sometimes feeling that she is unable to leave, but her love for cooking and caring for her customers is greater and allows her to overcome any difficulty. Margarita works hard everyday so she can form a family in the future and provide them with good economic stability. With the money she gets from the loan she will buy more groceries to make her delicious meals. In the future, she wants to enlarge her restaurant, owning her own location and hiring wait staff.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make food for her small restaurant

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María Juana una persona muy trabajadora, independiente, responsable y muy luchadora. Es viuda y madre D. 2 hijas: Paulina D. 16 años, estudiante D. preparatoria y Elsa D. 12 años, estudiante D. secundaria. Inició el negocio por L. necesidad D. tener un ingreso extra, ya que los gastos D. L. casa y D. sus hijas eran cada vez mayores , además D. que le gustan mucho las ventas y a través D. ellas ha conocido muchas personas que le han ayudado a vender sus productos. Comenzó hace 16 años con una pequeña tiendita D. abarrotes, pero después tuvo que trabajar como empleada y ya no podía atenderL. por lo que tuvo que cerrarL.. Después, en Marzo D. 2003 una vecina L. invitó a que vendiera productos por catalogo; al principio, sus ganancias no eran muy altas pero con el tiempo han mejorado. El crédito anterior que recibió a través D. KIVA le ayudó a salir adelante ya que le permitió comprar más mercancía y mejorar un poco su negocio.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 5 meses para surtir pedidos y comprar más cosméticos para esta temporada D. fin D. año que se acerca y poder cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Juana is a hard-working, independent, responsible and fighting person. She is a widow and mother of two daughters, Paulia, who is 16 years old and is a student, and Elsa, who is 12 years old and is in secondary school. María began her business because she needed additional income, because the household expenses and her children's expenses were increasing. Also, she enjoys sales, and has met many people who have helped her sell her products. She began 16 years ago with a small grocery store, but later had to work as a maid, and did not have time to devote to her store. Later, in March of 2003, a neighbor invited her to sell through a catalogue. At first, her earnings were not very high, but with time they have risen. The previous loan that Maria received through Kiva helped her to come out ahead, as it permitted her to purchase additional merchandise and improver her business. Now she needs a $325 loan which she will repay in 5 months. She will use the loan to fill her orders and purchase additional cosmetic products for this end-of-year season, so that she can meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre.  Es una joven emprendedora, se dedica a la venta de libros y material de librería desde hace un año atrás, para solventar sus gastos económicos.  Ella ha trabajado desde muy joven en diferentes labores, una de ellas, como la de empleada del hogar, pero su meta personal es estudiar y tener una profesión, para lo cual necesita trabajar mucho.  Dedica toda la mañana y parte de las tardes a atender su negocio, ya que quiere estudiar por las noches en la universidad local, a Zenaida no se le hace difícil la labor diaria, está acostumbrada a trabajar desde muy joven, pero cree que se le hará difícil estudiar y trabajar a la vez, pero está decidida a superarse y ser una gran profesional.  Su motivación es forjarse un mejor futuro, y sabe que con conocimientos, todo es posible, por ello que se empeña en estudiar para tener una profesión.  Con el dinero del préstamo Zenaida quiere comprar más cantidad de papelería y libros para poder vender y así tener mayores ingresos y solventar sus estudios con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 20 years old, unmarried and lives at home with her mother. She is a young entrepreneur and she has dedicated herself to the sale of books and library materials for a year to support her economic costs. She has worked since she was young in different tasks, one of them working in a home, but her personal goal is to study and have a profession, for which she needs to work a lot. She spends every morning and part of the afternoon attending her business because she wants to study at night at the local university. For Zenaida it is not difficult to work everyday, she has been used to working since she was young, but she believes it will be difficult to study and work at the same time. Despite this she is determined to overcome that and become a great professional. Her motivation is to forge a better future, and she knows that with knowledge, everything is possible; for this she is trying to study to have a profession. With the money from the loan Zenaida wants to buy larger amounts of stationery and books to sell to have a higher income and support her studies more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the stationary materials and books that she sells

loans.name: Ysabela

texts.es:
Ysabela una persona que le gusta echarle ganas a todo lo que hace, optimista y muy responsable. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener mayores ingresos y salir adelante, y porque son productos que tienen la facilidad de venderse y al mismo tiempo ayuda a la gente para que mejoren su salud. Comenzó su negocio hace 15 años en las ventas, inició vendiendo ropa, pero después se caso y dejo de vender, pero en el 2003 inicio como consumidora de productos naturistas y al darse cuenta que de verdad eran efectivos al notar mejoría en su salud, decidió también dedicarse a venderlos para t poder ayudar a otras personas. El crédito anterior que le dieron a través de KIVA le sirvió mucho ya que pudo surtir los productos naturistas que vende y tener un inventario mas surtido.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 5 meses para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y seguir dándoles un buen servicio que le permita conservarlos y a la vez que ellos le recomienden nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Ysabel puts effort into everything that she does. She is also an optimistic and responsible person. She began her business because she needed additional income to move forward. Also, the products are easy to sell and are beneficial to the consumers' health. Ysabel began the business 15 years ago, initially selling clothing, but later she got married and closed the business. In 2003 she began consuming naturist products and she realized that they were effective in improving her health. As a result of this observation, she decided to begin selling naturist products to help others. The pervious loan she obtained through Kiva helped her to purchase the naturist products that she later sold, and helped her stock an inventory. Now she needs a $425 loan which she will repay in 5 months to fulfill her clients' orders so that she can continue offering them a good service and retain her client base while attracting new ones as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase naturist products to sell

loans.name: Crecelia

texts.en:
Crecelia P. F. lives with her husband and 3 children in Ayacucho. She is a member of the community bank, LLamkasum, which means "let's work together" in Quechua. You can find P. at her house every day with the cows, guinea pigs and pigs that she sells, on order, to her customers.

She plans to invest her loan of 1500 soles in the purchase of more livestock. With her savings, P. plans in the future to build her own house.

loans.use: the purchase of more livestock

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa A. M. is a member of community bank, El Roble, which means "oak tree." She lives in Ayacucho with her three children and works every day in her grocery store. When her daughter,11 years old, has time she helps Rosa at the store.

Rosa will invest her loan of US$350 into her business to purchase candies, oil, crackers, and sodas. She is currently saving to send her three children to the University to become professionals and she is also saving to purchase a computer.

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Nohely Guiseli

texts.es:
Noheli es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en Quechua. Noheli es madre soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, estudia computación en un instituto, Noheli tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Urbanización Emadi, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, frutas, artículos de regalos, actividad que realiza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá cuando ella asiste a sus clases, Noeli realiza sus compras 3 veces por semana.

Noheli necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, leche, aceite. Los sueños de Noheli son ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a su hijo y culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Noheli is a member of the Community Bank Llamkasum, that means “We work” in Quechua. Noheli is a single mother. She is 21 years old and she has one 3-year-old son. She studies computation in an institute. Noheli has a store in her home of her parents, which is located in Emadi, where she sells groceries, vegetables, meats, fruits, and gifts. This is an activity that she does from 5 in the morning until 9 at night. She is helped to do this by her mother when she has to attend her classes. Noeli buys her merchandise three times a week. Noheli needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, vermicelli, milk, and oil. The dreams of Noheli are to grow her business, to get a good education for her son, and to finish her own studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Noheli needs a loan of 3000 soles which she would invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, vermicelli, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
"Jesus Nuestra Esperanza" is group of 15 entrepreneurs looking for their second small loan. The first loan was a success for this group, and each member was able to start a small business and experience a little bit of success. This second loan is going to go to expanding their businesses and, hopefully, to push this group out of the extreme poverty they live in.

MIledy was chosen to be the group representative because she has great leadership qualities. She is extremely hard working, and she is the type of person who gets things down when they need to be done. She is the mother of 4 children, and they are the main reason she wants to have her own business. She dreams of having her own restaurant and having her own vehicle some day. The whole group is ready to change their future and the future of their children. This is just the first step! On behalf of Miledy, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International--- Thank you for your support!!!!

loans.use: Food Vendor

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 20 y 18 años. Inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia y darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas. Comenzó el negocio hace 6 años vendiendo calzado en su casa y poco a poco fue incrementando sus clientes, logrando así aumentar sus ventas.

Ella ahora necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercancía y poder surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Minerva is married with 2 daughters of 18 and 20 years old respectively. She began her business to help her husband with the household expenses and to offer her children a better quality of life. She began the business 6 years ago by selling footwear in her house. Little by little she increased her client base, and was able to increase her sales. Now she needs a $425 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase merchandise so that she can fill her clients' orders. With your support Minvera will come out ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Sigifredo

texts.es:
Sigifredo es casado y tiene 3 hijos: Carlos de 23 años, Annye de 15 años y Julio Daniel de 2 años. Su esposa le ayuda en el negocio. El inicio el negocio porque necesitaba contar con un empleo para poder sacara delante a su familia. Comenzó hace 6 años vendiendo abarrotes en su casa, al principio contaba con muy poca mercancía pero gracias a su esfuerzo logro establecer mejor su tienda y hacerse de clientes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder así cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Sigifredo is married and has 3 children: Carlos, 23 years old, Annye, 15 years old, and Julio Daniel, 2 years old. His wife helps him with the business. He started the business because he needed a job in order to push ahead for his family. 6 years ago he started selling general goods from his home. At first he had very little merchandise, but thanks to his efforts he succeeded in establishing a stronger store and clientele. He needs a loan of US $425, that he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and be able to respond to the needs of his clients. With your help he will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Josefina Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella. Margarita es casada, tiene 58 años y 5 hijos D. los cuales 2 estudian en la ciudad D. Lima, Margarita vive en el barrio tradicional D. Conchopata, Margarita viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región, actividad que realiza los fines D. semana en donD. venD. abarrotes junto a su esposo, para el traslado D. sus productos alquila carros.

Margarita necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, aceite. Los sueños D. Margarita son ampliar su negocio, tener su negocio en un local estable y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the community bank Anabella. Margarita is married. She is 58 years old and she has 5 children, of whom two study in the city of Lima. Margarita lives in the traditional neighborhood called Conchopata. Margarita travels to different markets in the region, an activity that she does on the weekends. There she sells groceries with her husband. For the transportation of their products she rents a cart. Margarita needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, and oil. The dreams of Margarita are to grow her business, to have her business in a stable location and that her children are able to study.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Margarita needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Maria Nieves

texts.es:
Maria Es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga. Maria es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Maria tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida del distrito de Jesús Nazareno, en donde vende autopartes y repuestos, su tienda esta ubicado cerca de talleres de mecánica. Además Maria junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de carros en el mismo lugar. Mientras que su esposo tiene un taller de reparaciones y pinturas.

Maria necesita un préstamo de 2550 préstamo dinero que será invertido en la compra de micas, faros, focos. Los sueños de Maria son ampliar su negocio de carros, tener un taller de lavado y engrase y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a partner of the Community Bank Huamanga Joy. She is married, is 29 years old, and has 1 son. Maria has a stO. in a rented space located on the street of the Jesus Nazareno district, where she sells auto parts and replacements. Her stO. is located near a auto shop. Since marrying, Maria buys and sells cars in the same location. While her husband has a repair and auto paint shop.

Maria needs a loan of $850, which will be invested in the purchase of tail light kits, lights, and other auto parts. Maria's dreams are to expand her car business, have a wash and wax shop, and to provide a good education to her children.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in auto parts

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28975&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua. Victoria es separada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, los días lunes viaja a Chiara que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los martes a Hatunccasa, miércoles a Quishuar, jueves a Ichubamba, viernes a Pampas y se queda 3 días en este pueblo, Victoria vende abarrotes, frutas, ropas y todo cuanto le piden y de las ferias compra cereales, animales menores, queso, productos que vende en el mercado al por mayor y a veces de casa en casa. Además Victoria vende leña en su casa y también reparte de casa en casa, la leña lo adquiere en los pueblos y luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2100 dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite y ropa. Los sueños de Victoria son construir el segundo piso de su casa, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28975&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Victoria is a partner of the Community Bank "Llamkasum," which means "we work" in Quechua. Victoria is separated from her husband, in 39 years old, and has 4 children. She travels to different fairs in the region: Mondays to Chiara, which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho; Tuesdays to Hatunccasa; Wednesdays to Quishar; Thursdays to Ichubamba; Friday to Pampas, where she stays for 3 days. Victoria sells general items, fruits, clothing, and anything clients ask for at the fairs. At the fairs she buys cereals, small animals, cheese, and products that she sells in the market at wholeslae, and sometimes door-to-door. In addition, Victoria sells wool from her home and also door-to-door. She gets the wool from the villages and then transports it to the city of Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of $700 that she will invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, cooking oil, and clothing. Victoria's dreams are to build a second floor to her house, provide a good education to her children so that they can be professionals, and to expand her business.
