Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugars, rice, cooking oil, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nely Edit

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en Quechua. Nely es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos de 5, 7, 12 años, Nely vende comida en su casa que esta implementado como un recreo, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, la especialidad de Nely es la preparación de comida típica de la zona, también vende bebidas, los demás días de la semana vende bebidas en su tienda ubicada en el mismo lugar. Además Nely brinda servicios de preparación de comida para diferentes compromisos, eventos para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana.

Nely necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vajilla, ollas, arroz y azúcar. Nely sueña con tener un local propio, implementar un restaurante, casarse y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the Community Bank "Llamkasum," which means "we work" in Quechua. Nely lives with her partner, 39 years old, and has 3 children who are 5, 7, and 12 years old. Nely sells food from her home that she implements like a recreation, since she works on Saturdays and Sundays from 6 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. Nely's specialty is preparing food typical of the region. She also sells drinks. The rest of the week she sells beverages from her store also in her home. In addition Nely provides food preparation services for different events, for which she relies on help from her sister. Nely needs a loan of $500 that she will invest in the purchase of dishes, pots, rice and sugar. Nely dreams of having her own store, opening a restaurant, getting married and that her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dishes, pots, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr: Ndèye Coumba S., 50 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de TP Tackou Ligueye depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de prêt à porter (tenue homme et femme), de nappes et de drap de lit. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Ndèye Coumba S., age 50, is married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of TP Tackou Ligueye for six years. She wants to bolster her business selling ready-to-wear clothing (for men and women), table cloths, and bedsheets. Her income enables her to improve her living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell ready-to-wear clothing, table cloths, and bedsheets

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla N. est âgé de 49 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il est distillateur  de « sodabi », une liqueur tant appréciée par la population locale. Komla réside à Wome un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire par ce crédit acheter des palmier à huiles pour tirer son vin. Notons que c’est le vin issu du palmier à huile qui permet d’obtenir de la liqueur « sodabi ». Komla compte sur cette opportunité pour assurer la survie de sa famille. Dans la photo Komla est la personne située du coté droit habillé en T-shirt blanc bandé de vert
texts.en:
Komla N. is 49 years old, married, and the father of 5 children. He distills "sodabi", a liquor much appreciated by the locals. Komla lives in Wome, a village located approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, he wishes to buy oil palm trees to make wine. It should be noted that this wine is what makes it possible to obtain "sodabi" liquor. Komla counts on this opportunity to ensure the survival of his familya. In the photo, Komla is on the right and wears a white and green t-shirt.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil palm trees to make liquor

loans.name: Villa Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco VilL. Esmeralda son D. distintos lugares, algunas D. ellas son familiares, otras son vecinas, amigas. Las socias conforman un nuevo Banco Comunal que recién inicia, con 15 socias en total.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comida, abarrotes, calzados, ropa, golosinas, CD y venta D. comida, sus negocios se ubican en su casa, en mercados, algunos D. ellos son ambulantes y también reparten D. casa en casa. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles haciendo un total D. 7800 soles en el Banco Comunal.

Sus préstamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. Azúcar, arroz, carnes, verduras, chompas, casacas, polos, calzados, galletas, CD. L. socias mencionan que con el préstamo que obtendrán invertirán en sus negocios y con ello mejoraran sus negocios, surtiendo con mas productos. Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener un capital propio, casa propio, brindar L. mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Esmeralda Village Bank are from distinct locations, some of them are families, others neighbors, or friends. The members formed a new Community Bank that they recently initiated, with 15 members in all. The members have different businesses such as food sales, general stores, shoes, clothes, sweets, and CDs. Their business are in their homes, markets, and some of them travel or sell door-to-door. The members need different loan amounts like $150 dollars, $300 dollars, and $450 up to a total of $2550 in the Community Bank.

Their loans will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, meat, vegetables, coats, jackets, shirts, shoes, snacks, and CDs. The members mention that with the loan they each obtain they will invest in their respective businesses and with the loans improve their businesses by supplying them with more products. The dreams of the members are to expand their businesses, have their own capital, own homes, and proviD. better educations for their children.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Different loan amounts to purchase various merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca inició el negocio con la venta de calzado por catalogo y ahora esta vendiendo algo de abarrotes ya que labora en Tecnológico como maestra dando unas horas de clase solo por la tarde, las mañanas las tiene libres y es cuando atiende el negocio. Inicio aproximadamente hace un año vendiendo leche, pan, tortillas, aceite solo lo indispensable ahora poco a poco ha ido agregando mas productos para así tener mas clientela y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $ 500 que pagara en 6 meses para compra un enfriador para meter la venta de carnes frías, gelatinas, jugos y yogurt.
texts.en:
Blanca started a sales by catalogue business for shoes but she also runs a small convenience store. She also works at Tecnologico as a teacher giving a few hours of class in the afternoons. She has the mornings free and that's when she runs her businesses. She started selling milk, bread, tortillas, and cooking oil about one year ago but now she has been adding more and more products to her store. She has been gaining more clientele and she can offer a greater variety of products.

She requires a loan in the amount of $500 US, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. The funds will be invested in the purchase of a refrigerator so that she can start selling meats, gelatin desserts, juices, and yogurt.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María inició el negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado el comercio y para tener un ingreso propio además de no depender de sus hijos y estar ella ocupada inicio su negocio desde que su esposo vivía como estaba enfermo ya no podía trabajar. Inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente 6 años vendiendo solamente cocas frituras dulces leche y tortillas hoy en día vende de todo un poco de abarrotes y ya tiene juegos de video para los niños.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y brindar un mejor servicio así como contar con todo tipo de artículos para resurtir abarrotes, refrescos, dulces, y demás mercancía.
texts.en:
Maria started her business because she always liked commerce and she wanted to have her own income, not depend on her children, and to stay busy. She began her business after her husband became ill and could no longer work. The first 6 months she sold only soda, fries, sweets, milk, and tortillas, but now she sells everything--a few general goods and now has arcade games for children.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise and provide better service by providing all kinds of things to resupply her basic goods, refreshments, sweets, and other merchandise.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Los Dolores

texts.es:
María inició el negocio ya que después del fallecimiento D. su esposo se sumió en una soledad y para tener su mente ocupada y después D. platicar con gente, le recomendaron que buscara un actividad con L. que se sintiera productiva y a L. vez le generara ingresos, su hijo le ayudo a establecer una tienda D. abarrotes. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 18 años su hijo le dio un dinero que el tenia ahorrado y con otro tanto que elL. consiguió con un prestamista, D. ese modo compraron mercancía para poner su negocio.

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 5 meses para resurtir su tienda D. mercancía como abarrotes dulces frituras refrescos y lácteos.
texts.en:
María started her business because, after the death of her husband, she was plunged into a solituD. that occupied her mind. The people she talked to recommended that she seek out an activity that would make her feel productive and also generate income. Her son helped her establish a grocery store. She started it about 18 years ago with the money her son had saved and also with the money she obtained through a lender. In this way, she bought merchandise for her business. She needs a loan of $325, which she will repay in 5 months, to restock the store merchandise including groceries such as fried sweets, soft drinks, and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata B., 47 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois TP Tackou Ligueye de depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter des habits prêt-à-porter pour homme et pour femme de l’huile de palme et du miel et revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Aminata B. is 47 years old, married and has 5 children in her charge. She has been a member of the village bank TP Tackou Ligueye for the last 8 years. She wants to purchase men and women's ready-to-wear clothing, palm oil and honey to retail. Her income allows her to participate in the family's expenses.She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of clothing, honey and palm oil

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita inicio el negocio por que como su esposo tuvo que dejar de laborar debido a una lesión en la cintura. Ella le gustaba las ventas y la invitaron a vender cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien además de que es algo que disfruta hacer. Comenzó aproximadamente hace 10 años con la venta de los productos, primero vendía solo algunas cremas y fragancias pero ahora tiene mucha clientela y vende productos de todas las líneas, en ocasiones hace rifas, loterías y eso le ayuda a tener mas ganancias y sus clientes están contentos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $175 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir una mercancía de fragancias que tiene encargadas tanto de hombre como mujer.
texts.en:
Margarita started her business when her husband was forced to stop work because of an injury to his waist. She liked sales and started selling cosmetics; it has gone very well, and it is something she enjoys doing. Her business started about 10 years ago with the sale of products. She first sold only a few creams and fragrances but now has many customers and sells products in all lines. She sometimes makes raffles and lotteries, and that increases her profit and customer satisfaction. She needs a loan of $175, which she will repay in 6 months, to make a good fragrance that attracts men as much as women.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa inició el negocio ya que ella siempre ha trabajado desde joven le gusto no depender de nadie y aunque su esposo no la dejaba inicio con el negocio de la venta de tamales por encargos. Inicio hace aproximadamente 22 años con el negocio venta de ropa la elaboración de tamales por pedidos pero no le fue tan bien como esperaba por que la gente le quedaba mal con los pagos platicando con su esposo decidieron invertir lo que tenia pero en una tienda en la casa de abarrotes y puso su tiendita años mas tarde las circunstancias la obligaron a poner un comedor el cual hasta la fecha lo tiene da de comer a personas que laboran en las fabricas del municipio y le va bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así tener surtido en su tienda.
texts.en:
Josefa started the business because she has always worked since she was young and liked not depending on anyone. Her husband did not initially allow her to start her business of selling tamales for orders. For about 22 years, she started with the business of selling clothes for the preparation of tamales orders, but it was not as good as expected because people made bad payments. After chatting with her husband, she decided to invest what she had in a shop in the grocery store; years later, circumstances forced her to put a dining area in the store, which to date has done well feeding people who work in factories in the city. She needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and have well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Maura G. me dedico a la venta de frescos naturales y tambien vendo lacteos como ser quesos, mantequilla y quesillo, mi negocio lo tengo ubicado en un lugar muy estrategico para las ventas ya que es una zona muy transitada por mucha gente y eso hace que mis refrescos se vendan muy bien.
en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion la cual me ha costado mucho y deseo tener una mejor calidad de vida.
las mejoras que le deseo hacer a mi casa es ponerle piso y repellar las paredes ya que solo estan los puros ladrillos y en el piso solo esta la plancha de cemento.
soy madre soltera y he sacado a mis hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maura G., and I sell natural fruit drinks and also butter and fresh cheese. My business is located in a very strategic location for sales because it is a neighborhood well-traveled by many people. This means that my drinks sell very well. Right now, I need credit to remodel my house, which costs a lot, and I would like to attain a better quality of life. The home improvements that I wish to make are remodeling the floors to be made of cement and walls to be made of brick. I am a single mother, and I have raised my children.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as cement, brick, sand, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.en: "Emmanuel" is a group of 15 people, 13 women and 2 men. The people in this group are very excited about starting their own businesses and about being in control of their own future. Right now, they are all living in extreme poverty in the Dominican Republic, and don't have any means of income. They are all looking to start small businesses and change that fact. Wilma is the group representative and she was chosen among her peers to be the group leader. She is a very faithful and humble person, and the type of person who will make a great leader. She is the mother of three children, and wants something better for their future. She plans on starting a small business selling food in her area. She hopes to continue receiving loans and to someday have her own restaurant. She also hopes to open a small store as well. She is very ambitious and realizes this is her chance to change her life! On behalf of Wilma, the group, and Esperanza International---- We thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: To start a small business

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí, el señor Asunción O. se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de refrescos y comida atendido en su propia casa de habitación. Sus inicios fueros muy duros por la razón de que vendía en pequeñas cantidades pero a medida que vino pasando el tiempo fue incrementando sus productos.

Hoy en día el señor Asunción atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir las bebidas y preparar los alimentos para su respectiva comercialización y por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener un crédito y así continuar en el negocio que es su única fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Within the Municipality of Condega in the city of Esteli, Asuncion O. has been selling food and drinks for the past three years from their home. The beginnings were very difficult because his sales were weak but slowly with the passage of time he began to increase the products he could offer.

In present day Asuncion sees the need to acquire drinks and prepare foods for sale, and due to this need he seeks the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan. With the loan he will be able to continue with his business, the only source of income he has to support his much beloved family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and ingredients.

loans.name: María De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María D. es del departamento de Madriz, de Nicaragua es soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos básicos y de productos de belleza los cuales los vende en su casa de habitación donde tiene su mercadería.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el único propósito de obtener un crédito con el cual comprar la mercadería para ofrecerla y además con la necesidad de comprar los productos de belleza para ofrecerlos de igual manera. Es por esta razón que espera en Ceprodel que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria D. is from the department of Madriz, Nicaragua. She is single and sells basic products and beauty products, which are sold in her house where she has her merchandise. Today she has gone to Ceprodel for the sole purpose of obtaining credit with which to buy merchandise and furthermore with the need to purchase beauty products to offer them the same way. It is for this reason that in Ceprodel she hopes that her credit is given so that she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Freydell Silonem

texts.es:
La señora Freydell R. es originaria del municipio de Condega donde se dedica desde hace varios años a laborar fuertemente para llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

Sus esfuerzos han incrementado hoy en día por lo que ha dedicado más tiempo a su trabajo por la razón de que es madre de dos hijos el cual debe de mantener y brindarles las condiciones de vivienda digna por lo que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Hoy en día una vez más busca el apoyo en Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí.
texts.en:
Freydell R. originates from the municipality of Condega where she has worked hard for many years to maintain her home.

More recently, her efforts have increased. She is dedicating more time to her work in order to raise her 2 children in decent living conditions. To that end, she turned to Ceprodel to obtain credit to buy construction materials. Today, once again, she turns to Ceprodel for support, hoping her loan will come through so she can continue with the renovation of her house in the municiplaity of Condega in the city of Estelí

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jamilett Del Carmen

texts.es: Es una madre soltera de dos hijos, la necesidad de salir adelante y tener una fuente de ingresos la llevó a aprender el oficio de costura en un taller de una vecina, cuando logró adquirir todos los conocimientos necesarios, con la ayuda de su mamá se compró una maquina sencilla para empezar su propio negocio, debido al carácter jovial y amable muy rápido se hizo de una buena clientela, la que le demandan sus productos. Adim le financió su segunda maquina, en la actualidad tiene 3 trabajadoras, además tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, y esto le permite ofrecer una gran variedad de productos tales como: Maxi, cotonas, trajes típicos etc. Tiene casa propia,  y necesita un crédito para reparar el techo de su vivienda y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
She is a single mother of two children. The need to move forward and have a source of income pushed her to learn the craft of sewing in a workshop of a neighbor, where she managed to acquire all the necessary skills. With the help of her mom, she bought a simple machine to start her own business. Because of her jovial and friendly character, she rapidly developed a strong customer base that demands her products. Adim financed her second machine. She currently has 3 employees and more than 10 years of experience, and this allows her to offer a wide variety of products such as: maxi,cotton, typical dresses, and so on. She has her own home and needs a loan to repair the roof of her house to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Hilario De Jesus

texts.es:
El caballero Hilario L. es originario del municipio de Condega y desde hace varios años se dedica a la actividad de ganadería el cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo para mantener su hogar. Es casado y con el deber de mantener su núcleo familiar. Es por este motivo que ha decidido una vez más buscar el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de ganado y así dar lugar a la crianza de este.

Son sus sueños desarrollarse más en su actividad y de esta forma realizar más créditos para continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar de habitación. Actualmente él tiene un total de 4 créditos habiéndolos cancelado todos en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
The gentleman Hilario L. is originally from the municipality of Condega and for several years has dedicated himself to cattle ranching. He has attended to this work with great effort in order to maintain his home. He is married and has the duty of supporting his family. For this reason he has decided to once again come to Ceprodel for help in buying cattle to raise.

It is his dream to develop his business with more loans and in this way continue to maintain his humble home. At this time he has taken out 4 loans and has repaid them all in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Con un pequeño monto que le prestó ADIM esta joven mujer instaló su taller de costura en la casa de sus padres.  Maria aprendió a coser desde niña, por ser de familia humilde y pobre no tenia maquina, logrando comprarla con un crédito que adim le facilitó en grupo solidario y el que pagó con mucha responsabilidad. Maria considera que su mayor logro como mujer fue haber empezado su propio negocio ya que considera  una de las cosas mas importantes que le han pasado, puesto que cuenta con mucha clientela que esta ubicada en el mercado de Masaya, está segura que poco a poco va a poder avanzar con los créditos de adim y con montos mayores. Vive con dos hijas que le ayudan en la elaboración de los trajes, aspira a comprar una maquina industrial para dar mejor acabado a su producto y ampliar su taller es una meta que está segura de alcanzar con trabajo duro, disciplina, voluntad y ahorro.
texts.en:
With a small loan from ADIM this young woman set up a sewing workshop in her parents’ house. Maria learned to sew as a young girl but, because her family was humble and poor, she did not have a sewing machine. Through her solidarity group with ADIM, she was able to get a loan to buy a machine, and she repaid the loan very responsibly. Maria feels her greatest achievement as a woman is having started her own business. She considers it to be one of the most important things that has happened because she has a large clientele for her business which is located in the market of Masaya. She is sure that, little by little, she will be able to advance with loans in larger amounts from ADIM. Maria lives with her two daughters who help her with the production of clothing. She hopes to purchase an industrial machine with which she will be able to give a better finish to her product. Her goal of expanding her workshop is one she is sure to achieve with hard work, discipline, determination, and saving.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Julia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Julia inició su negocio desde adolescente vendiendo cosméticos de la marca AVON y de la ZERMAT, ella oferta este producto en su barrio y en las empresas cercanas, sus ventas son al crédito y por encargos. Este negocio le permite atender los deberes de su casa y la atención de sus 2 hijos que asisten al colegio. Tiene su casa propia donde vive con su esposo que trabaja de albañil y él la apoya  con  los gastos de la casa, Sueña con realizarles mejoras a su casa de habitación lo que dice que lo va a lograr con la ayuda de adim.
texts.en:
Julia started her business as a teenager selling Avon and Zermat cosmetics. She offers these products in her neighborhood and to companies nearby. Her sales are by credit and by order. This business allows her to attend to her household duties and to spend time with her 2 children who are in school. She owns her own home where she lives with her husband. He works as a mason and helps her with household expenses. She dreams of making improvements to her house which is what she will be able to achieve with help from ADIM.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Juana es una señora muy trabajadora, con la ayuda de sus dos hijas mayores elabora guirila, yoltamales, elotes y frijoles cocidos. Sus hijas ofertan en las calles de su barrio estos productos, igualmente lo hacen en su casa de habitación. Doña Juana con mucho sacrificio les ha dado educación a sus hijas, las que después de clases ofertan el producto. Actualmente tienen clientela fija, donde logran la venta total de sus productos; de las ganancias puso una venta de golosinas y gaseosas en su casa, además le ha realizado mejoras a  su casa, tiene como propósito para el mes de diciembre próximo de reparar el techo de la cocina ya que está cubierto de plástico, con el préstamo que le proporcione adim va a invertir en la venta de productos básicos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is a very hardworking woman who, with the help of her two older daughters, makes guirila (a kind of pancake or tortilla made from corn batter), yoltamales (sweet tamales), elotes (corn on the cob), and cooked beans. In addition to helping produce these foods at home, her daughters sell them in the streets of their neighborhood after school. Doña Juana has made sacrifices to give her daughters an education. At this time, they have a fixed clientele to whom they sell all their products. From the earnings Doña Juana started another business selling sweets and sodas from her home. Also, she has made improvements to her house and has plans this coming December to repair the ceiling in her kitchen which is now covered in plastic. With the loan from ADIM, Juana will invest in the sale of basic commodities.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic commodities

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This is Hassan K.. Hassan was born in Kabala some 35 years ago. He is married with one child who is not of school age. His wife sells market food at the Kabala town market. Hassan sells spare parts and has been in this business for the past 10 years now.

This will be Hassan's fifth loan from SMT.  Previous loans have helped Hassan a great deal. With each loan cycle, Hassan can buy himself valuables while paying off the principal of the loan. He has been able to buy a bed, a tape recorder, a motor-bike and a plot of land. 

Most often, Hassan buys his spare parts from the neighboring country of Guinea because prices are lower in Guinea than in Sierra Leone. When Hassan is in urgent need of parts, he must travel to Freetown (285 miles each way) and purchase the items he needs.  

Mr. Hassan is seeking a loan of Le 5,000,000.00 (US$1,200). This loan amount he will reinvest in his business by buying more spare parts. With more spare parts in his shop, he will be able to make more sales and avoid having to travel to purchase more parts.  Consequently, this will increase the amount of profit he makes. This will make him a happy person and he will be able to do a lot of great things for himself. He will be able to buy himself a house and take great care of his family.

loans.use: Buy more spare parts to add to his business

loans.name: Dios Nuestro Ayudador Group

texts.en:
"Dios Nuestro Ayudador" is a group of 10 Haitian women. At this point in their lives, they are all living in extreme poverty in the Dominican Republic. None of them have a steady income and so they are living day to day, and meal to meal.

Macula is the group representative and leader. She was chosen because she is very diligent and excited about this opportunity. You can see it in her eyes: she is ready to better her life. She is the mother of 3 children, and more than anything she want to better their lives. She plans on starting a small beauty salon in her house and dreams of having a thriving business. She wants to provide her kids with a comfortable life.

The whole group is ready to take the first step to bettering their lives! On behalf of Macula, the group, and Esperanza International: thank you for your support!

loans.use: opening a beauty salon

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: En un taller familiar trabaja doña Danelia, se especializó en la elaboración de tapetes de mecate, tiene 15 años de ejercer este negocio, ella los elabora y comercializa en el mercado de Masaya, goza de buena clientela por la calidad de su producto. No  se casó ni tuvo hijos,  ella trabaja para ayudar a su hermano en la crianza de sus sobrinos y a los que les esta enseñando a la elaboración de tapetes. Ha recibido 2 capacitaciones de adim, en autoestima y desarrollo empresarial, dice sentirse bien por que ha aprendido a manejar su negocio. Su mayor sueño es de realizar mejoras a la casa y separar el taller de la casa para tener mejores condiciones de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ms. Daniela works in a family workshop, where she specializes in making rope mats. She has been in business for 15 years, making the mats and then selling them at the Masaya market. She has a solid client-base because of the quality of her products. She has never been married nor had any children, so she works in order to help her brother raise his children, and she is also teaching them how to make mats. She has received 2 training sessions from ADIM, one on self-esteem and another on business development. She says she feels good because she has learned how to manage her business. Her biggest wish is for home improvement, and she wants to separate the workshop from the house so that she can have better working conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mansor

texts.en:
This is Mansor K.. She is 28 years of age, and married with three children, all of whom are in primary schools. Her husband works for a local non-governmental organization (NGO) in Kabala and the two work hand-in-hand to maintain the family. Mansor is in the business of selling ready-to-wear-clothes to females.  

This is the fourth loan she is getting from SMT.  Previously, she received a loan of Le 3,000,000.00.  The loan was a great help to her business and life. She was able to solve many of her problems with the profit made from the loan. She repaid the loan successfully while maintaining additional capital.

Mansor buys her goods in Freetown and sells in Kabala. It is in Freetown that she can get the best clothes at a cheaper price. 

She is requesting a loan of Le 6,000,000.00 (US$1,200). This time, she wants to invest this loan on local produce like beans, rice and palm-oil. She will keep the goods in a store and wait until the prices of such commodities rise, then she will sell them. Meanwhile, she will continue selling her ready-to-wear clothes.

Even though her business faces no serious challenges, she does have a great goal of building her first home.

loans.use: Buy more products to add to her business.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Tiene un taller que es de origen Familiar, quedó viuda y cuenta solo con  el apoyo de sus dos hijos para sacar adelante el negocio, la comercialización esta a cargo de sus nueras que se movilizan a los diferentes mercados de Managua. En un futuro quiere tener su tramo en el mercado de Masaya para así ser vendedora directa de este producto, dice que lo va a lograr ya que esta en trámite con la alcaldía,  para su proyecto familiar  necesita un crédito, para mantener un inventario grande y variado. Su casa es propia la que en la actualidad le esta realizando mejoras ya que sus dos hijos, nueras y nietos viven con ella y hacen pequeños aportes.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia has a workshop which began as a family business. She is widowed and counts on the support from her two children to run her business. Her daughters-in-law are in charge of marketing and travel to the various markets in Managua. In the future, Maria Antonia wants to have her own stall in the Masaya market so that she can sell her products directly. She is in the process of having this arranged with the mayor. This family project needs a loan to maintain a large and varied inventory. She owns her house and is currently making improvements on it since her two sons, daughters-in-law and grandchildren live with her and make small contributions.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Maria Amanda

texts.es: Es una madre soltera con dos hijos, se vio en la necesidad de aprender un oficio al quedarse sola, asistió a una academia de belleza, luego se fue a trabajar a un salón donde una amiga, con lo que ganaba, ahorró y logró comprar algunos instrumentos de belleza. Con un crédito de adim ajustó para montar su propio salón en su casa de habitación, empezó hacer clientela y a atender a domicilio, el local en su casa le resultó muy pequeño, por tal motivo solicitó un crédito en adim para alquilar y acondicionar  un local que esta ubicado en la calle central del barrio Salesiano, por la gran cantidad de clientes que tiene contrató una ayudante y entre las dos atienden el salón. Vive con su mamá, que es la que le ayuda en el cuido  de  sus hijos. Su mayor sueño es de preparar a sus hijos y tener su propia casa
texts.en:
Maria Amanda is a single mother with two children. Seeing the necessity of learning a trade, she attended a beautician academy and then went to work in a salon with a friend. From what she earned, she saved enough to be able to buy some beautician’s equipment. With a loan from ADIM, she set up her own salon in her home and began to serve her clientele there. The workspace in her house was very small, so she was motivated to ask for a loan from ADIM in order to rent and furnish a space located on a central street in the Salesiano neighborhood. Now she has so many clients that she has hired an assistant and between the two of them they take care of the salon. Maria Amanda lives with her mother who helps look after her children. Her greatest dream is to prepare her children and to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
This is Amara K.. Amara. 25, was born in Kabala. He is single with no children. Amara is a business man who sells soaps, batteries, milks, drinks, and cassettes tapes.  Some people also come to Amara to charge their mobile phones for a fee. He has been in this business for the past two years. Amara is requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000.00 ($1200 USD) to add goods to sell in his business.

Previously, he received a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 from Kiva through SMT. That loan was of great help to him. It enabled him to expand his business because€" he was only selling tapes, but now he has a shop full of items.

Amara can now travel as far as Freetown (285 miles from Kabala) to buy the goods he sells. Freetown is the only place in Sierra Leone where he can get access to goods at a fair price. 

Amara uses the profit to improve his living condition and reinvests the rest back into the business.

loans.use: Buy additional goods to sell in his shop

loans.name: Consepción Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Concepción  está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de un servicio higienico), trabaja como docente de la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce, esta clienta es una mujer que con mucho esfuerzo y empeño ha llegado a cumplir sus metas, tiene una hija, quien está actualmente cursando el quinto año de educacion secundaria, es una madre abnegada que apesar de sus labores como docente siempre ha estado muy al pendiente de la educacion de su hija inculcandole buenos principios tantos morales como espirituales. Consepcion es una mujer que posee  alto espiritud de superacion personal  y profesional,muy responsable, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que de esta manera ayuda a muchos niños  campesinos de la colonia Naciones de Nueva Guinea, su mayor anhelo es poder darle a su hija un hogar digno, que pueda cubrir sus necesidades. Actualmente habita en el barrio  linda vista del municipio de Nueva Guinea, ayuda a su esposo a cuidar a sus ancianos padres con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como taxista,ambos se ayudan con los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Concepción is requesting this loan in order to invest it in home improvement by builing a restroom. She works as a teacher at Francisco Aaron Joce School. This member is a woman who, after much hard work and determination, has been able to reach her goals. She has a daughter, who is currently in high school. She is a selfless mother who, despite her duties as a teacher, has always been involved in her daughter’s education, inculcating her with both moral and spiritual principals. Concepción is a professional and highly responsible woman with a strong desire for self-improvement. She is a teacher who loves her job because she is able help many farm workers’ children in the Naciones de Nueva Guinea residential area. Her biggest wish is to be able to give her daughter a decent dwelling that can meet all her needs. She currently lives in the Linda Vista neighborhood in the municipality of Nueva Guinea. She helps her husband take care of his elderly parents and the household expenses. Her husband works as a taxi cab driver, and they both help each other with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a restroom in her home

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.en: "Luz Divina" is a group made up of 10 hopeful entrepreneurs. They are all hoping to take out their first loan, and start to change their situations. Every member of the group is currently living in extreme poverty. None have a steady income. They are all looking to make a change, and want a better life. Diana is the group leader and representative, and says she feels ready to lead her friends in this new challenge. She is a hardworking mother, and wants to better not only her life but the life of her loved ones. She plans on opening a small food stand, and hopes to one day have her own thriving business, and possibly even her own restaurant. The whole group is ready to take this step, and better their lives. On behalf of Diana, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Food Vendor

loans.name: Romel Isidro

texts.es: Don Romel tiene 45 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte, es casado y con dos hermosos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, que están estudiando la secundaria, su esposa trabaja en una farmacia y se desempeña como farmacéutica. Don Romel trabaja como albañil, desde muy joven aprendió el oficio, el cual ha sido su fuente de trabajo, a veces trabaja por su cuenta y otras veces por contratos. Con la solicitud del préstamo que está haciendo, es para hacer mejoras a su vivienda, desea comprar arena, cemento, y otros para repellar su casa y que tenga una mejor visión como duración, a largo plazo es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su casa y vivir  cómodo.
texts.en:
Mr. Romel is 45, living in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua called Laureles Norte. He is married with two beautiful children 13 and 15 years old who are in secondary school. His wife is a pharmacist working in a pharmacy. Mr. Romel works in construction, which he learned while young, and which has been the source of his work. At times he works on his own, and at other times for contractors. He is requesting this loan in order to improve his home. He wishes to buy sand, cement, and other things in order to plaster his house, so that it will both look better and be more durable. In the long term, he would like to be able to finish the improvements to his home and to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster the walls of his home

loans.name: Mario De La Cruz

texts.es: Don Mario tiene 48 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y tiene tres hijos de 23, 25 y 30 años de edad, su esposa es comerciante y juntos salen a vender en los diferentes barrios de Managua. El negocio de Mario es la venta de elotes, creolinas, pinesol,  y otros productos de limpiezas, son cinco años de experiencias en las ventas e iniciaron con fondos propios. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en los productos variados de la limpieza y comprar otros productos para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad. Espera en un futuro poder establecer su negocio de manera formal para no estar saliendo a las calles a vender.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario, 48, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He is married with three children ages 23, 25 and 30. His wife is in business, they sell together in the various neighborhoods of Managua. Mario's business is selling corn, disinfectants, pinesol and other cleaning products. He has been in sales for 5 years and began with his own equity. He is requesting this loan in order to invest in various cleaning products and to buy additional products to offer to his varied clientele. He hopes in the future to be able to establish his business in a permanent way so he won't have to be out selling in the streets.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products for the home

loans.name: Ilva Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Ilva habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de la ciudad de Managua,  tiene 30 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos de 2, 4,8 y 11 años de edad, dos de ellos están cursando la primaria, y los otros dos pequeño no estudian. El negocio de doña Ilva es una pulpería,  lo cual le permite velar por su familia, tiene ocho años de tener la pulpería. La cual empezó con la ayuda de su esposo, él trabaja en la alcaldía de Managua desempeñándose como conductor, y apoyado a su familia para optar a otros ingresos. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la compra de productos varios en la pulpería para ofertar a sus clientes, así como captar mas clientes y poder mejorar las ventas y fortalecer el negocio. A largo plazo  es poder obtener mejores condiciones en su negocio, como mayor inventario; mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos a estudiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ilva lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is 30 and married with 4 children ages 2,4,8 and 11. Two of the children are in primary school, the younger two are not yet in school. Mrs. Ilva's business is a local store which she has had for 8 years, which allows her to watch over her family. She started the store with the help of her husband, who works as a conductor for the City of Managua, in order to support her family with additional income. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various products for the store to offer to her clients, to attract more clients, improve sales, and strengthen her business. Her long-term goal is to be able to improve her business, increase the inventory, improve her home, and support her children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products for her store

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Norma tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es soltera, con tres hijos de 14, 25 y 27 años de edad, dos son independiente y el mas pequeño esta estudiando la primaria. La Sra. Norma desde muy joven le ha tocado trabajar mucho para sacar a sus hijos adelante, su negocio es el destace de cerdo el cual inició desde hace seis años y fue mediante solicitud de préstamo que Afodenic le brindó el apoyo e hizo fortalecer su negocio, pues lleva un ciclo de siete préstamo, con este préstamo desea invertir en comprar  varios cerdos para poder vender más, y así generar mas ganancia, ella no sólo destaza, también los vende vivos ya engordados. A largo plazo es mejorar la infraestructura del lugar donde tiene los cerdos, para así también asegurarse mejora calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma, 41, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is single with 3 children ages 14, 25 and 27. The elder two are on their own, the younger is in primary school. Mrs. Norma from her youth has worked very hard in order to help her children get ahead. Her business is pork butchering, which she started six years ago by means of a loan from Afodenic. She has built her business and this is her seventh loan cycle. With this loan she wants to invest in the purchase of several pigs in order to be able to sell more and generate additional profits. She not only butchers pigs, she also sells live fattened pigs. Her long-term goal is to improve the place where she keeps her pigs, thereby assuring a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Lissette Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Lissette tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte, tiene dos hermosos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad, que están estudiando, su esposo se desempeña como abogado y esta pendiente del bienestar de su familia. Lissette tiene una pulpería y venta de variedades desde hace doce años, ella inició con fondos propios y con ayuda de su esposo. Para poder invertir en la pulpería comenzó con créditos y así ha permanecido por mucho tiempo. El uso de este préstamo será para el mismo objetivo, desea invertir en su pulpería, comprará granos básicos, y así poder satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes. A largo plazo es crecer más en las ventas,  así como dar estudios a sus hijos para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lissette, 41, is married and lives in a neighborhood of the capital, Managua, called Laureles Norte. She has two beautiful children 12 and 15 years old who are in school. Her husband is a lawyer and is devoted to the wellbeing of his family. Lissette has had a general store selling various items for 12 years, starting it with her own capital and with the help of her husband. In order to start the store she obtained loans, so it has lasted for a long time. She will use this loan in the same way, investing in her store, buying grains to satisfy her customer's requirements. Her long-term goal is to further increase her sales, in order to educate her sons so that they would be honorable men.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains for her store

loans.name: Evelyn Brigida

texts.es: La señora Evelyn, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, a quien mantiene y por quien trabaja con mucho esmero. Viven en una pequeña casa que comparte con su madre quien le ayuda en la alimentacion y los cuidados del niño mientras ella trabaja. Laboralmente la señora cuenta con un pequeño restaurante, dónde ella misma cocina y atiende a los clientes, este su pequeño negocio, es el unico ingreso con que cuenta para solventar todos los gastos familiares, además de los estudios de su niño. Es una persona muy responsable y cumplida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn is a single mother. She has a school aged son who she supports and is the reason she works so hard. They live in a small house she shares with her mother, who helps feed and care for her son while she works. Work-wise, Mrs. Evelyn owns a small restaurant where she cooks and serves her customers. This small restaurant is the only source of income she has to pay for family expenses and her son's studies. She is very responsible and dependable person.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Mauricio M., se dedica a la venta de periodicos, revistas y CDs, en la zona de Sopocachi, de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, realiza su actividad desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, recorriendo las calles de la zona. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de caramelos, en un pequeño puesto ambulante, con los igresos que ambos perciben, apenas les alcanza para cubrir con los gastos familiares, además colaboran a sus hijos, quienes ya son mayores, apoyando en la alimentacion de sus nietos y pagando algunos de los gastos de educacion de ellos. Este crédito será destinado para incrementar su capital de trabajo, es decir, para comprar algunas revistas de interés asi como algunos CDs musicales.
texts.en:
Mauricio M. sells newspapers, magazines, and CD's in the Sopocachi neighborhood outside of La Paz, Bolivia. He begins working very early in the morning, passing through the streets of the neighborhood. His wife sells caramels in a small, traveling position. With both of their incomes, they can barely cover normal expenses. They also assist their children, who are grown, in providing food and education for the grandchildren. This loan will be used to increase working capital, specifically to buy magazines of interest as well as some music CD's.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of magazines and CD's

loans.name: Jeanette Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Jeannette habita en un barrio que se llama Naciones Unidas de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, y con dos hijos de 5 y 13 años de edad, que están estudiando,  su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad. La Sra. Jeannette tiene una pulpería que  inició con ayuda económica de su esposo. Con la solicitud del crédito quiere comprar productos de consumo básicos ya que es uno de los cuales se vende más rápido y con mayor demanda, también desea captar más clientes para crecer más en su negocio. A largo plazo es tener mas inventario obtener mejores ganancias, y captar más clientes, así como poder dar estudios a sus hijos para que sean personas responsables.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeannette lives in a neighborhood of Managua called Naciones Unidas. She is 35, married, with two children ages 5 and 13 who are in school. Her husband works in security. Mrs. Jeanette has a general store that she started with the help of her husband. With this loan she wants to buy the basic daily products that sell most quickly and are in greatest demand. She also wants to attract more clients so her business can grow more. Her long-term goal is to increase her inventory, make a better profit, and increase her clientele, in order to educate her children so they will become responsible adults.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic daily products for her store

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Junto con su Hermana mayor inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante en el mercado Oriental de Managua, donde ofrece ropa para dama y niño, actualmente ella vende de manera individual lo cual logró su capital propio con los crédito que Adim le ha brindado durante 4 años comenzando con un monto de $50.00 y actualmente maneja montos de $250.00. En el futuro ella sueña con tener un tramo en el mercado oriental,  para poder ofertar más variedad  de ropa y calzado, tener ayudantes y hacer crecer su negocio. Es madre soltera de dos hijos, los cuales le ayudan a vender tres veces por semana. Vive con su mamá, en la comarca Campuzano de Nindiri.
texts.en:
Together with her older sister Yolanda started-up her small business as a walking saleswomen in Managua's Eastern market, where she sold clothes for women and children. Today she sells on an individual basis, which has brought her her own capital with the credits which Adim have offered during the last four years, beginning with a total of $50 and currently reaching a total of $250.00. In the future she dreams of having her own spot in the Oriental market, to be able to offer a greater variety of clothes and shoes, to have assistants and expand her business. She is a single mother with two children, who help her with sales three times a week. She lives with her mother, in the Camuzano de Nindiri region.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edgard Bismarck

texts.es: Don Edgard habita en un barrio llamado Villa Alemania de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y junto a su esposa tiene una hija de seis años de edad, su esposa se dedica al cuido del hogar y de su pequeña hija. Edgard es dueño de una unidad de taxi, desde hace dos años, pues anteriormente  tenía una ruta de bus 111, pero decidió vender la ruta y comprarse el taxi, puesto que esta nueva actividad llevaba a generar más ingresos. Con la solicitud del préstamo que está haciendo es para mejorar el taxi, darle buen  mantenimiento, ya que es su fuente de trabajo. Sus planes a largo son poder adquirir otra unidad de taxi para alquilarla, y así tener mejores ganancias como más capital, poder criar a su hija y darles los estudios necesarios para que llegue a ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Edgard lives in a neighborhood called Villa Alemania in the city of Managua. He is 30 years old, married, and has one 6-year old daughter with his wife who is a homemaker and cares for their young child. Edgard has owned a taxi for two years, having previously had route 111. However, he decided to sell the route and buy himself a taxi because this new activity would generate more income. With the request he’s making for a loan, he wants to make improvements to his taxi and maintain it well given that it is his source of income. His long-term plans are to be able to buy another taxi to rent out. He would have greater profits in the form of capital to be able to raise his daughter and provide the necessary education for her to become a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his taxi.

loans.name: Elena Margarita

texts.es: La señora  Margarita, es una persona muy humilD., trabaja con nosotros desD. que iniciaba su pequeño negocio, vive con sus cuatro hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, con la ayuda del esposo, que es empleado publico sacan adelante a sus hijos, con mucho cariño, desD. muy temprano se dedica a preparar los alimentos para el almuerzo diario, felizmente, según ella misma indica tiene unas hijas mayores quienes en sus momentos libres colaboran en la cocina y en algunos casos en la atención D. los clientes, los cuales son muy regulares, actualmente se encuentra muy felíz D. recibir ayuda D. los prestatarios D. Kiva.
texts.en:
Margarita is a very humble person who has worked with us since she started her small business. She lives with her four children who can be found studying in school. With the help of her husband, who is a public employee, they try to help get their children ahead with much care. From early in the morning, she dedicates herself to lunch food preparation, happily, as she indicates that her older daughters are able to help her out in their spare time. They collaborate with her in the kitchen and, in some instances, also help serve the customers who are there regularly. Currently, she finds herself quite happy to receive help from Kiva loans.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of provisions.

loans.name: Maria Tereza

texts.es: La señora S. C., tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una hija de tres años de edad, aun no asiste al colegio, su compñaero de vida se desempeña como albañil, sus aspiraciones es poder concretizar una carrera como profesional, y ayudar en la enseñanza de su pequeña hija, su mayor sueño es poder adquirir un terreno e ir construyendo una casita. La actividad economica de la señora es la venta de ropa y cosmeticos,actividad a la  que tiene 12 años de dedicarse, dando inicio como producto de la necesidad de un empleo que en su lugar se convirtio en autoempleo, y una manera de poder obtener ingresos para el nucleo familiar, dentro de la mercaderia que oferta ademas de ropa y cosmeticos tambien vende calzado, y ropa para niños, esperando contar con el apoyo nuestro para mantener un inventario lo suficientemente capaz de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes para lo cual solicito el credito. Cabe señalar que doña Teresa S. C. este seria su segundo ciclo que presta con el programa Kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. C. is 31 years old, she is single and has a 3 year old daughter, who is not in schol yet, her life partner works as a carpenter, she wishes to one day fulfill a professional career and help on her daughter’s education, her biggest dream is to buy land and build her own house. She works selling clothes and beauty products for the last 12 years, which started as self-employment when a job wasn't available. This way she helps the family income. Besides clothes she sells also shoes, children’s clothes and is looking for our help to increase her inventory and satisfy her client’s demand this is why she is requesting the credit. We should mention that this could be her second loan from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Bertha Alemán

texts.es: Desde pequeña su mamá le enseñó el bordado y desde hace 15 años tiene su negocio propio, con los créditos de adim ha logrado comprar una máquina de coser  y materia prima para la elaboración de cotonas, guayaberas y batas típicas las que vende por docenas en el mercado de Masaya, ella tiene clientela fija donde le encargan las tallas y los estilos de trajes; comenzó con créditos pequeños y en la actualidad tiene un préstamo de $ 309.00 los que ha pagado con un buen record crediticio, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales la mayor le ayuda en el bordado de los trajes, su casa es propia, dice que se esfuerza trabajando para la preparación de sus hijos los que están estudiando secundaria, ya que piensa mandarlos a la universidad.
texts.en:
From the time she was a little girl, her mother taught her embroidery and, for the last 15 years, she has had her own business. With loans from ADIM, she has succeeded in buying a sewing machine and raw materials for the making of shirts, “guayaberas” (lightweight men's shirts with pockets and sometimes embroidery), and typical robes that she sells by the dozens at the Masaya market. She has an established clientele that orders clothing from her in certain sizes and styles. She started with small loans and currently has a loan of $309.00. She has paid her loans with a good credit record. She is a single mother of 3 children, the oldest of whom helps her in the embroidering of clothing. Her house is her own. She says that she works to hard in preparation for her children who are in high school as she already plans to send them to the university.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Aura De Jesús

texts.es: Inició su negocio con su esposo elaborando calzado de niños y damas, comercializando en la zona norte del país, donde actualmente descubrió nuevo mercado con la elaboración de botas vaqueras, las que vende por docenas a las tiendas de calzado, los que al día de hoy son clientes fijos,  los fines de semana  doña Aura se dedica  a la venta de comida en su casa de habitación y en los juegos de baseball, este es otro ingreso extra que ellos perciben. Tiene 2 hijos, la mayor estudia en la universidad y el menor en escuela de secundaria, con mucho esfuerzo ellos han logrado tener su casa propia; y el taller lo tiene en la parte delantera de la casa, su mayor propósito es tener un tramo propio en el mercado de Masaya para ser vendedores directos de sus calzados.
texts.en:
She started her business with her husband making footwear for children and women which is then sold in the northern zone of the country. Recently, she found a new market for the making of cowboy boots which she sells by the dozen to shoe stores that, today, are established clients of hers. On the weekends, Doña Aura sells food in her home and at baseball games. This is other extra income that they receive. She has two children, the oldest is studying at the university and the youngest is in high school. With much effort, they have succeeded in having their own home and the shop is located in the back part of the house. Her main goal is to have a section in the Masaya market so they can be direct sellers of their footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Rafaela De Jesús

texts.es: Inició su negocio vendiendo comida  en las zonas francas (textileras), las cuales las elaboraba en su casa y luego se trasladaba  a las zonas francas a distribuir su producto, actualmente amplió su mercado a otras zonas francas y además vende en su casa y los fines de semana elabora nacatamales; ella dice que logró ampliar mercados con la ayuda de los créditos que adim le ha facilitado. Ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos quienes le apoyan en el negocio tanto en la preparación como en la distribución del producto, su mayor propósito es tener su propio comedor en el mercado de Masaya, para esto primero quiere consolidar su negocio actual y luego empezar las gestiones de un tramo en el mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Rafaela began her business selling food in the duty-free zones (textiles), which she made in her house and then took to the duty-free zones to distribute. Today she has expanded her market to include other duty-free zones and also sells from her house and on the weekends makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan cornmeal and pork snacks). She says that she has been able to expand her market thanks to the credit that adim has provided her with. She lives with her husband and her children who help her in the business with both the preparation and distribution of her products. Rafaela's dearest ambition is to have her own restaurant in Masaya market, and to do this she first needs to consolidate her current business and then begin taking the steps to secure her own stand in the town market.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients/basic materials

loans.name: Olga Muñoz

texts.es: Esta Sra. inicio vendiendo ambulante  en todas las fiestas patronales del país,  así logro un pequeño capital, con el que inicio una pulpería en su casa de habitación, posteriormente nos visito y empezó a trabajar con créditos en adim comenzado con un monto de crédito pequeño, ya que había mucha demanda de clientela en el lugar, es conocida por su trato amable y muy luchadora ya que los fines de semana elabora comida para vender en el barrio; ella piensa invertir más en el negocio para obtener más ganancias y hacer crecer su negocio. Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores los que le ayudan en sus negocios Piensa obtener más créditos para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Olga began as a walking saleswoman at all the national fiestas in her country, and in this way she accumulated a little capital, with which she set-up a convenience store in her home. Later she visited us and began to work with adim credits, beginning with a small loan, as there was already high customer demand in the place and she was known for her friendly demeanour and her fighting spirit, as on the weekends she makes food to sell in the area. She is thinking of investing more in the business to improve her earnings and make her business grow. She lives with her husband and her two eldest children who help her in the business. She is hoping to obtain more credits in order to keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Arcadia Gertrudis

texts.es: Esta señora se dedica a la actividad de repostería y  además  se desempeña en la costura  ala medida. Por la calidad de sus queques ha tenido mucha demanda ya que en ocasiones especiales recibe muchos encargos, el negocio lo heredo de su mama y en la actualidad lo saca a delante con el apoyo de sus hijos los que le ayudan en la elaboración del producto. Ella espera poder obtener créditos mayores que le permitan adquirir utensilios que se ocupan en el negocio. Ella se siente satisfecha de poder controlar el negocio y poder manejar los créditos que Adim le ha dado para salir adelante
texts.en:
This woman works in baking pastries and also as a seamstress making made-to-measure clothing. Because of the quality of her cakes, she has had a great deal of demand. Now, on special occasions, she receives many orders. She inherited the business from her mother and currently she is moving her business ahead with the support of her children who help her with the making of the product. She hopes to receive larger loans that will allow her to acquire utensils that she uses in the business. She feels satisfied to be able to run the business and to be able to manage the loans that ADIM has given her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Félix Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. Félix habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega, tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 2 y 9 años de edad, su esposa labora en una empresa de la zona Franca desempeñándose como operaria. Don Félix trabaja de taxista y también vende materiales para reciclaje. Como taxista tiene siete años de experiencia y en las ventas de chatarra un año. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la construcción de la cocina de su casa,  ya que hasta el momento la tiene en un pequeño lugar de la sala, y quiere estar mas cómodo el y su familia.  A largo plazo es comprar una unidad de taxi para trabajar por su cuenta y así poder obtener más ganancias y poder tener recursos económicos para poder terminar de hacer su casa y vivir en una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Félix lives in the neighborhood Camilo Ortega. He is 26 years old, is married, and has two children, one 2 years old and one 9 years old. His wife works in a business in the zone Franca, working as an operator. Don Félix works as a taxi driver, and also sells materials for recycling. He has seven years experience as a taxi driver, and one year experience selling scrap. With the help of this loan, he would build a kitchen in his house, which is currently in a small part of the living room. He wants it to be more convenient for him and his family. In the long term, he wants to buy a taxi in order to work for himself and so be able to obtain a better income and be able to have the financial resources to finish building his home and to live in a decent house with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Mailing Ivonne

texts.es: Su mama le enseñó el negocio de la costura, de soltera era ayudante en el taller de su mama, cuando contrajo nupcias su esposo le ayudo a la compra de una maquina de coser y que ella empezara su propio taller, por la calidad de su trabajo no le fue difícil hacerse de mucha clientela, por lo cual se ve obligada a  invertir  más y a la vez contratar ayudantas para poder cumplir con la demanda en su localidad. Vive con su esposo quien trabaja en el ministerio de salud y con su salario le ha ayudado a salir adelante, tiene 2 hijos los que asisten a escuela de primaria, sueña con tener un local  bien acondicionado para trasladar su taller  y lo piensa lograr con los créditos que adim le ofrece.
texts.en:
Mailing's mother taught her the business of sewing: as a single woman she helped in her mother's seamstress workshop, and when she married her husband helped her to buy a machine. Once she began her own shop, due to the quality of her work it wasn't difficult to attract many customers, as a result of which she was obliged to invest more and at the same time to hire assistants in order to be able to meet the demand in her area. She lives with her husband who works at the Ministry of Health and with his salary he has helped her to move forward. She has 2 children who attend primary school. Mailing dreams of having a well-equipped space to move her workshop to and she hopes she will achieve this with the credits that adim offer.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es: Don Secundino tiene 59 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, casado, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y aportan para los gastos de la familia, su esposa trabaja en ventas de verduras y frutas para ayudar a las necesidades básicas de su  familia. El Sr. Secundino trabaja desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad desde hace cuatro años, desde muy joven ha trabajado en el oficio de servicios de vigilancia y también trabaja en la construcción en los días libres que tiene. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para mejoras de vivienda en la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de su casa para tener mejor seguridad. Alargo plazo es apoyar a su esposa en su negocio para que crezca en las ventas así como terminar de hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Don Secundino is 59-years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino borough in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. He is married with children that are of age to help with the family expenses. His wife works to sell fruits and vegetables to provide for the basic necessities of the family as well. Mr. Secundino has been working as a security guard for the last four years and from a young age he has worked in the office of security. He also works in construction on the days he is free. With this loan request he would like to make home improvements to build a wall in the rear of the house for better security. In the long term, he would like to help his wife’s business grow in sales as well as finish the improvements on his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in the rear of the house

loans.name: Sonia Galán

texts.es: Esta señora empezó su negocio con la venta de refrescos ya que tenía la oportunidad de ofertarles a los estudiantes del colegio “Dulce Sonrisa” porque está ubicado frente a su casa de habitación. Ella ha ido ofertando mas productos  entre los cuales están la venta de helados puestos que un crédito de Adim; además compró una refrigeradora. Para así surtir y ofrecer frutas y golosinas a los estudiantes. Sueña con tener una pulpería, debido a su tenacidad ella sabe que lo va lograr, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo, quien ha sido muy colaborador en los proyectos que emprende su mama.
texts.en:
Sonia began her business selling drinks, as she had the opportunity to offer them to the students of "Sweet Smile" school because it's located opposite her house. She has started offering more products, among these the sale of ice-cream, thanks to an Adim credit: she also bought a refrigerator. In this way, she stocks and sells fruits and sweets to the students. She dreams of owning a convenience store, and thanks to her tenacity she knows she will achieve this dream, especially as she can count on the help of her son, who has been very supportive of his mother's projects.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora Marta Isabel Rios se dedica al negocio de venta de comestibles como lo son platanitos, fritanga, tacos, papas,etc.

El negocio lo inició vendiendo poco pero a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ha mejorado su situación gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido obtener la materia prima para elaborar sus productos. Por esta razón es que hoy en día una vez más acude a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito para la elaboración de sus comestibles y asi ofrecerlos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, Mrs. Marta IsabelRios is dedicated to the business of selling groceries like plantains, tacos, potatoes, etc.

She started the business selling a little, but over the years that have passed, she has improved her situation thanks to the support given by Ceproden, which has permiteded her to obtain the raw materials to make her products. For this reason, today she once again comes to Ceproden with the purpose of obtaining a loan to make her groceries and so offer them to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials for her products

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
En negocio de pulpería es un negocio que requiere de inversión constante por lo que a medida qeu se va agotando el inventario se requiere volverlo a llenar. En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora Martha Lorena D. se dedica desde hace 7 años a su negocio de pulpería atendido en su casa de habitación.

Sus dos hijos son el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos y por esta razón busca la forma de cómo suplir las necesidades del hogar por medio de los ingresos percibidos de la pulpería. La necesidad que ella está atravesando es que requiere el capital económico para la compra de sus productos. Por esta razón es que ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
The business of a general store is a business which requires a constant investment because of the measure of inventory is constantly rotating and requires being filled again. In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, Mrs. Martha Lorena Diaz has been dedicated for 7 years to her general store business in her home. Her two children are the motivation for her great strengths and for this reason she is looking for a form to supplement her household needs by means of the income received from the general store. The need that she is addressing is that she requires economic capital for the purchase of her products. For this reason she has looked for refuge in Ceprodel, hoping that her loan will be granted, and that she will be able to continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Reymunda Juliana

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León la señora Reymunda Areas se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y calzados en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende a su fiel clientela con mucho entusiasmo y amabilidad.

Ella es madre casada y con un pequeño niño el cual tiene el deber de mantener y brindarle todas las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es debido a que le es de urgencia comprar la ropa y calzados para la venta y es por este motivo que se apoya de Ceprodel esperando que su crédito le sea brindado y así mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leo, Mrs. Reymunda Areas is dedicated to the business of selling clothes and footwear in her own house where she attends to her loyal clientele with a lot of enthusiasm and friendliness.

She is a married mother with a small child who she has to take care of and give all of the necessary conditions for his success. The reason that she has come to Ceprodel is due to the urgency of buying clothes and footwear to sell, and for this reason she hopes that the support of Ceprodel and her loan will give her the chance to improver her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es: Esta señora vende de manera ambulante con un carretón de caballo, ella vende frutas y verduras, etc. se desplaza por todos los barrios de Nindiri, se destaca por mantener ella sola su negocio, lo que la ha convertido en una mujer muy popular del municipio, cuenta con una clientela fija la que además les lleva por encargo. Los créditos de adim le han servido para hacer crecer su negocio. Sus hijos ya mayores vive aparte son sus esposas, ella con su negocio les dio educación y el día de hoy son personas de buen comportamiento
texts.en:
Sonia engages in traveling sales with a horse and small cart. She sells fruits and vegetables, among other things, making her way through all the districts of Nindiri. She stands out by running her business by herself, a fact which has made her very popular in her municipality. She has a fixed clientele who she makes deliveries to by order. She has employed loan proceeds from field partner ADIM in growing her business. Her children are grown and live apart from her with their wives. With her business, Sonia was able to provide them an education and today they are good citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy produce.

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen
