texts.es: Cuando inicio a trabajar en la elaboración de tortillas en su casa de habitación, por iniciativa de ella misma quiso vender raspado en los colegios del municipio, su primer crédito de adim lo invirtió en la compra de un carretón para iniciar este negocio, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo el que con tanto sacrificio compro una caponera (triciclo) y presta los servicios de traslado de personas en el mismo municipio. Tiene su casa propia donde vive con su esposo el que trabaja de albañil y con sus dos hijos mayores que le ayudan económicamente con  los gastos de la casa. Sueña con tener dos carretones más para tener vendedores ya que este producto en toda época se vende.
texts.en:
Simona began working by making tortillas in her home. This gave her the initiative to sell shaved ice in the high schools in the town. Her first loan was invested in the purchase of a cart to begin the business. For this she relied upon the help of her son, who sacrificed to buy a non-motorized vehicle for transporting people within the town. She has her own house where she lives with her husband, who is a mason, and with her two grown children who help her financially with the household expenses. She dreams of having two more carts and salesmen so the product can be sold at all times.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: La necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos la llevo a ofertar frutas y verduras de forma ambulantes en el municipio, ella hace sus compras en el mercado de Masaya por docenas y vende por unidad, por su alto espíritu  emprendedor actualmente tiene clientela fijas a las cuales abastece durante toda la semana, siendo su mayor inversión los días sábados y domingos donde logra vender al 100 % su mercadería. Vive con su esposo el que trabaja en albañilería y le ayuda con los gastos de  la casa. Sus hijos estudian en escuela de secundaria, tiene su casa propia, y sueña con remodelarla en un futuro
texts.en:
Reina's need to have a source of income brought her to travelling sales of fruits and vegetables in her town. She makes bulk purchases in the Masaya market and then sells by the unit. She has a very enterprising spirit, and she has clients to whom she supplies her product throughout the week. Saturdays and Sundays are the most financially rewarding days in that she is able to sell 100% of her merchandise. She lives with her husband, who is a mason, and helps him with the household expenses. Her children are secondary school students. She has her own home and dreams of remodeling it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es: El señor Francisco M., es un cliente que tiene 63 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos a su cargo ya que son mayores, no tiene compañera de vida, la actividad eocnomica de este señor es una pequeña pulperia la cual logro poner como producto de su liquidacion como trabajador, teniendo cinco años de dedicarse a este pequeño negocio, su sueño es poder mantenr este pequeño negocio, ya que a su edad dificilmente va encontrar empleo, por lo que su unica fuente de ingresos es esta pequeña ventecita que es muy pequeña, pero con el apoyo nuestro tiene el deseo de poder ir invirtiendo mas y fortalecer su inventario actual, para ello solita un credito con leon 2000.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es:
El señor Francisco M., es un cliente que tiene 63 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos a su cargo ya que son mayores, no tiene compañera de vida, la actividad eocnomica de este señor es una pequeña pulperia la cual logro poner como producto de su liquidacion como trabajador, teniendo cinco años de dedicarse a este pequeño negocio, su sueño es poder mantener este pequeño negocio, ya que a su edad dificilmente va encontrar empleo, por lo que su unica fuente de ingresos es esta pequeña ventecita que es muy pequeña, pero con el apoyo nuestro tiene el deseo de poder ir invirtiendo mas y fortalecer su inventario actual, para ello solita un credito con leon 2000.
En la actualidad con el credito pretende adquirir productos como gaseosas, bisuteria que es lo que mas comercializa, no da al credito, ya que su negocio no se lo permite. Sus hijos le ayudan en lo que pueden pero cada uno ya tiene su familia establecida. Por lo que espera contar con nuestro apoyo en el fortalecimiento de su ideas de negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco M. is 63 years old and is single, his children are all grown up and he has a small grocery store that he was able to start with the money he got when he was laid off. He started his business 5 years ago. His dream is to be able to keep on his little business because at his age is difficult to find a job, and his little store is his only source of income. With our help he will be able to increase his business. With the current loan he is looking to get products like sodas, women’s jewelry, which sells very well, although he doesn’t, has lay away, at this time. His children help him on everything they can, but each one has their own family. This is why he hopes to get our support to strengthen his business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Yesenia Benita

texts.es: Doña yesenia V. es una cliente que tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de apenas tres años de edad, su compañero de vida tambien es comerciante, su mayor sueño es poder tener su propia casa ya que habita con su señora madre actualmente. La actividad eocnomica de doña yesenia es la comercializacion de ropa actividad que tiene seis años de ejercer, ella compra en conjunto con su compañero de vida en mercados de managua, a un costo mas bajo y posterirmente entrega a comerciantes locales de los mercados, ademas de comercializar de ropa nueva tambien comercializa con cosmeticos; en dicha actividad da incio como una necesidad de empleo y de poder salir adelante con su familia a fin de poder logar sus sueños y ofrecerle mejores condicones de vida a su familia, para eso solicito este credito siempre para capital de trabajo teniendo la conviccion que el dia de mañana producto de las utilidades y del esfuerzo de sus trabajo pueda cambiar su vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yesenia V. is 32 years old and is a single mother, she has a 3-year-old son and her life partner works as a sales person. Her biggest dream is to buy her own home, because she currently lives with her mother. She works selling clothes for the past 6 years, she buys with her partner merchandise on the markets in Managua at a lower price and then she distributes the merchandise to local retailers. She sells clothes as well as beauty products. She started this activity to support her family and improve her living conditions. She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital and in the future due to her hard work she will be able to change her life.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Yang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yang L., 40 years old, is a wedding decorator. She provides a decorating service at clients' houses for wedding parties and other ceremonies. She currently earns approximately US$5.00 a day, and her income is higher than her husband's. Her husband Mr. Senghong Bu, 43 years old, helps his wife's business. They have four children and one of them is a fisherman. Recently, Yang wanted to fulfill a customer's requirement hence she decided to ask for a loan of US$400 to purchase more decorative materials for her service. She hopes the loans will help to expand this modern business. Mrs. Yang is the group leader of three members in a joint loan as following:

Mr. Pilot L., 28, is a fisherman who has been fishing for a L. time in the Tonle Sap Lake. He requests a loan of US$200 to purchase fishing tools such as nets, traps, etc.

Mrs. Mao P., 36 years old, is a fish and vegetable seller. Her husband fishes and she sells them at a market. Mao seeks a loan of US$200 to buy a new net and trap for her husband. The loan will increase their revenue and support their daily foods.

They all live in Sarikakao Commune, Kandal Province.

loans.use: Yang would like to purchase more decorative materials for her decoration service and the other entrepreneurs in the group would like help with improving their businesses.

loans.name: Trich's Group

texts.en:
There are four members of this group loan. Mrs. Trich S., 47 years old and the group leader, is a fish seller. She has operated her business for over twenty years. She sells her fish from village to village, earning approximately US$3.00 a day. Mrs. Trich married to Mr. Set Sei, 47, a fisherman. Set always leaves the house early in the morning to fish. They have three children, one of whom lives with them and their two daughters work for a garment factory. Set is facing difficulty with his fishing tools often being broken. Therefore, he had a discussion with his wife and decided to seek a loan of US$400 to purchase more nets and bait for fish. The other members of their group are:

Mrs. Thoeun V., 33, is a fish seller. Her husband fishes and she sells them in addition to fish she buys from suppliers. Thoeun requests a loan US$250 to buy more fish to sell.

Mr. Sarat Y., 23, is a fisherman in Tonle Sap Lake, and he has been fishing for long time. Sarat is asking for a loan of US$200 to buy a net for fishing.

Mrs. Vany C., 47, is a farmer. She has a lot of experience in faming. Vany seeks a loan of US$150 to purchase a net to help her husband's fishing business.

They all live in Sarikakao Commune, Kandal Province.

loans.use: These people would each like to improve their fishing businesses by buying nets and bait for fish.

loans.name: Nith

texts.en: Nith S., 35, is married with six children living at home in the Kampong Cham province. She works in construction, typically making US$1 each day and her husband has a business operating a motor-taxi. Her husband typically makes about US$3 each day. Nith S. would like a loan of US$500 to breed cows to sell. This loan would allow their family to increase their profits from raising the cow along with their daily income.

loans.use: Nith would like to breed cows to sell.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Oeun C., 30, is married and lives with her two young children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband works as a fisherman making US$3 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Oeun C. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase more fishing tools for her husband. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: Oeun would like to purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Nem N., 43, is married and lives with two of her three children in the Kampong Cham province. Working a farm together with her husband, Morm Vin typically makes US$1 each day. Besides farming her husband also works in construction. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in the garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nem N. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase palm leaves to sell, a purchase that she believes can bring an increase to her daily income. Poor people take the palm leaves to build the roof cages for their animals like pigs or cows.

loans.use: Nem would like to purchase palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao H., 44, is married and lives with four of her five children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a farmer, typically making less than one dollar per day, while her husband works collecting palm juice to refine into sugar palm. On average, he makes about US$4 per day. This couple also get support from two of their daughters who work as garment factory workers. Besides work collecting palm juice, her husband also works catching fish in the rainy season. Mao would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase more fishing tools for her husband to catch more fish. (Mao's husband is pictured.)

loans.use: Mao would like to purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song V., 34, is a good housewife who stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. Her husband works as a construction worker and makes US$10 each day; he has been doing this work since 1995. This couple has five children and all of them are students. Song would like to take out a loan of US$1200 for her husband to  get the commission to build a road. He will use this money to purchase gas and other construction tools.

loans.use: Song would like to help her husband build a road.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en: Mrs. Nen Y., 39, is a widow selling fish such as dried fish, smoked fish and fish-paste in the Kompong Tom Market. She is doing well by purchasing fish from a supplier to sell retail in the market. Nen has five children, four of whom are students while her eldest daughter Mrs. Sreymom Chi, 19, is married and helps her business. Nen requests a loan of US$400 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for easier transportation and will use the rest of the loan to expand the business. They all live in Compongkrobav Commune, Kompong Tom Province. (Nen is so busy, so we just took a picture of her daughter and her son-in-law.)

loans.use: Nen would like to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to improve her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem R., 50, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works selling palm juice to the people in the village to earn a living and is able to make about US$2 each day, while her husband is a farmer. Farming is hard as the weather conditions are bad and inflation caused the prices of goods to skyrocket. Fertilizers, seed and gas are extremely expensive. This couple has six children, one of whom is married and no longer lives at home, while two are employed and two others are students. Nhem R. would like to take out a loan of US$900 to purchase fertilizers and bean seeds for her husband to grow.

loans.use: Nhem would like to purchase fertilizers and bean seeds.

loans.name: Sup

texts.en: Sup S., 54, is married and lives with his wife in Battambong, Cambodia. Selling fish, he makes US$6 each day and his wife sells traditional medicine making US$3 each day. This couple has six children, four of whom are students and two of whom are employed. Sup S. is asking for a loan of US$700 to increase amount of fish he has to sell. He sees this purchase as a good investment to expand his business and he is confident it will increase his income.

loans.use: Sup would like to increase the number of fish he has to sell.

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm P., 48, is a widow who lives with six of her children. She sells lotus stems in the Battambong province, typically making US$3 each day. She is also supported by her children who work and sell lotus stems and its flowers with her. She would like to ask for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport the lotus to sell.

loans.use: Morm would like to purchase a motorbike to transport lotus to sell.

loans.name: Tet's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loA. for three members and Mrs. Tet A. is the group leader. Tet, 39, is a farmer growing rice on her farmland with a lot of experience. Normally, CambodiA. people begin to do farming in July and grow until October every year. Her husband, Mr. Chhaya Rut, 47, is a fishermA.. She has six children, one of whom is married and left home to live independently, and four other children are single; two are construction workers and one is in school. For another source of income, Tet needs a loA. of US$350 to purchase twenty piglets to breed and the period of breeding is around four months when she cA. sell them.

The other members of Tet's group are:

Mrs. Sar V. is a grocery seller. She requested a loA. of US$200 to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mrs. Phon N. is a farmer. She requested a loA. of US$350 to purchase pigs to breed for another source of income.

These women live in Khna Sanday Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: These women would like to purchase piglets to breed and groceries to sell for their small businesses.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three members and Mrs. Leap C. is the group leader. Leap is 48 years old and a vegetable grower. She started her work in early 2008 behind her home and will sell her vegetables after 3 months' time when they are grown. Leap has two children whom are married and have left home. She lives with her husband Mr. L. Kun, 43. Leap lacks capital for increasing her vegetable crop. So she decided to request a loan of US$100 to purchase fertilizer to use for her vegetables.

Mrs. Chreup D. is 40 years old. She is working in her village growing vegetables. Chreup needs to ask for US$50 to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables.

Mrs. Nun L., 29 is also a vegetable grower. She seeks a loan of US$25 to buy fertilizer for her vegetable crop. They all live in Kantang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: These women would each like to purchase fertilizer to grow their vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen Tariq Masih's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the wife of T. M. and lives in a small neighborhood named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. All of her children are in kindergarten. Nasreen baji's husband is a blacksmith. He makes iron boxes and door locks. He learned this art from his brother and started this work 15 years back. Nasreen baji is a housewife and also sews clothes for her neighbors. She charges $1 for one dress. Nasreen baji completed her education through10th standard [grade]. She dreams to see her children in good conditions. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more iron to expand her husband's business.

Nasreen baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to complete her customers’ orders. Gogi baji wants a loan to buy electronic items (particularly televisions) to sell them on installments.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for her husband to make more iron boxes and door locks

loans.name: Ulugbeck

texts.en:
A. Ulugbeck has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, but he has already shown reliability and experience. He trusts the MicroInvest loan process. He is married and has 3 children. Mr. Ulugbeck is engaged in the family livestock business. He has one bull, one milk cow, and 6 rams. Mr. A. Ulugbeck has the appropriate skills as he took care of home animals from his early years, helping his father in livestock.

Mr. A. Ulugbeck also works as a private taxi driver, but the general family income depends on the livestock business. His wife makes sour milk products and trades it in the local bazaar. Mr. A. Ulugbeck has applied to KIVA for financial support, and asks for a business development loan of 2200 STJ for 3 months, to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: to purchase one more milk cow

loans.name: Cheema's Group

texts.en:
Cheema baji is the wife of P. M. and lives in a small area called Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son works in a factory. The next one has a food business. Her youngest son is a sweeper by profession.

Cheema baji's husband has a government job and he also has a part-time work selling artificial jewelry sets in markets. He has been in the jewelry-selling business for the last 3 years. Cheema baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more artificial jewelry sets for her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Sarafeen baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transporting loads. Zahida baji and Shahida baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Fazilat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more matching sets of jewelry

loans.name: Mamura

texts.en:
B. Mamura was born in 1976 in the Spitamen region. She is married and has one child. Mrs. B. Mamura has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. She applied first for a business development loan, and thanks to that loan, her business terms improved significantly. Now she has a trade outlet in the central bazaar selling food products.

Mrs.Kulieva has been in the business for 5 years. She has a good assortment (meat products, milk-sour products, sweets, vegetable oil, etc.). Working in the bazaar, she meets strong competition, so Mrs. B. Mamura has applied to KIVA for a business development loan in the sum of 2600 STJ for 4 months, to buy a new refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Ketut Ranten

texts.id: Keseharian yang hanya tinggal di pedesaan yang berada di kaki bukit membuat Gusti Ayu Ketut Ranten mengandalkan hasil dari mengolah ladang bersama suaminya. Itupun hasilnya tidak seberapa besar dibandingkan dengan kebutuhan yang harus ditanggung setiap hari di keluarganya. Termasuk juga menanggung kedua anaknya yang masih sekolah di SMA dan SD. Dengan modal awal Rp.1000.000,- Gusti Ayu membuka warung di rumahnya yang menjual beberapa kebutuhan pokok serta makanan dan minuman. Gusti Ayu berharap bisa mendapatkan penghasilan tambahan dari usaha yang sudah ditekuninya hampir 2 tahun itu. Tetapi karena keterbatasan modal membuat usaha warungnya tidak berkembang dengan baik. Setelah mendapatkan penjelasan dari Staf DINARI tentang program yang mengembangkan usaha untuk masyarakat kecil, akhirnya Gusti Ayu memutuskan untuk meminjam modal ke DINARI melalui program Tempek. Pinjaman ini merupakan yang pertama bagi Gusti Ayu dan jangka waktunya adalah selama 12 bulan. Pembayaran dilakukan dengan cara mencicil setiap bulannya. Dengan modal yang dipunyai sekarang Gusti Ayu mampu menambah omset barang dagangannya menjadi lebih lengkap. Para pelanggannya yang berasal dari sekitar rumah Gusti Ayu pun semakin ramai karena barang-barang kebutuhan yang dijual sudah tersedia lengkap dan tidak perlu harus mencari jauh ke tempat lainnya. Hasil yang didapat dari usaha warungnya ini lumayan besar, setelah dipotong pembayaran ke DINARI setiap bulannya Gusti Ayu bisa meraup keuntungan mencapai Rp.200.000,-. Tentunya hasil ini sangat membantu perekonomian keluarga Gusti Ayu serta mampu memenuhi biaya sekolah kedua anaknya.
texts.en:
As villagers who live in a village on a downhill, Gusti Ayu Ketut Ranten and her husband count on their garden products to fulfill their daily need but the income earned from gardening has never been enough, including to fund their 2 children in studying in elementary and high school level. With Rp 1,000,000 as initial capital, Gusti Ayu started to open a small grocery store in their house. Gusti Ayu hopes that she will be able to earn additional income from her business that has been running for about 2 years. Gusti Ayu realizes that the limited capital prohibit her from expanding the business. After attending a short presentation on small enterprise development from DINARI, Gusti Ayu decided to propose loan from them through Tempek Program. The loan will be the first for her, that will be paid 12 months with monthly installment. With this additional capital, Gusti Ayu will be able to add the number and the varieties of goods she sell that she is sure her customer will be increase because they do not have to look for goods that they need to other store. The income from her grocery store is quite good. After deduction of monthly installment, Gusti Ayu will earn Rp 200,000 that will be used to help fulfilling their family daily needs and supporting their children to study.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number and varieties of goods sold

loans.name: Kosar Irshad Masih's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of I. M. and lives in a small area named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 25 years. She is the mother of three sons. None of her sons got an education. They all are working in a factory. Kosar baji's husband is a blacksmith and makes different things, such as iron boxes and door locks. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Kosar baji is a sweeper in a local school in her community. She has been working in this school for the last two years. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy iron to expand her husband's business.

Kosar baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Shaila baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Sofia baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mafia baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron to expand her husband's blacksmith business

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
B. Naimjon is 30 years old. He lives in the Spitamen region and is married. Mr. B. Naimjon is a very hard-working man with a good reputation among neighbors and colleagues. Mr. B. Naimjon has a livestock business, also selling onions and rices through his life. He works also as semiskilled worker.

Mr. B. Naimjon has applied for a KIVA loan for the business development. He's asking for a loan of 2800 STJ for 4 months for livestock business support. He wants to buy rams, to permit him in the future to open a new business in wool manufacturing. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: livestock business support

loans.name: Manzurahon

texts.ru:
Муйдинова Манзурахон, 1964 года рождения. Она замужем и у нее 2 детей. От матери ей в наследство осталась швейная машинка, которая является необходимым в личной жизни. Она вспоминая слова своей матери «женщина должна уметь шить» решила развивать свои способности в шитье. И начала свой бизнес с шитья национальной одежды. Развивая свой бизнес часть своего жилого дома Манзурахон переоборудовала под швейный цех и установила там 6 швейных машинок.
Теперь она кроме шитья национальной одежды занимается вышивкой и набивкой цветных узоров на материях и одежде. Хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для закупа сырья: нить, материал, хлопок-волокно и другие принадлежности.
texts.en:
M. Manzurahon was born in 1964. She is married and has two children. She inherited a sewing machine from her mother which has been a necessity in her life. By remembering her mother's words "a woman must know how to sew" she decided to develop her skills in sewing. She started her own business by making national Tajik dresses. To develop her business Manzurahon has reconstructed part of her house to make a sewing shop where she installed six sewing machines.

Right now, besides making national clothes, she also does embroidery and printing of colorful designs on fabrics and clothes. She wants to receive a loan for 4,000 somoni (USD$1,200) to buy raw materials: thread, fabrics, cotton fiber and other supplies.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials: thread, fabrics, cotton fiber

loans.name: Ni Ketut Lantri

texts.id: Usaha ini memang sudah ditekuni Ketut Lantri dari sebelum ia menikah. Sebab tinggal di pedesaan jadi ia harus memaksimalkan apapun yang dihasilkan dari kebun yang ada di pedesaan. Termasuk dengan memanfaatkan daun kelapa yang dipakai untuk bahan membuat tempat banten yang biasa digunakan pada setiap upacara keagamaan di Bali. Disamping membuat sendiri di rumahnya, Ketut juga membeli hasil pekerjaan dari orang lain yang kemudian akan dijualnya di pasar tradisional. Karena keterbatasan modal Ketut tidak bisa mengambil barang jualan berupa tempat banten ini dalam jumlah besar padahal disekitarnya banyak sekali yang membuatnya dan perlu dipasarkan. Akhirnya Ketut memberanikan diri untuk meminjam ke DINARI lewat program Tempek dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan serta pembayaran dilakukan mencicil setiap bulannya sehingga modal usahanya jual beli tempat banten ini bertambah dan bisa menampung lebih banyak untuk dipasarkan. Untuk satu ikat tempat banten dengan isi 50 biji biasanya dibeli oleh Ketut seharga Rp.7000,- dan kemudian dijualnya seharga Rp.10.000,- di pasar. Harga ini tergantung dari banyaknya hari raya dan upacara keagamaan. Kalau memang sedang musim yang baik untuk upacara keagamaan, harganya akan naik. Hasil yang diperoleh Ketut dari usahanya ini sangatlah lumayan, mampu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya serta membantu suaminya yang sebagai peladang dan menanggung satu orang anaknya yang masih belum bekerja tetap.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Lantri has started to produce "banten" plate, a plate to put Balinese ceremonial offering knitted from coconut leave, since she was still single. She produces them by making use of those from gardens in her village. She also purchase finished "banten" plate from her neighbors and sell them in the traditional market nearby. For 50 pieces, she should pay Rp 7,000, and will sell them for Rp 10,000. The price is varied, according to the frequency of the ceremonials. The more frequent, the more expensive the price will be. "Banten" plate production number in Ketut Lantri village is quite big, but she cannot trade more because of the limited capital she has. Thereby she proposes a 12 months loan form DINARI through Tempek Program to boost her business. She will pay the installment monthly. Ketut Lantri earns quite good income from the business. She uses it to fulfill their family daily needs to help her husband who is a farmer, and to support their only child who has not had a permanent job.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the capital

loans.name: Aly

texts.en:
G. Aly is an active client of MicroInvest who trusts the MicroInvest loan process. He has applied for a business development loan. Mr. G. Aly is married and has 2 children. He does not have a good education but he is very experienced in the livestock business. Mr. G. Aly has a dream that his children will get a good education. He is ready to work day and night to realize that dream.

He is engaged in the family business of livestock, agricultural, and selling rice. He also works in the collective farm as a bookkeeper. Now Mr. G. Aly asks for a business support loan of 4000 STJ to buy a pedigree bull. He appreciates his gratuity to KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipa K., a resident of Sanepa, Lalitpur, opened her grocery shop a year ago to improve the living standard of her family. Assisted by all members of her family, she sells a variety of grocery items such as rice, maize, biscuits and snacks in her shop.

Now Mrs. K. is requesting a loan to buy more grocery goods for her shop, planning to spend any increase in income helping her husband to improve the quality of life of her family. Mrs. Dipa K., lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law and her husband, Mr. Amit K., who works in a private office.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita K. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur with her husband. Sanepa is a developing town in Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are work in small businesses. 
Both Mrs. and Mr. K. work in their own grocery store. Their grocery store opened four months ago. They sell different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks, etc in their shop. 
In Nepal, people celebrate Dashain and Tihar in this coming month. Dashai and Tihar are the main festivals celebrated in Nepal. The demand for goods is continuously increasing. So to meet the demand of their customers Mrs. K. is asking for $205 loan to buy various types of grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Ni Komang Suarmi

texts.id: Sudah hampir 10 tahun Komang Suarmi menekuni usahanya mengelola warung di rumahnya sendiri. Dengan mulai berjualan dari jam 07.00 pagi hingga jam 09.00 malam dengan menjual berbagai kebutuhan pokok serta makanan dan minuman. Modal awal yang dipakai Komang untuk memulai usahanya ini sekitar Rp.1000.000,- dan memang dirasakan sangat kurang karena barang-barang dagangan yang dijual hanya berkisar itu-itu saja. Untuk meningkatkan hasil dari usahanya ini sehingga paling tidak mampu membantu suami yang hanya sebagai petani akhirnya Komang bertekad untuk menambah modal usahanya dengan meminjam ke DINARI melalui program Tempek. Pinjaman dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan dan pembayaran cicilan setiap bulan ini akan dipakai untuk menambah omset barang dagangan yang akan dikembangkannya kearah penjualan barang-barang pokok kebutuhan dapur. Para pelanggan pun bertambah karena semakin lengkapnya barang dagangan di warung Komang Suarmi. Keuntungan bersih yang diperoleh setiap bulannya hampir Rp.300.000,- dan hal ini sangat membantu Komang dan suaminya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari serta menyekolahkan anaknya di bangku SD disamping juga memenuhi kebutuhan anak keduanya yang masih bayi. Kerjasama dengan DINARI meskipun baru pertama kali tetapi dirasakan sangat membantu meningkatkan taraf kehidupan dari Komang Suarmi.
texts.en:
It has almost been 10 years since Komang Suarmi running her small grocery store in her house. She sells various goods, food and beverages, and opens the store at 7.00 am until 9.00 pm. The initial capital outlaid for the business was Rp 1,000,000. Komang Suarmi realizes that there should be more amounts deployed, so that goods sold can be more in number and varieties, but it was all they had. To improve her grocery store that will help her husband who is only a farmer in fulfilling their daily needs, Komang propose to earn loan from DINARI through Tempek Program. Komang will use the 12 months loan with monthly installment to increase the number and the variety of goods sold, especially the variety of seasonings and kitchen materials. Komang is sure that the more variety her grocery store provides, the more customer will shop, and the more she will earn. Komang is able to earn Rp 300,000 a month from the store. The income is really usefull, especially to help her husband to fulfill their family daily needs and to fund their child’s tuition fee, as well as to raise their toddler. The first cooperation with DINARI will be very helpful to Komang Suarmi and her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number and varieties of goods sold

loans.name: Abdumajod

texts.en: D. Abdumajod lives in the Nausky region. He is married and has 4 children. He decided to apply to MicroInvest because he heard many successful stories from friends about people developing and improving their businesses thanks to MicroInvest loans.  D. raises livestock. It is the family business. He has the appropriate knowledge and skills because he taken care of cows from early childhood, helping his father at the farm, raising and selling livestock. D. wants to build a new cowshed and asks KIVA for a business support loan of 3200 STJ for 4 months. He thanks KIVA for its work and support.

loans.use: to build the new cowshed

loans.name: Shakoora's Group

texts.en:
Shakoora Baji, the wife of N. M., lives in a small area named Bund Road of Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 25 years. She is the mother of one son. Her son is one year old and his name is Hanka. Shakoora Baji's husband has a fruit selling business. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. Shakooran Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bushra Baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Syeda Baji wants a loan to buy plumbing supplies (taps, pipes) to resell. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell. Bushra Baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Sita

texts.en: Mrs. Sita K. is a 42 years old woman that lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Her husband's name is Thulo Kancha, and his profession is farming. She has three sons all of which are engaged in raising cows for work. Mrs. Sita and her children have been selling cow’s milk for the past seven years. They are running their business under the bridge of Baghmati river. She already owns 18 cows and hopes to own more in the future. She has been selling cow’s milk in local neighborhoods. Cow’s milk has become a delicacy in Nepal so demand for milk is becoming increasing high. Her request for the first loan of $205.00 to buy medicine and food grains for the cows in order to keep her cows in good health.

loans.use: To buy medicine and food grains for cows

loans.name: Ni Luh Putu Supartini

texts.id: Meskipun tergolong ibu yang masih muda tetapi Putu Supartini sangat tekun menggeluti usaha membuat tempat banten atau di Bali biasa disebut Mejejaitan untuk upacara keagamaan. Usaha yang ditekuni sejak masih remaja ini awalnya hanya untuk dipasarkan disekitarnya saja tetapi lama-kelamaan karena banyak yang memerlukan bantuan untuk dipasarkan lebih luas akhirnya dengan modal hanya Rp.500.000,- awalnya, Putu menampung hasil karya dari para tetangganya dan kemudian dijualnya di pasar tradisional kota. Per ikatnya Putu biasanya membeli seharga Rp.7000,- dan kemudian dijualnya di pasar seharga Rp.10.000,- sampai Rp.15.000,- tergantung situasi banyaknya upacara yang terselenggara. Dengan pinjaman modal dari DINARI melalui program Tempek, Putu mampu meningkatkan omset jual beli tempat bantennya dengan cara mengambil hasil karya sampai keluar dari desanya dan memang sudah menjadi langganan tetap dari Putu. Pinjaman ini berjangka waktu selama 12 bulan dengan pengembalian dicicil setiap bulannya. Dengan bertambahnya modal tentunya hasil penjualannya juga bertambah dan keuntungan yang didapatpun lumayan besar sehingga dapat membantu suaminya yang hanya mengandalkan hasil dari kebun yang diolahnya. Keuntungan ini sedikit demi sedikit ditabung untuk keperluan anaknya nanti karena memang sekarang Putu masih belum dikaruniai seorang anak. Program DINARI ini sangat penting pengaruhnya terhadap taraf ekonomi keluarga Putu Supartini untuk mencukupi biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari yang dirasakan semakin tinggi saja.
texts.en:
Even though Putu Supartini is still young, she is very keen in running her small business: “Mejejaitan” production. “Mejejaitan” is a plate to put Balinese ceremonial offering (“Banten”), knitted from coconut leaves. Putu Supartini has started her business since she was very young. She started to produce “Mejejaitan” by her own, and market her product to her neighbor, but then because of the increasing demand, she started to need helpers. With Rp 500,000 at the beginning, she purchased finished “Mejejaitan” from her neighbor, and then sell them in the nearby traditional market. Putu pays Rp 7,000 for a bunch of “Mejejaitan”, and sell it for Rp 10,000 up to Rp 15,000, according to the ceremonial session. With loan from DINARI through Tempek Program, Putu was able to increase her revenue. The loan is a 12 months loan with monthly installment. With higher capital, Putu Supartini is able to earn more income that she is able to help her husband, a farmer who only count on the result of their garden, to fulfill their family’s daily needs. Right now Putu Supartini and her husband have not had any children yet, but they are saving some of their income to be able to fund their children’s tuition fee in the future. Loan from DINARI through Tempek Program is very important for Putu Supartini’s economics to fulfill her family daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the capital to increase revenue

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en: Mrs. Lalita S. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur.  Sanepa is one of the developing towns in the Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are involved with small businesses.  Mrs. Lalita S. has two other members of her family, her husband and son. Her son is currently attending a pre-primary school.  Her husband's name is Mr. Min Bahadur S..  They opened their first telephone booths in Sanepa two years ago. Her husband is planning to do cell phone repairs in his current shop, but due to a lack of funds they are unable to buy necessary goods and materials for their repairs. Therefore, Mrs. S. is requesting for a $150 loan to establish cell phone repair work in their current shop.

loans.use: To establish mobile reparing work

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Baji is the wife of M. P. and lives in a small area named Bund Road o Lahore, Pakistan. She completed her education to the 10th standard. She has been living in this town for the last 25 years. She is the mother of seven sons. Her first two sons rent motorbikes. The next one drives a local 32-seat bus. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasreen Baji's husband runs a PCO in his community. Nasreen Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy a new phone set to make her PCO attractive. Note: PCO stands for (Public Calling Office), like a telephone booth. People come to a PCO to make a call and pay the charges per minute.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sana Baji wants a loan to buy a molding machine. Sharifan Baji wants a loan to buy betel leaves to resell. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new phone set

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Balkhu, located in the Kathmandu district of Nepal. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. K. opened her grocery store seven years ago to pay for her family. She sells different varities of grocery items such as rice, maize, biscuits, and noodles in her shop. In this coming month, the Nepalese celebrate their main festivals of Dashain and Tihar. People buy lots of food for these festivals, so Mrs. K. is requesting a $500 loan to meet the increasing demand of her customers.
Mrs. Jamuna lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband Mr. Bishal K. works in a private office. Both her daughter and son are studying in primary school.

loans.use: to invest in her shop

loans.name: Azim

texts.en: I. Azim lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. I. Azim has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007 and he done well enough to repay previous loans He runs a business raising livestock and selling meat and milk. He dreams of owning a trade outlet for the large-scale meat selling.  Mr. I. Azim asks KIVA for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months for the required capital to open a trade outlet.

loans.use: To open a trade outlet

loans.name: Hera Ganga

texts.en:
Hera Ganga K. is a resident of Balku, kathmandu. She lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law and husband. Her husband, Mr. Bikash K., works in his own meat shop.
Mrs. K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Khokhana. She opened her grocery store two years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her store. Her father-in-law and mother-in-law help her in her work.
Now, Mrs. K. is asking for a loan to invest in her shop to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.use: To invest in her shop

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en: Ilhomjon is a hard-working person and he makes an effort to give his 4 beloved children the best. He decided to stay on his home land so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 8 years in the purchase and sales of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to extend his cultivated lands and would also like to purchase cattle to create more income for his large family. For this reason, he is requesting a loan and Ilhomjon thanks you very much for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand business.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita S. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband and two sons. Both of her sons currently attend elementary school. 
Mrs. Sarita and her husband Mr. Puspa S. make baked goods. They have been in business baking cakes and cookies for one year. They sell their baked goods to local shops and markets.
Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to expand their business. They will use the extra income generated by expanding their business to send their children to better schools.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna K. lives in Balkhu, which is located in the Kahtmandu district. Most of the people in this region own or work in small businesses. Mrs. Muna lives with her husband Mr. Ramesh K. and her one daughter.
Both Ramesh and Muna currently sell glass bangles in a local market. They also supply glass bangles to the local shops. Mostly married women buy and wear their glass bangles in Nepal.
Muna is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy various glass bangles to meet the increasing demand because this month Nepalese people celebrate their main festivals Dashain and Tihar.

loans.use: To buy various glass bangles

loans.name: Boltaboy

texts.en:
Boltaboy is a 54-year-old man who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business; he drives the taxi, and he rents the microbus. Boltaboy has about two years of experience in the public transportation business. The competition is rather great in this business because there are so many people who need transportation.

Boltaboy requests a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) so that he can purchase the spare parts for his microbus. He needs to maintain his vehicle because it is essential for his business. He has a wife and three children, two of whom still depend on him for support. Boltaboy is counting on your help so he can continue to prosper.

loans.use: Purchase  spare parts to repair his microbus

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en: Mrs. Nirmala T. is a 25 year old tailor in the town of Balkhu in Kathmandu.  Three years ago, she started her tailoring business out of  in her house three years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwars, Blouses, long women’s dresses, Makhshis, and others. Before starting her business, Mrs T. took a yearlong training course in tailoring from a tailoring institute. She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. Mrs. T. lives with her husband Mr. Ranbahadur. Her husband left for Saudi-Arabia five year ago to earn money for the family. Now Mrs. T. lives with her mother.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Lila Mati

texts.en:
Mrs. Lila Mati T. is a farmer in Balkhu, Kathamndu. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her land, due to the lack of technology. She sells her vegetables in the local market. Now Mrs. T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming work.

Mrs. T. has three members including herself in her family. Her husband Mr. Bhakta Bahadur T. works in his own grocery store. Her daughter is a tailor and opens her tailoring work in their one house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming work.

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Mrs. Bimala T. M. lives in Balkhu, Kathmandu. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. Bimala lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Laxmi T. M., and her son is studying in grade two.

Mrs. Bimala T. is a farmer in the town of Bhalkhu. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her land, and now she is growing green vegetables. She sells her vegetables at the local market in the morning and evening.

Mrs. Bimala T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
U. Nazokat is the 52-year-old loving mother of three children. The elder son is already a student and the younger children are going to school. Nazokat and her husband, who bakes the bread, dream that all three of their children will receive higher education.

For 13 years, Nazokat has had a business selling the national bread “lepeshka” in the local market in the city of Khujand. The bread is the main dish on any table. That is why Nazokat’s business is rather successful and stable. She has had buyers who purchase in bulk for many years, which provides her with a stable income for her family.

Nazokat requests a loan of $600 USD to purchase more bread in order to increase the variety of goods that she offers. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. One of her dreams is that her children will improve their quality of life by studying. She makes great sacrifices so she can send them to college. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength to have a better life.

loans.use: Purchase bread to increase variety of bread to sell

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Mr. Hean N. is a villager in Traeuy Troeng Village in Kandal Province. He is a chicken breeder, and his wife owns a small restaurant where she sells rice-soup to villagers and passers-by. 

Since Mr. Hean N.'s business is going well, he is requesting a loan to buy more chickens for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. 

Mr. Hean N. is 36 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only one year old. Mr. Hean N.'s wife is shown on his left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Usha

texts.en:
Mrs. Usha T. works as a farmer in Balkhu, Kathmandu. She has five children in school and a husband who works as a painter. She mostly grows seasonal vegetables and sells her vegetables in a local market.
Now Mrs. T. is requesting a Rs 20000.00 loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm, and plans to use extra profits to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buys fertilizers and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en:
Ruzigul Y. is 52 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of four children.

Since childhood, Ruzigul has worked on a farm. She is disciplined and dedicated. She is a strong-willed woman with sound morals, a good heart and good energy. She gets strength and energy from her grandchildren, who come to visit her often. She is very active in her community and would like to develop her leadership skills further. Recently, the town people selected her as their representative in the community. Since then she has been able to achieve many things that benefit the entire community.

In order to support her family, she raises cows and sheep. She began this business 8 years ago with only one calf. As time has gone by, she has expanded her business. Currently she has four bulls and a calf. Today she wants to expand her business. She wants to purchase a small milking cow so she can sell the milk for profit and also fatten her animals. For this reason she is requesting 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 12 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to breed and sell

loans.name: Kley

texts.en: Mrs. Kley S. L. is a seamstress in Traeuy Troeng Village in Kandal Province. She is 49 years old and the mother of seven children, four of whom are employed in different businesses, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Seng Khen, is a house constructor who makes a small income to support his family. Since his work place is far from his house and he usually pays a lot on transportation, he wants to buy a motorbike to go to work. Thus, his wife decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: Kley would like to buy a motorbike for her husband to go to work .

loans.name: Anu

texts.en: Mrs. Anu K., 33 years old, lives in Kritipur. Kritipur is located in the Kathmandu Valley. Kritipur is one of the developing villages of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. K. lives in a home with her husband and three children. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter is studying in grade 9 and the younger one is in grade 1; her son is in grade 8. Her husband, Mr. Bhim K., is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu Valley. Her husband's taxi was damaged and it needs to be repaired. Mrs. Anu is requesting a loan to help her husband with the repair of his taxi.

loans.use: To repair taxi

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra Y. is 24 years old. As a good housewife, Gulchehra could not just sit still. Besides taking care of her 2 kids, Gulchehra runs a small cattle breeding business. She also raises sheep, and will use this loan to purchase a cow to raise for milk production and to finance the feeding and care of the animals.

This is her first loan with IMON, and like most of the women dealing with their first loan, it's a bit scary. It's stressful to think of the loan payments, but she decided to go ahead with the loan anyway. Her dream is to buy calves and raise them. The remote village where she lives has lots of pasture land, and the people make good use of it, raising lots of sheep and cattle. With great hope she is asking for a loan to purchase calves to raise for milk production. She is committed to paying back the loan on time. You could become an important part in Gulchehra family's life, and she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Mrs. Rama T. lives in Balkhu, Kathamndu with her husband, Mr. Manohari T., one son and daughter-in-law. The entire family is engaged in farming. They grow seasonal vegetables in their land. Now they are growing green vegetables in their land. They sell their vegetables in the morning and the evening daily. 
Now, Mrs. T. is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for their work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly S., 38, is married and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a motor-taxi driver and makes US$10 each day, while his wife has a business selling rice, typically making US$5 per day to support their family. This couple has two young children. Ly S. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase rice stock. (His wife is pictured.)

loans.use: Ly would like to purchase rice stock.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita S. lives in Balkhu, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family home with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Rabi S., works in a private office. Her eldest son is in fourth grade and her other son is in second grade.
Mrs. S. runs a grocery store in Halumandhoka near Kathmandu Durbar Square. She sells noodles, biscuits, and snacks in her store. She will use her loan to buy more grocery items for her store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items

loans.name: Gopi

texts.en: Gopi Kapaley lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband Mr. Karna Dhoj and seven children. She has four daughter and three sons. Some of her daughters are studying and some are working in a private office. All of her sons are studying in secondary school. Both Mr. and Mrs. Kapaley are engaged in their own fruit shop. They sell different varieties of fruits in their shop. They opened their fruits shop 2 years ago in Sanepa-chock. Now Gopi is requesting a loan of Rs. 10000.00 to buy fruits for their shop.

loans.use: Gopi would like to buy fruits for their shop.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas Y. is 39 years old. She is married with three adorable children. Mukaddas is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. Her years of experience raising diverse types of animals has helped her progress in spite of the bad economical situation that her family went through. Her unconditional motherly love is what drives her to work. She cares and prays every day for her animals' wellbeing so that she can offer them at a very good price at the market. 

The desire to contribute to finishing her children's education satisfactorily is what drives Mukaddas to request your help to receive a loan in order to consolidate her small business. The well-being of her family and her business are in your hands. Mukaddas and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif I. is 38 years old and sells cattle for a living. He buys cows at the local market, raises them for one month, and then sells them at a profit. This business has been the main source of income for his family for the past 12 years. He has large family consisting of three children, and his parents, who live with them in one house.  Arif is planning to increase the size of his business by buying more cattle to raise and sell. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. As this is his first loan, Arif thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil F. is a 40 year old woman. She is married with five children! 

Surrounded by beautiful and tame cows, Sevil carries out her daily work herding the grazing cattle. She has been dedicated to this occupation for the last 8 years along with her dear husband. Her business is very  hard and she struggles to afford adequate education to her children. She and her husband wish to give each of them the opportunity of advanced studies. 

Sevil wishes to buy calves for breeding and reproduction so she can have a business of her own. Therefore she is asking for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase four calves. Let us help this industrious mother make her dreams come true. She wants to see her beloved children become professionals with bright futures.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif Q. is 35 years old. He is married with three sons; the youngest just started school last year. Asif sells sheep for meat production. He started his business in 1999; at that time, he sold one sheep every two weeks. Now Asif is selling more. The business requires much effort. It does generate enough income to provide for Asif 's family, but not enough to expand his business. He gets up every morning at five o'clock to feed and look after the animals.

Asif requests 1200 USD to purchase 20 additional sheep. Asif appreciates every one who supports him in his business!

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Vusale

texts.en:
Vusale A. is 24 is years old. She began her business to keep herself active and busy when she found herself sad and depressed over her old parents' and unemployment.

Vusale has been running her own small business for four years. She rents a store in the local market and sells different kinds of candies, sweets, butter and soft drinks. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 7:00 p.m. Her sister helps her with the business. Vusale and her sister are very friendly and polite people, which has earned them a loyal clientele.

Vusale is now requesting a loan of $1200. She is planning to use the loan to purchase additional good to sell and to be able to continue to provide for her parents.

Vusale promises to repay her loan within 15 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her. She is counting on your help.

loans.use: To purchase additional good to sell

loans.name: Gulovsha

texts.en:
Gulovsha I. is 36 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of three children. Her husband is unemployed.

About eight years ago, her family faced mounting financial problems, so she decided to become a cattlewoman. Specifically, Gulovsha buys calves at the market at a low price, feeds them, and then re-sells them at the same market at a higher price to generate profits. Her husband also works with her in this business. Gulovsha works extremely hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a sufficient amount of income for the family.

Now, Gulovsha is planning to purchase additional calves to raise and thereafter to sell for a profit. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 1200 USD. This is the first loan she has requested, but Gulovsha asserts that she will not be delinquent in any way and will promptly repay the loan according to its terms.

loans.use: to purchase four calves

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir V. is 35 years old and is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur that sells a variety of items like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream, washing powder, kitchen furniture, slippers and many other items. Tahir's family is actively involved in helping with the business. Tahir is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his inventory. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to become a successful entrepreneur. Tahir 's main goal is pay for his beloved children's education so that someday they'll become successful entrepreneurs themselves. We believe his perseverance and clear vision are key factors in the success of his small business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for his store

loans.name: Amirhon

texts.en: T. Amirhon lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. T. Amirhon has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she shown herself as a serious and motivated client. She has gradually increased loan sums and grown her business and personal income.  She has the business growing livestock and producing milk. She dreams to purchase one more milk cow for further milk production to supply to local bazaars. She plans to sells an assortment of milk and sour products such as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, and curds. Mrs. T. Amirhon asks KIVA for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months to purchase that milk cow.  It will allow her to significantly increase her family income.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Abdumutalib

texts.en: L. Abdumutalib was born in 1950 in the Spitamen region. He applied to MicroInvest in 2008 and bought a pedigree bull thanks to his first loan. The first loan helped him grow his business and now he is ready to take the next loan step. Mr. L. Abdumutalib has been in the livestock business for 14 years. He works at the collective farm but it is seasonal work so the livestock business brings in general family income. He has 2 pedigree bulls, 3 milk-cows and 4 rams. Mr. L. Abdumutalib applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months to build a cowshed. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes KIVA lenders all the best.

loans.use: To build a cowshed

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that contains three members. Mrs. Saret is group leader. Mrs. Saret R., 29, is grocery seller. Normally, she sells her groceries in crowded places. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver in Battambang town. With their incomes, Saret always manages her cash carefully. She cares for two children, both of whom are attending school. To increase her family's income by satisfying her customers' requests, she would like a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. In the future, she wants all of her children to graduate from university and get good jobs.

Mr. Chamruen S. is an ice-cream seller. She requested a loan of US$300 to purchase a second hand motorcycle to sell her ice-cream by transporting it to customers' homes.

Mrs. Sarom R. is a general products seller. She requested a loan of US$300 to purchase more of a variety of products to sell.

They are all people who are living in Svay Por Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: Purchasing more groceries

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en: N. Kahramon was born in 1966 in the Spitamen region of Tajiksitan. He applied to MicroInvest in 2008 when he heard successful stories from neighbors about taking MicroInvest loans. He decided to apply to MicroInvest and to take a business support loan and built a new cowshed.  Mr. N. Kahramon has been in the livestock business for 16 years. He works at the collective farm as a bookkeeper but the livestock business brings in more income. He has one pedigree bull, one milk cow and 2 rams. Mr. N. Kahramon asks KIVA for a business support loan of 3200 STJ for 5 months to purchase another pedigree bull. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes KIVA lenders all the best.

loans.use: To buy a pedigree bull

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap L., 45, sells roast beef and breeds pigs. She has been operating this business from the front of her house since earL. 2007. Her customers always visit her house to eat her roast beef.  She currentL. earns approximateL. US$8.00 each day. She has two young children and spends a lot of time taking care of them as well. Mr. Pheang Song, her husband, is 46 years old and is a mobile dealer in domestic animals. Mrs. Pheap hopes to expand her husband's business. ConsequentL., she is requesting a loan US$1,000 to purchase more oxen, buffalo and pigs. They all live in Kantang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: Purchasing more oxen, buffalo and pigs

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin R. is 26 years old. Elchin sells cattle. As a rule he purchases calves in the central market, raises them, and then re-sells them at higher prices at the local market. Being in this business for 7 years now, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to raise them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning at five o'clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his large family consisting of his elderly parents and brothers and sisters.

Today, Elchin is planning to enlarge his herd and to purchase cows and calves. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 1200 USD. Elchin thanks all for trusting and supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Muhtor

texts.en: O. Muhtor lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. Mr. O. Muhtor is an invalid but he is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work to ensure his children a happy future. He has had a home business purchasing and selling livestock for 12 years. In addition he works on the railroad as conductor. But the livestock business brings the general income. Mr. O. Muhtor applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 2800 STJ for 5 months to purchase another pedigree bull. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes KIVA lenders all the best.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Roun's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that contains three members. Mrs. Saret is the group leader. Mrs. Roun C., 36, is a pig breeder. Her husband is a Khmer style constructor; sometimes he goes away from home for his construction works. To increase her income, Saret needs a loan of US$300 to purchase more piglets to breed. The remainder of the loan would be used to purchase pig food.

Mrs. Sal S. is vegetable seller. She requested a loan of US$300 to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables to sell.

Mrs. Meat K. is vegetable seller and she requested a loan of US$300 to purchase a greater variety of vegetables to sell.

They are people living in Kdol Daunteav Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: Purchasing more piglets to breed

loans.name: Oruj

texts.en:
Oruj R. is 50 years old. He is married with four children. Oruj`s wife is a housekeeper and she takes care of their children. Oruj is the main bread-winner in the family

Oruj sells candies, cookies, tea and cigarettes in the market place . He has been in this business for more than 20 years. With a constant demand for his goods, the business brings stable income for the family. Now Oruj wants to increase the stock of his goods to be able to supply all the demands of his buyers. 

Oruj requests a 1200 USD loan. He is going to purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods to sell. Oruj would like to thank all for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: to purchase more food inventory

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en: Ilyas I. is a 56 year old man who sells different kinds of goods as soft drinks, tea, sugar, onion, flour, candies and garden supplies. He is married and has five children. Ilyas started his business in 1983 when poverty and unemployment pushed him to start his own business and support his family. He achieved good results with long years of experience.  In the beginning of his business he was renting a place, but now he has built his own shop next to his house. Ilyas's business generates income just enough to cover family needs but it is not enough to expand it. He requests additional funds to purchase more inventory which will help generate more income and improve his life. Your contribution will be very helpful for Ilyas`s business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Qafar

texts.en: Qafar Q. is a 45 year old man who keeps his own business selling a variety of goods such as soap, powder, shampoo, and pens. He is married and 2 sons of school age.  He started his business in 1996 when his salary as accountant was just enough to barely make ends meet. Qafar decided to start his own business and now his store is the main source of income for his family. Qafar also helps his very old parents financially. He applies for a 1200 USD loan to buy more inventory for his store and generate more income.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his store

loans.name: Pheun

texts.en: Mrs. Pheun L. is a villager in Angk Village in Kandal Province. She is a 47-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and one of whom is still attending the local school. Mrs. Pheun L. is a breeder who raises pigs. Although she and her children have two different businesses, they are all still living in an old house. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Pheun L. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings, which which she will build a new house for her household. She hopes that her family will live in better conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: Building a new house

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Mrs. Kun H. is a villager in Vihea Village in Kandal Province. She is a breeder who raises seven piglets. Since her pigs are growing, she no longer has enough money to buy food to feed them. Consequently, she is asking for a loan with which she will purchase pig food. If any money remains, she will use it to build a piggery for her pigs. Mrs. Kun H. is a 48-year-old widow with two children.

loans.use: Purchasing pig food

loans.name: Farzaliyev

texts.en:
Farzaliyev A. sells livestock. He started his business in 2000 with growing the sheep. Now A. has the sheep shed and which he sells in the local market once-twice in a week . He likes animals and his job very much which allows him to support his family. A. is 36 years old. He is married with four children. His elder son is in the secondary school.

The business requires a great effort to keep it successful and to generate stable income for the family. Thus, his elder son gets up every morning at five o'clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. Also A. has a car and sometimes makes money by taking people from his settlement to the city or to the closest city. Today A. requests 1200 USD for the term of 15 months. The loan is required to purchase 15 sheep and fodder for them. A. would like everyone to trust him, and he promises to be precise in the loan payment.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Yuos

texts.en: Mrs. Yuos M. is a farmer in Chek Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Yuos M. is a 54-year-old widow with two children, one of who is employed in a garment factory while the other one is a farmer. In her plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support her field. With the rest of the money, she would hire laborers to plow her rice field with oxen. She hopes her rice revenue will increase with this new loan.

loans.use: Yuos would like to buy more fertilizers to support her rice field.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
P. Mukaddas is 21 years old. She is very entrepreneurial and hardworking, with innumerable plans for her future life. She doesn’t attend school, but in spite of this she is helping her parents get ahead. For 5 years, Mukaddas has been selling the national bread “lepeshka” and other types of bread in the local market in Khujand. Because she buys bread wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. She offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Mukaddas to make her business quite successful and provide a stable income for her family.

Mukaddas requests a loan of $600. She plans to purchase an greater assortment of baked good to expand her business. Mukaddas expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase more varieties of baked goods to increase sales

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn C. is a villager in Vihea Village in Kandal Province. Morn is 25 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns 1.3-hectares to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ban Nhock, is a fisherman who can gather only a little fish because he now has insufficient fishing tools. In order to improve their businesses, his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat for her husband to catch fish and she will use the rest of the money to buy more fishnets.

loans.use: Morn would like to buy a new boat for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Mam

texts.en: Mrs. Mam C. was born in 1964 and she now lives in Vihea Village in Kandal Province. She is a 44-year-old without any children. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. San Seng, is a fisherman. In the plantation, Mrs. Mam C. now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support her field while it is infertile. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: Mam would like to buy fertilizers to support her field while it is infertile.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S. M. is a villager in the village of Kampong Chrey in Takeo Province. She sells grocery goods in the local village and her husband, Mr. Chao Meng, is a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her husband's business. Mrs. M. is 35 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of four. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Kim would like to buy more piglets and pig food for her husband's pig breeding business.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon P. is a villager in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. She owns a small store in the local village where she sells grocery products. Aside from this business, she is a farmer. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a very bad affect on her crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Mrs. P. is a 29-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: Khon would like to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda F. is 36 years old and married with four children. Her children study at school. Sevda's husband is currently unemployed and that is why she is the main breadwinner in the family. For last five years, Sevda has been breeding cattle. Currently, she is breeding two cows. Her son helps her and her husband sells the meat of the cattle in the market.

This family business brings a stable income for the family of Sevda. The main activities are selling calves and dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt. Sevda is planning to expand her business and to purchase two calves and one cow. For this reason, she requests 1200 USD. Being very accurate by her nature, Sevda promises to pay the loan timely and precisely. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and one cow

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo K. is a farmer in Meoun Tumrong Village in Takeo Province and his wife, Mrs. Em Chroeb, helps him on the plantation. They cannot currently support their family well because they only have one business. Keo decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.
