Keo is 30 years old and the father of three children who are all attending the local school. His wife is also presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Keo would like to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin F. is a young man of 21. He is very enthusiastic and full of energy. His father helped him to start his shop, which sells food, four years ago. In the beginning Elvin simply assisted his father by procuring the merchandise, but once he was of age his father entrusted him with the entire business. It has proven to be quite successful, and the store carries a range of food products and sweets.

Elvin has decided to take out a loan in order to further expand the variety of foods he sells. For this purpose he applied for a loan of $1200. He is counting on your help.

loans.use: To expand the variety of foods for sale

loans.name: Me

texts.en: Mrs. Me S. is a farmer in Srey Chey Village in Takeo Province and her husband, Mr. Tieng Sorn, is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Although Mrs. Me S. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot afford to buy timber in order to build a new house for their household. Thus, Mrs. Me S. decided to ask for a loan. Mrs. Me S. is 43 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the other two are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Me would like to buy timber in order to build a new house for their household.

loans.name: Mil

texts.en: Mrs. Mil S. is a village in Srey Chey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and grocer. Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to re-sell. She is a 36-year-old widow with two children who are attending the local school. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: Mil would like to buy more grocery products to re-sell.

loans.name: Keob

texts.en: Mrs. Keob L. is a farmer in Dock Por village in Takeo province. Mrs. Keob L. is 47 years old and the mother of four, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. In her plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad affect on her crop, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Chu Kheng, is a coconut seller who usually sells it door-to-door. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Keob would like to purchase fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
This is a group loan and there are three members. Mrs. Saret is the group leader. Mrs. Tha S. is 47 years old and sells fish in the market. Normally, she buys fish from fishermen and sells them to the market for profit. Her husband, Mr. Sat Mann, is 46 years old and is a motorcycle taxi driver in Battambang Town. Tha and her husband earn around 10US$ per day in total. She has seven children, five of whom are married; she cares for the remaining two children, both of whom attend school, in the family's home. In order to expand her fish selling business, Tha is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase more fish inventory to sell.

Ms. Ralin Soeun is a fish seller; she requested a loan of US$300 to purchase more fish to sell.

Mrs. Mit Sman requested a loan of US$300 to purchase more fish inventory to sell.

They all live in Norea Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: Purchasing more fish

loans.name: Cheab

texts.en: Mrs. Cheab L. is a villager in Dock Por Vilalge in takeo Province. She owns a small store where she sells grocery products. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Touch Keurn, helps her in the business in order to make income to support their family together. Mrs. Cheab L. is 32 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are at the age of two and five years old. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Cheab would like to purchase more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Diribash

texts.en:
Diribash F. is 57 years old. He is married and has four children. All he does is for the well-being of his children. Diribash's wife is a housekeeper, and she takes care of their children. Diribash's business is the main source of income for his family. Diribash started his own business over 30 years ago when he was young.

First he began selling foods in the local market. As time went by, he decided to change his business because he was married and the business did not generate enough income to support his family. He rented a place and started to sell candies, butter, conserves, jam and other food stuffs.

He purchases all goods he sells from his suppliers. With over seven years of working in this business, Diribash has enough experience to do his work successfully. He also has loyal clients. Today Diribash requests $1200 so he can increase the stock of goods. Diribash would like to thank everybody for supporting him, and promises that he will repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Dock Por Village in Takeo Province. Chea has four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are at the age of one and five years old. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Nget Chor, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes little income because his motorbike is too old and he pays a lot of money on it. In order to improve his business, his wife decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Chea would like to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one for her husband's motor taxi service.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S., 26 and the mother of two children aged two and three, is a farmer in Dock Por Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Yem Koem, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income that contributes to the support of their family. Although Mrs. Chea S. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions.

In order to improve their lives, Mrs. Chea S. is requesting a loan to buy piglets in order to start a breeding business. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through Junior High. Cecilia sells saucepans and powdered fish and other food items at Kotokoraba which is the heart of Cape Coast. She has been doing this since 1996.

Cecilia uses her income for the feeding of the family and to pay utility bills. Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more saucepans. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: purchase more food items and saucepans for re-sale

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano U. is an active client of our program and she has been the client of MicroInvest since 2004. Mrs. U. is engaged in commerce; she sells eggs in the local market. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in Khujand.

Mrs. U. is applying to KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months to expand her little business.

loans.use: to expand her little business

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang P. was born in 1970 and she now lives in Pour Dos Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chea Rim, are farmers. They now live in poor conditions because they have only one business to earn their living. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Neang P. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Neang has six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, three others attending the local school, and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the right of the photo.

loans.use: Neang would like to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina D. sells coal pots and African cooking pots at Kotokoraba, which is in the heart of the Cape Coast.

Sabina has received a junior high school education. She has four children. Sabina has been doing this business since 1996. She is responsible for feeding the family and paying the utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy more coal pots and cooking pots for resale. She hopes to use the new profit from her business to help her husband to start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more coal pots and cooking pots for resale.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S. is a villager in Pour Dos Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer but she now faces a problem in farming because she does not have cows to plow the field for growing rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Thon thorn, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support his family. Mrs. Touch S. is 32 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is also presented in the right of the photo.

loans.use: Touch would like to buy two cows to plow the field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
This is group that consists of three members; Ren is the group leader. Mrs. Ren L. is 28 years old. She sells vegetables in front of her home in Sretkeut village. Her customers are her neighbors. She is married to Mr. Sor Lam, 37, who is a construction worker. Sor always leaves home in the morning and returns in the afternoon. He can earn about US$5.00 per day from his business. Ren, however, is facing difficulties in transporting her vegetables; consequently, she decided to ask for US$150 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

Mrs. Raiy L. is 29 years old and is also a vegetable seller. She decided to ask for US$150 to buy a secondhand motorcycle, which she will use for vegetable transportation.

Mrs. Lok L., 28, sells vegetables in the market. She wants to increasing her income; consequently, she is requesting a loan of US$150, with which she will purchase more vegetables for resale. They all live in Kantang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: Purchasing a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn H. is a pig breeder in Trapaing Krasang Village in Takeo Province. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding; if there is any money left over, she will use it to buy pig food. Mrs. Moeurn H. is a 37-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a construction worker; the other two are still attending the local school.

loans.use: Purchasing more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Zilha

texts.en: Zilha Junuzović is 52 years old and lives in a suburb of Doboj. She is not married and the only income that she has is from her business with poultry. This is seasonal work and she earns only enough to pay her daily costs. Zilha is not able to save much money, and every time she has to buy chickens she has to borrow money or take a loan. She has taken out loans with WWI in the past, and and now she requests a loan of 600KM ($450 USD). Zilha will use this loan to buy little chickens and turkeys for fattening and reselling.

loans.use: To buy chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en: Mrs. Kalpana K. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur and lives with her huband Mr. Shyam Kumar K.. He is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu valley. Mrs. Kalpana opened her fruit shop a few months ago in the Sanepa-chock. Now Mrs. K. is requesting a $150 loan to buy fresh fruit to sell during the festivals of Dashain and Tihar.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva Labudović comes from Doboj. She has been divorced for a long time and she raised her child alone without any help. She is now in retail and that keeps her busy in the field. She has a garden for her own use and now she wants to buy strawberry seedlings to plant this autumn. Eva decide to take a loan in WWI in amount of 600 KM. Eva will use this loan to begin her business with strawberries.

loans.use: Eva would like to buy strawberry seedlings.

loans.name: Samjana

texts.en: Mrs. Samjana L. opened her hotel in Sanepa near a bus stop. She sells several varieties of food in her hotel, including Nepalese and Newari. She serves coffee and tea as well. Samjana prefers to make Newari foods in her hotel because her Newari foods are very testy and delicious to eat. Samjana's older sister also helps her run her hotel. Miss Samjana L. is requesting a $150 loan to buy food supplies for her business.

loans.use: Food supplies

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana Baji is the wife of M. L. and lives in a small area named Bund Road of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 50 years. Se is the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are job holders. Rehana Baji's husband has a vegetable selling business. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Rehana Baji herself has a clothes selling business with 2 years experience. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nabeela wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Samina wants a loan to buy material (beads, sketches and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Parveen Gudu Baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita L. lives in Sanepa Lalitpur. Sanepa is a developing town in Lalitpur and most of the people living in this region are engaged in small business endeavors.
Mrs. L. lives with her husband and four children, she has two sons and two daughters. Both of her sons are studying in lower secondary school and her daughters are studying in secondary schools. Her husband, Mr. Ram L., is engaged in his own small restaurant.  Sunita manages a grocery store that sells different varieties of groceries. She also exchanges coins for bus drivers and charges a commission.
Now Mrs. L. is requesting a loan so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jasminka

texts.en:
Jasminka Babić was born in 1971 and comes from Gračnica. She is the mother of two children; one child is in primary and the other in secondary school. Her husband is employed and Jasminka is a housewife. Jasminka has been selling clothes for a long time, which helps her and her family to have money for their daily and school costs.

Jasminka has already been a user of WWI loans and now she takes a loan to prepare herself for the coming season. She sells clothes at home and at the local marketplace. She takes a loan of the amount of 1000 KM to buy some winter clothes for reselling, to provide her with earnings for the winter time.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes for reselling

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Ang Chea, 49, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. One son studies at University and the other son works in a garment factory. Their only daughter sells vegetables.

Nga and her husband have been farming since 1994. They grow many types of vegetables such as tomatoes, papayas, and spinach to sell to middle men in the village who then take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Nga is requesting a loan of 400 to pay school fees for her son who studies in University and some amount for growing vegetables.

loans.use: Nga would like to pay school fees for her son who is at University, and for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn P., 49, is a widow with six children; three sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home. Two sons do farming and one daughter is a garment factory worker. The youngest daughter studies in the local school. The family lives along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yorn has been farming for thirty years. She grows papayas, bananas, and other crops in her farmland. Now, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide for her farming business.

loans.use: Yorn would like to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for farming.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina Salkić is 36 years old, married, and the mother of one daughter. She comes from a town well known as a very enterprising area where almost everybody has his or her own little business. Edina does a lot of agriculture – she has cows and sells milk and milk products, and a garden where she produces vegetables, but her main job is in her green house. Edina has to do some reconstruction on the green house and she decided to take a loan in WWI in the amount of 800 KM. She must buy more nylon and do some changes on the water system in the green house. Edina hopes to extend her green house and provide producing abilities throughout the whole year.

loans.use: Edina would like to buy supplies for her green house.

loans.name: Vich

texts.en:
Mr. Vich E., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Bich Long, 47, live along national road number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. Three children are construction workers; another two children are garment factory workers. One son studies at the local school.

Mr. Vich is a mason and a motor taxi driver. He does his job in his village and nearby his village. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. The main income in the family is from Vich and his children. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike so that his children can drive to work.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. sells food items like beans, groundnut, and millet at Kotokoraba which is the heart of Cape Coast. She has received no formal education and she is married and with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Elizabeth has been selling food items since 1998. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more food stuffs like beans, groundnut, millet and others for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a piece of land for the family house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to purchase more food stuffs to resell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima Fazlić was born in 1971 and comes from a village named Đurđevik near Živinive. She is a housewife and her husband works out of Bosnia. She keeps busy by her handwork – she makes table suites and such things and Fatima does mostly the orders. Beside that she has her garden and now she wants to try poultry. That is the reason that she takes a loan in WWI in amount of 1200 KM. She will use this loan to buy poultry and food for them.

loans.use: Fatima would like to buy poultry.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mrs. Mara E., 28, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Thorn, 41, who live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1998 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their daughter studies in a local school.

Mara has been a cotton scarf weaver for six years, a skill she learned from her mother. She takes her products to sell at Olympic Market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a policeman and a motor taxi driver as well. Mara is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase cotton materials for weaving cotton scarves.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials for weaving cotton scarves

loans.name: Ševala

texts.en: ŠEvala Salkić comes from Suha, a village near ŽIvinice. She has one school-aged daughter and she gives everything of herself to provide good living conditions for her familly. ŠEvala keeps busy in a greenhouse producing a healthy vegetable. She wants to take a loan from WWI to keep her business running. She needs a loan in amount of 800 KM to buy  onion seeds to plant in the greenhouse. Young onion is a very popular vegetable in spring time in Bosnie, so ŠEvala hopes to earn a good profit and that that will improve her production of healthy food.

loans.use: To buy onion seeds

loans.name: Samoe

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoe K., 31, and her husband, Mr. Yan Chou, 40, live on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. Now their daughter is a silk weaver and other two children study in a local school.

Samoe and her husband have been farming since they were married. Besides farming she is also a silk weaver and Yan is a construction worker as well. They grow many types of crops and vegetables in their farmland. Samoe is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and pay fees for plowing to growing papayas, melons, and taros.

loans.use: Samoe would like to purchase seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and pay fees for plowing.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheak C., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Choub, 30, live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of their children study in a local school.

Mr. Sopheak has been a silk weaver since 2006, a skill he learned from his wife. Mrs. Sophoin has been a silk weaver since she was young. The couple sells their finished products to a man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides being a weaver, Sopheak is also a mason.

He is requesting a loan of 300 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
Mrs. Chat Y., 55, and her husband, Mr. Sun Tol, 59, who live along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1974 and have five children; two sons and three daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home and their other daughter is a garment factory worker. One son is a construction worker and the other son builds wooden houses.

Mrs. Chat and her husband have been farming since 1974. They grow cucumbers and ridye gourd in their farmland near the house. Currently, the couple is in the process of building one house for their daughter who was married but lacks the money to finish it. Therefore, Chat is requesting a loan of $1000 to build a house for her daughter.

loans.use: Chat would like to build a house for her daughter and her husband.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy S., 35, and her husband, Mr. Mo Bou, 36, live along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have three children; one son and two daughters. All of their children study in local school. Sophy is operating grocery store at her home. She bought all of the grocery items from Korky market to resell to the villagers. Her husband is in the army. Sophy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery items for resale and for her stock.

loans.use: Sophy would like to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom U., 54, and her husband, Mr. Sut Pheng, 64, live along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have three daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and the youngest one studies in a local school.

Mrs. Sokhom and her husband have been farming since 2000. They plant different kinds of vegetables and flowers and sell them to a middle man who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Sokhom is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fertilizers and pesticide for her vegetable farm.

loans.use: Sokhom would like to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S., 40, and her husband, Mr. Han Long, 29, live along the Tonle Basac River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1999 and have two sons. Both of them study in a local school. 

Mrs. Phalla has been selling fruit for three years. She buys them from farmers in her village and sells them at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a truck driver. Phalla is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase one motor trailer to carry fruit to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing one motor trailer to carry fruit to sell

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya has been selling domestic tools in Zanzibar since 1994. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children, ages 3 and 5.

She works every day from 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $250. She is hoping that this loan enables her to buy more items for her to sell for profit at her shop.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of domestic tools for her shop

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah B. is married and has one child. She has received no formal education. Hannah sells groundnut, beans and alata soap in large quantities at Kotokoraba, which is in the heart of the Cape Coast. She has been doing this since 1990. 

Her husband is a farmer. Hannah uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more food, such as beans and groundnut, for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to expand her capital base to increase her profit.

loans.use: Hannah will use the loan to purchase more food like beans, groundnut and others for resale.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha has been selling fish and chapati in Zanzibar since 2004. Chapati is a flat pancake often eaten for breakfast or lunch, either plain or rolled up with fruit or vegetables inside. Both chapati and fish are staples of the Tanzanian diet.

Sabiha is 43 years old, married, and has six children. Her oldest child is 24 and her youngest is 3 years old. She works every day from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $65. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to purchase chapati ingredients and fish at greater quantities so that she may net an increased profit.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients to expand her business.

loans.name: Jambo Nia Group

texts.en:
Hawima has owned a shop selling small items in Zanzibar since 2003. She sells a variety of goods, from cleaning products to drinks to snacks. Among her most popular sellers are juice and biscuits. She works every day from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. at her shop and is able to earn approximately $90 each month. She is hoping that with this access to capital she will be able to purchase more of the most popular goods and increase her sales and profit.

Hawima is 48 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 10 and 25.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her small shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice O. has 3 children. She has completed her education through junior high school.

Alice sells cosmetics in Kotokoraba, which is the heart of Cape Coast. She has been doing this since 1997.

Alice uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Alice will use this loan to increase her capital to buy more cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to help her husband with the renovation of their house.

loans.use: Alice will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Mbaya

texts.en:
Mbaya has been selling charcoal and dresses in Zanzibar since 1997. She is 45 years old, divorced, and has four children between the ages of 15 and 25.  

She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of approximately $45. She hopes that this loan will allow her to buy more charcoal and clothing so that she is able to have higher sales and greater profit.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale at her business.

loans.name: Aba Kessiwaa

texts.en:
Aba Kessiwaa O. sells cosmetics in Kotokoraba, which is at the heart of Cape Coast. Aba Kessiwaa has received some education. She is single and has no children.

Aba Kessiwaa has been selling cosmetics since 2006. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses.

Her loan will be used to increase her capital so she can buy more cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Mwanabaraka's Group

texts.en:
Mwanabaraka has had a shop selling clothing and juices in Zanzibar since 2006. In order to get inventory for her shop, she buys second-hand clothing sent from other countries (like the United States) in bulk and sells it to the local people. She also buys locally-produced juices like mango and passion fruit juice and sells them to the students in her neighborhood. She works every day from 8:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of approximately $130.

Mwanabaraka is 33 years old, married, and has two children ages 8 and 15. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to buy more inventory and increase her sales and profit. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mashavu, who also has a shop in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her small shop.

loans.name: Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Nihfadhi has been making dresses in Zanzibar since 1998. She is 48 years old, divorced, and has five children. She works at her tailoring shop from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and earns a monthly profit of approximately $85. She is hoping to use this loan to by more fabrics and tools so that she may make more dresses.

Nihfadhi will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Safia, Fatma, Aisha, Biubwa and Umanzi. They each also have their own businesses in Zanzibar making and selling foods.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and tools to make clothing.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. sells phones and accessories at Kotokoraba, which is in the heart of the Cape Coast. Michael has received a senior high school education. He is a single parent and has three children. 

Michael has been selling phones and accessories since 2000. He is responsible for paying his children's school fees and other utility bills. His loan will be used to buy the latest mobile phones and accessories for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand his capital base to increase his profit and enable him meet the increasing needs of his family.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy latest mobile phones, accessories for resale.

loans.name: Sauma

texts.en:
Sauma has had a business baking and selling bread in Zanzibar since 1995. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children. Her children range in age from 15 to 30 years.  

Sauma works every day from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of approximately $75. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to buy more ingredients so that she can produce and sell more bread.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her bread business.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Née à Kétao en 1974, Madame A. Béatrice est mariée et mère d’un petit garçon. Outre cet enfant, elle compte à sa charge deux autres personnes qui l’aident à vendre ses produits. La production du jus de mil est son activité quotidienne.

Après les mauvaises récoltes de l’année dernière, la mesure du mil devient très chère. Pour continuer à produire, elle sollicite un crédit  pour acheter assez de mil afin d’être à l’abri de la hausse continue du prix.

Par cette activité, elle aura réussi à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Kétao in 1974, Mrs. Béatrice A. is married and the mother of one small son. Besides this child, she is responsible for two other people who help her sell her products. Producing millet juice is her daily business.

After the poor harvests of last year, millet has become very expensive. In order to continue production, she is asking for a loan to purchase enough millet so as to be sheltered from price hikes.

By means of this business, she will manage to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of millet to prepare the local drink

loans.name: Sauma

texts.en:
Sauma has had a shop selling shoes and bags in Zanzibar since 1998. She is now seeking her first loan so that she may increase her inventory in the shop. She works daily from 6:00am to 6:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $75.

Sauma is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages of 15 and 28.

loans.use: To buy more clothing products for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel Y. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through to Senior High education. Mabel sells groceries like sugar, rice, biscuits, soap and others at Kotokoraba, which is the heart of Cape Coast. She has been in this business since 1998. Mabel uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills.

Mabel will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more groceries for sale, to meet her ever-increasing customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mabel plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy more groceries for sale, to meet her ever-increasing customers.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca A. sells groceries like sugar, rice, biscuits, soap and others at Kotokoraba, which is the heart of Cape Coast. Prisca has received Primary education. She is married and has 3 children. Prisca has been selling groceries since 1997. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of groceries to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a variety of groceries to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Zeynuu's Group

texts.en:
Zeynuu has had a dress and shoe shop in Zanzibar for eight years. She is 39 years old, divorced, and has no children. Every day she works from 7:00am to 3:00pm at her shop, earning a monthly profit of approximately $130. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her inventory so that she may sell more of the most popular dresses and shoes.

Zeynuu will share this loan with her fellow group member, Fatma. Fatma sells food items in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more dresses and shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Née en 1965 à Vogan, Madame A. Afi vit dans le village de Kpémé où elle vend de la bouillie accompagné de gâteaux. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Très appréciéepar sa clientèle, elle s’efforce pour satisfaire cette dernière en préparant toujours une bouillie de bonne qualité.

Pour maintenir ce cap, elle  sollicite un crédit  pour s’approvisionner en maïs, sucre et farine de blé. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir de la matière première sur un temps donné et éviter les ruptures.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Vogan, Mrs. Afi A. lives in the village of Kpémé where she sells porridge and cakes. She is married and has 6 children. Very much appreciated by her clientele, she tries hard to satisfy her customers' needs by always preparing high quality porridge.

To continue doing this, she is requesting a loan to stock up on corn, sugar, and wheat flour. This will permit her to have the necessary raw materials always at hand and prevent her from running short of her products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock up on corn, sugar, and wheat flour

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through Senior High level. Elizabeth sells fabric, lining and other sewing materials. She is a seamstress by profession at Aboom near Cape Coast. She has been doing this since 1980. Elizabeth uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials to enable her to meet the increasing demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to purchase more sewing materials to enable her meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Sadeta

texts.en: Sadeta Husaković is 39 years old and comes from Stanić Rijeka, a nice village near Doboj. She was unfortune to be  widowed very young, and she raised her son alone. Sadeta is remarried now and has one more son. Her husband has a car wash and Sadeta and her older son help him. Beside that, Sadeta has her garden and she raises poultry in season. Sadeta wants to support her older son and help him to provide his own living (he lives with them now). They are trying to fix his living place and Sadeta takes a loan from WWI every year for that. She takes a small amount to be able to repay it. Sadeta is requesting a loan from WWI in the amount of 1000 KM to provide electricity in her son`s living quarters.

loans.use: To provide electricity in house

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné N. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants avec 2 autres à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Pire Gourèye depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des  poissons séchés et de poissons fumés. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b>
texts.en:
Ngoné N. is married and the mother of 4 children. She is also responsible for 2 others. She has been a member of the village bank of Pire Gourèye for three years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling dried and smoked fish. She wants to bolster her little business. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac E. is married and has four children. He has received schooling through to Junior High education. Isaac sells used clothing at Kotokoraba, which is the heart of Cape Coast. He has been in this business since 1998. His wife is a trader. 

Isaac uses his income to feed the family and to pay for utility bills. He will use the loan to increase his capital to buy used clothing in larger quantities for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to help his wife with the renovation of their house.

loans.use: To increase his capital to buy used clothing in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Miza

texts.en: Miza, a 48-year-old widow with eight children ranging in age from 8 to 32, has had a dress and shoe shop in Zanzibar since 2006.  She works everyday from 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of approximately $85.  Miza is now requesting a loan that will enable her to increase her inventory so that she can net a greater profit.

loans.use: To buy more dresses and shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Zumra

texts.en: Zumra Kamberović comes from a suburb of ŽIvinice. She is married and lives with her husband and her grown son. Her husband and son are employed, but they earn little, and that is the reason that they all work together in their field. The men work hard and Zumra does the daily job of caring for the sheep and goats. They have enough food for the animals but they want to buy more goat to rice and resell it. Zumra decided to take a loan in WWI in amount of 800 KM to extend her herd.

loans.use: To buy a goat

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama has been selling dresses and shoes in Zanzibar since 2005.  She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 20.  She works at her shop from 7:00am to 4:30pm every day.  She gets inventory by buying dresses and shoes in bulk and then sells them at retail prices.  She hopes that this loan will allow her to buy a greater quantity of goods so that she may increase her sales and profit.  She currently earns approximately $45 each month.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira Mujčić was born in 1966. She comes from the little town Jelah which is well known as a very commercial area. Esmira is the mother of three school-aged children. Her husband is a mechanic, and he has garage by his house and Esmira works at home. They are able to take care of their three children and earn enough for their living. Esmira is an accountant for a few little companies and stores at her place. She would like to expand her business, as she has more time now because their children are not so little any more. She decided to buy better equipment and needed materials to be able to get more clients. Esmira takes her second loan (the first was for the beginning of her business) in WWI in the amount of 1500 KM. She hopes to develop her business and provide a job for their children in the future.

loans.use: Esmira would like to buy better equipment for the small accounting business she runs out of her home.

loans.name: Imani Yetu Group

texts.en:
Mayasa has been selling dresses in Zanzibar since 2006. She is now seeking a loan so that she can increase her monthly profit, which is currently approximately $100. She intends to use the loan to buy more dresses at bulk rates to stock in her shop and sell at retail prices.

Mayasa is 25 years old, single, and has no children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sija and Asha. Sija keeps chickens and sells eggs, and Asha sells charcoal.

loans.use: To buy dresses for her shop.

loans.name: Gnagna

texts.fr: Gnagna F., 46 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants et 02 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Pire Gourèye depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de  produits divers (savon, sucre, lait, bougie, effets de toilette, etc.) dans une boutique. <b> Gnagna sollicite un  prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Gnagna F. is 46 years old, married with 5 children and in charge of 2 others. She has been a member of the village bank Pire Gourèye for 7 years. She wants to strengthen her retail activity of various goods (soap, sugar, milk, candles, toiletries, etc.) in a store. Gnagna is asking for a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soap, sugar, milk, candles and toiletries to supply a shop

loans.name: Umukulthum

texts.en: Umukulthum has had a school in Zanzibar since 2004.  She is requesting a loan to put towards the school.  To supplement her income from the school, she also maintains a shop in her neighborhood.  Every day, Umukulthum works from 6:00am to 6:00pm and make a monthly profit of approximately $125.  She is 28 years old, divorced, and has two young children.

loans.use: To improve her school.

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma B., 47 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Pire Gourèye depuis 7 ans. Elle  s’active dans l’embouche et la vente de légumes (carottes, navets, choux….). Elle veut renforcer ses activités et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Diouma B., 47, married and raising 4 children, has been a member of the village bank of Pire Gourèye for 7 years. She raises livestock and sells vegetables (carrots, turnips, cabbage etc.) She would like to bolster her businesses and improve living conditions for her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables and fattening of livestock

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa has had her own bakery in Zanzibar since 2002. There she bakes breads and other local baked goods for the people all over the Kikwajuni borough. She bakes from 7:00am to 2:00pm daily and is able to make a profit of approximately $30 each month. She is hoping that this loan allows her to buy more ingredients so that she can prepare more bread each month.

Mtumwa is 30 years old, married, and has one 4-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake breads.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 41 años, es soltera no tuvo hijos y vive en la casa de su familia.  Es una mujer luchadora, día a día batalla con las redes de pescar en busca de un mejor porvenir, desde las 5 de la mañana se va a orillas del lago Titicaca para iniciar la pesca,  terminando hasta entrada la tarde.  Le gusta su trabajo, el cual ha venido desarrollándolo desde hace ya 21 años, ganando cierta experiencia en cuanto a la pesca se refiere, la única dificultad que a veces tiene, es no contar con la fuerza necesaria para sacar a todos los peces del agua.  Martina está muy motivada, trabaja arduamente para asegurar su futuro y estabilidad económica. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de materiales; como redes, remos, etc., para poder mejorar la pesca y mejorar la venta de su mercadería. En el futuro, le gustaría tener otro tipo de negocio que estabilice su economía.
texts.en:
Martina is 41 years old, is single and has no children and lives in the house with her family. She is a fighting woman; day after day she battles with the fishing nets in search of a better future, from 5 in the morning she goes to the shores of Lake Titicaca to begin fishing, ending in the afternoon. She likes her work, which has been developing since she was 21 years old, gaining some experience as far as fishing is concerned. The only difficulty is that sometimes, you do not have the necessary strength to remove all the fish from the water . Martina is very motivated, working hard to secure her future and economic stability. With the money requested she will buy larger quantities of materials such as nets, paddles, and so on in order to improve fisheries and increase the sale of her merchandise. In the future, she would like to have another kind of business that stabilizes her economy.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and necessary tools for fishing

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Née le 25 mai 1972 à Aného, Madame L. Kayi est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle fait le commerce d’eau glacée de jus et de pure water qui marche très bien.Afin de mieux rentabiliser son commerce et satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’ augmenter elle sollicite un crédit pour se procurer un nouveau congélateur afin d’en tirer un meilleur profit.Ainsi elle pourra mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in the city of Aného, Ms. Kayi L. is married and the mother of two. There in Aného, she works in commerce involving plastic plates. She is very devoted and struggles greatly in order to be successful. She often buys plates on credit and resells them, which is not so profitable for her. She is requesting a loan to buy goods using cash in order to derive a better profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de  congélateur

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija Velinda de 13 años en la Isla Tata Inti de los Uros.  Es una mujer muy emprendedora, desde hace 20 años ha trabajado en el negocio de la venta de artesanías como souvenirs, y la vestimenta de turistas con los trajes típicos de la zona, se dedica íntegramente a esta labor, ya que tuvo a su hija a muy temprana edad, no contaba con el apoyo de su pareja quien la abandonó al enterarse de su embarazo.  Ahora, su hija Velinda creció y es su principal fuente de apoyo, tanto de forma personal como en el negocio, juntas hacen que tenga éxito. Irma se siente feliz al contar con el apoyo de su hija y poder trabajar al lado de ella.  Su deseo es que su hija tenga un buen futuro, que constituya una familia con todo lo que ella le enseñó.  Con el dinero que Irma obtenga gracias al préstamo, comprará material para elaborar sus artesanías, tejidos, etc., y así aumentar su producción, y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma is 28 years of age. She is a single mother and lives in the Isla Tata Inti de los Uros with her daughter Velinda who is 13 years old. She is a very enterprising woman. For twenty years, she has worked in the business of selling handicrafts as souvenirs and typical clothing from the area for tourists. She wholly devotes herself to this work since she had her daughter at a very young age. She has not relied on the support of her former partner who abandoned her when he found out about her pregnancy. Now, her daughter Velinda has grown and is her main source of support, both personally and in her work. Together they have made it so she has been successful. Irma feels happy, counting on the support of her daughter and being able to work alongside her. Her hope is that her daughter has a good future with a family with everything she that she has taught her. With the money Irma receives thanks to the loan, she will buy materials to make her handicrafts, textiles, etc., and, that way, increase her production and, ultimately, her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculo Group 4

texts.en:
"Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculo" is a group of 20 women, of whom 5 are applying for their first loan. Crucita S. is the group representative. She is an older woman with two older children. When you look at her you can tell she has been through a lot in her life. She has lived in the same community for many years, and for her entire life she has been living day to day without a steady income. She is excited to do something different with her life and is ready to make a change and start to better her life. She hopes to help her children out of their poverty some day as well. 

Crucita plans on opening a small cafe and dreams of having a big coffee shop some day. She and the rest of the group are all ready for the first step towards bettering their lives! On behalf of Crucita, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Open a small cafe

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr:
Madame L. Koko est une dame âgée de 50 ans et résidant à Aného dans le quartier LEGBANOU. Mariée elle a deux personne pratiquement à sa charge, car son mari vieillissant n’a plus de force nécessaire pour mener à bien son métier d’agriculteur.

Courageuse et entreprenante, elle tire ses revenus du commerce de pagnes qui  constitue son activité principale.

Elle désire aujourd’hui renforcer son commerce. Ainsi, elle sollicite un crédit  pour l’achat de pagnes et bijoux. Cela lui permettra de rehausser son revenu et de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Koko L. is a 50 year-old lady, resident of Aného in the LEGBANOU district. A married woman, with an aging husband who no longer has the strength necessary to continue his work as a farmer, she has two persons to take care of. Courageous and entrepreneurial, her main income and primary business comes from the sale of cloths. Today, she would like to strengthen her small business and is thus requesting a credit to purchase cloths and jewellery. This will help increase her income and contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of cloths and jewellery

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.  Esta carismática joven se dedica, desde hace 6 años, a la elaboración, compra y venta de mantas bordadas, recibe pedidos de señoras que le compran su mercadería, para vender a los turistas, no teniendo un horario fijo para su labor, ya que al recibir pedidos, trabaja desde su casa, elaborando sus bordados, los cuales toman tiempo para llegar al acabado final, a veces durante todo el día.  Le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede explotar sus dotes de artista y puede hacerlo desde su casa, la desventaja, es que a veces no puede ella sola con todos los pedidos que su clientela requiere.  Carmen trabaja mucho para su futuro, quiere crecer como persona y como negociante y así cumplir todas sus metas y sueños.  Con el dinero que reciba del préstamo solicitado, comprará materiales para la elaboración de sus bordados y así poder cubrir la demanda de su clientela. Carmen quiere progresar, teniendo un negocio mucho más grande en el futuro y contratar un ayudante para poder cubrir los pedidos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Carmen is 21-years-old and lives in her parents' home. She is a charismatic young lady who has bought, sold, and made embroidered blankets for 6 years. She receives orders from ladies who purchase her merchandise to sell to tourists. She doesn't have a fixed schedule. When she receives the orders, she works from her home to make the blankets, and it takes a long time to produce a finished product, sometimes all day. She likes her job since she can make the most of her talents as an artist and can work from home. The disadvantage is that sometimes she alone can't fill all of the orders that her clientele requires. Carmen works very hard for her future. She wants to grow as a person and a businesswoman and fulfill all of her goals and dreams. With the money that she receives from this loan, she will purchase materials to do her embroidery so she can cover her clientele's demand. Carmen wants to progress and have a much larger business. In the future, she wants to hire an assistant so she can cover all of her requested orders.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to do her embroidery so she can fill all of her orders

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es soltero, tiene 37 años, vive con su hijo de 8 años Jhony.  Desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios, tuvo que  dedicarse a trabajar, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria, es así que hace 5 años, con sus ahorros compra un triciclo, el cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, realizando transporte de pasajeros.  Usualmente trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta entrada la noche  para ganar lo suficiente y mantener a su pequeño Jhony y así cubrir todos sus gastos.  Le gusta mucho su  trabajo, ya que se siente útil al realizarlo y puede conversar y compartir  con la gente que requiere de sus servicios, pero algunas veces, cuando trabaja de noche, las calles se tornan peligrosas, haciendo que esta sea la parte difícil de su trabajo.  El motivo de  tanto esfuerzo es su pequeño, a quien quiere sacar adelante y hacer un hombre de bien.  El dinero del préstamo quiere invertirlo en la reparación de su triciclo, el cual presenta algunas averías y mejorar así, el servicio que presta.  En el futuro Juan quiere comprar un motocarro o poner otro negocio paralelo, y así incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is single, is 37 years of age and lives with his 8 year-old son Jhony. Since he finished high school, he has had to work as he did not have the opportunity to study in the university. It is because of this that, 5 years ago, with his savings, he purchased a three-wheel cart, which he has turned into his primary source of income by transporting passengers. Usually he works from 8 in the morning until the early evening so that he can earn enough to support his little Jhony and that way cover his expenses. He really likes his work and feels useful now that he is doing the work and can talk and share with the people that need his services. But, sometimes, when he works late, the streets become dangerous making this the hard part of his work. The motivation for such effort is his little one, who he wants to get ahead and make a good man. He would like to invest the money from the loan to repair his cart which is damaged and that way improve the service he provides. In the future, Juan wants to buy a three-wheeled motor cart to start another business on the side and that way increase his business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of his three-wheeled cart that he uses to transport passengers

loans.name: Apélété

texts.fr:
Marié et père de quatre enfants, Monsieur D. Apélété est âgé de 50 ans et réside à Aného. En plus de ses enfants, il a deux autres enfants de son frère cadet à charge.

L’élevage de poules pondeuses est son activité principale. Activité d’où il tire ses revenus pour la prise en charge de sa famille.

Aujourd’hui, Monsieur D. Apélété manque de moyens financiers pour le stockage d’aliments pour pondeuse. Il sollicite donc un crédit pour satisfaire son projet. Ainsi, il pourra tirer les revenus nécessaires pour la survie de sa famille et contribuer largement à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Apélété D. is married and the father of four children, he is 50 years old and lives in Aného. In addition to his children, he is in charge of two other children form his younger brother.

His main business is the rearing of laying hens. This activity produces his income to provide for his family. Today, Mr. Apélété D. lacks the financial means to buy feed stock for the laying hens. He is requesting a loan to fulfill his project. This way, he will be able to make the necessary income for the survival of his family and to contribute generously to the schooling of his children.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking of animal feed

loans.name: Livia

texts.es: Livia tiene 47 años, vive con su hijo Rafael de 15 años, es divorciada.  Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de res) de forma ambulatoria por alrededores del estadio de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace ya 20 años, trabajo al cual le  ha puesto mucho empeño y dedicación para poder solventar los gastos de su hijo, el cual requiere mayores gastos por sus estudios.   Livia sale a trabajar desde las 5 de la tarde en la venta de anticuchos y se queda hasta acabar todo lo preparado, usualmente hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, lo dificultoso de su trabajo es la inestabilidad de los precios para adquirir la carne ya que suben frecuentemente, haciendo que tenga que ofrecer sus anticuchos a mayor precio, pero a sabido lidiar con esos pequeños detalles y disfrutar de su trabajo, ya que hace nuevos amigos, que es lo que más le gusta.  Livia trabaja para sacar adelante a su hijo Rafael, quien esta estudiando en la secundaria.  Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar una nueva parrilla para cocinar sus anticuchos y algunas bancas para atender mejor a su clientela.  Quiere  en el futuro, estabilizar su negocio vendiendo en un pequeño snack.
texts.en:
Livia is 47 years of age, lives with her 15 year-old son Rafael, and is divorced. For the last 20 years she has worked in the traveling sale of "anticuchos" (kebabs of beef-heart meat), she has put much effort and dedication into this work to be able to afford her son's expenses who has high expenses costs because of his studies. Livia leaves for work from 5 in the afternoon to sell the "anticuchos" and she stays until she has run out of all she has prepared, usually at about 9 or 10 at night. The difficulty with her work is the instability of beef prices which increase often, making her have to charge more for her "anticuchos." But she knows how to contend with these little details and to enjoy her work. She has made new friends which is something that she likes the most. Livia works to get her son Rafael ahead. He is in high school. With the money that she requests she will be able to purchase a new grill to cook her "anticuchos" and some benches to better serve her clientele. In the future she wants to stabilize her business, selling in a small snack bar.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new grill for the preparation of her "anticuchos" (a type of beef kebab)

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es natural del distrito de Paucarcolla, tiene 29 años, es divorciada y vive con sus hijos Julio  de 8 y Brayan de 3.  Se dedica desde hace ya 16 años, a la venta de pescado, actividad que realiza de forma ambulatoria, acostumbra vender pescado durante las mañanas y parte de las tardes. A Nancy le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que lo ha venido realizando durante mucho tiempo y con él puede mantener a sus dos hijos, pero aun así, el trozar el pescado le resulta dificultoso, pero como ella misma dice, es cuestión de acostumbrarse a esas pequeñas cosas, las que no afectan su ánimo.  El principal objetivo de Nancy es sacar profesionales a sus dos hijos, para que no pasen apuros económicos.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más cantidad de pescado para vender y así aumentar sus ventas.  En el futuro, quiere poner un puesto fijo en algún mercado de la ciudad de Juliaca para estabilizarse y no tener que realizar la venta de forma ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Nancy is from the Paucarcolla district. She is 29 years of age, is divorced, and lives with her 8 year old son Julio and her 3 year old son Brayan. She has worked for 16 years in the traveling sale of fish, usually selling fish during the mornings and part of the afternoons. Nancy really likes her work. Now that she has been selling for so long she is able to support her two children but, even so, the butchering of fish is difficult because, as she herself says, it is an issue of getting used to the small things so that they don't affect your attitude. Nancy's main goal is to for her children to be professionals so that they don't have economic difficulties. With the money from the loan she will buy more fish to sell and that way increase her sales. In the future, she wants to set up a fixed stand in a market in the city of Juliaca to stabilize herself and not have to sell by traveling.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of fish, the product she sells

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo Edwin y sus tres hijos Daniel de 16, Karelyn de 14 y Huber de 4.  Desde hace diez años, Luz se viene dedicando a la atención de su tienda, donde ofrece, productos de belleza, artículos de librería, fotocopias, etc, durante toda la mañana y de 3 a 6 de la tarde, que es donde hay demanda de sus productos.  Luz es abogada de profesión,  pero dada la realidad, no pudo ejercer, y decidió dedicarse al comercio, esta actividad le gusta mucho, ya que la  pequeña tienda que tiene arroja buenos ingresos económicos y le permite mantener a sus hijos y brindarles una buena educación, lo desagradable es tener abastecerse ella sola en la atención, ya que a veces se le hace muy cansado.  Luz trabaja en bien del futuro de sus hijos a los cuales quiere ver triunfar.  Con el dinero que Luz requiere, expandirá su negocio, comprando más mercadería, para que en el futuro su tienda llegue a tener más sucursales.
texts.en:
Luz is 40 years of age. She lives with her husband Edwin and her three children, Daniel who is 16, Karelyn who is 14, and Huber who is 4. For ten years, Luz has worked in her shop where she offers beauty products, stationery, photocopies, etc. She works all morning and from 3 to 6 in the afternoon, when there is a demand for her products. Luz is a lawyer by profession, but given her realities, she was not able to practice and decided to work in business. She really enjoys this work. Since she has been making good earnings from her little store, it allows her to support her children and to provide them with a good education. The unfortunate thing is having to provide all of the services which, at times, makes her very tired. Luz works with the future of her children in mind who she wants to see succeed. With the money that Luz needs, she will expand her shop, buying more merchandise so that in the future her shop will come to have more branches.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Massanvi

texts.fr:
Agée de 70 ans, Madame T. Massanvi est née à KPINNOU et réside actuellement à Aného. Veuve, elle a deux personnes à charge.

Son activité principale étant le maraîchage, elle sollicite un crédit  afin de promouvoir son activité. Sans doute, cela lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Massanvi T., age 70, was born in KPINNOU and currently resides in Aného. She is a widow and has the responsibility of caring for two people. Her main work being in market gardening, she is requesting a loan to advance her business. Without doubt, this will enable her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Market gardening (truck farming)

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia  tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijos.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, siempre ha buscado oportunidades para surgir, hace 3 años decide tener un restaurante campestre, luego de varios años de vender comida de manera ambulante y por la gran solicitud de sus clientes, emprendió este negocio, en el cual está surgiendo rápidamente. Debido a su buena sazón sus platos típicos son un éxito, para ella, cocinar es un placer, la dificultad es cuando no se abastece en atender a sus clientes.  Alicia se esfuerza para que sus dos hijos sigan superándose a través del estudio.  Solicita un préstamo para implementar la infraestructura de su restaurante, en el futuro quiere  ofrecer el servicio de hospedaje  para turistas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 45-years-old and lives with her two children. She is a very hard-working person and has always searched for opportunities to get ahead. Three years ago, she decided to open a countryside restaurant. After several years of selling food as a street vendor and many requests from her customers, she started this business, which is growing quickly. Because of the great flavor with which she makes her food, her traditional dishes are a success. For her, cooking is a pleasure. The difficult part is when she doesn't have enough food in stock to attend to her customers. Alicia works hard so her two children can improve themselves through their studies. She is requesting a loan to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant. In the future, she hopes to offer lodging for tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her restaurant

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 33 años, en la actualidad vive con sus padres y sus dos hijos.  Es unja mujer que se esfuerza cada día en entregar lo mejor de sí en el cuidando de los animales que posee en su pequeña granja, todas las mañanas, muy temprano, sale a cortar la alfalfa que será el alimento para sus  animales, luego limpia su establo. Para Rocío es una buena actividad, ya que le permite poder atender a sus hijos. Después de varios meses de cuidado, los fines de semana, lleva sus animales a la feria ganadera, luego de su comercialización, puede ver los frutos de su arduo trabajo. Adicionalmente, vende la leche que produce su vaca, la que le permite obtener ingresos extras. Su trabajo es le agrada mucho,  por lo cual seguirá dedicándose a esta actividad.  Rocío realiza todos estos esfuerzos para darles a sus hijos lo mejor, en la actualidad, es el único sostén que ellos tienen.  Solicita un préstamo para comprar una vaca más; trabaja, para ver en el futuro, un establo más grande.
texts.en:
Rocío is 33 years of age. She currently lives with her parents and her two children. She is a woman who makes an effort every day to give her very best in the care of animals that she has on her small farm. Each morning, very early, she leaves to cut alfalfa which is food for her animals. Later, she cleans the stable. For Rocío, this is good work since it allows her to take care of her children. After many months of care, on the weekends, she takes the animals to the livestock market. Later, from her sale of the animals, she can see the fruits of her arduous work. Additionally, she sells milk produced by her cow which has allowed her to make extra income. Her work pleases her greatly which is why she will continue doing this work. Rocío works so hard to give her children the best. Currently this is the only support that they have. She asks for a loan to buy another cow. She works, seeing a larger stable in her future.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an additional cow in her work as a rancher

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos.  Tras muchos años D. esfuerzo constante, hace 2 años abre un establecimiento D. venta D. productos alimenticios, su pequeña tienda, está muy feliz, porque esto le permite ser un apoyo más en la economía D. su hogar, por la que Marcelina atienD. diariamente, durante todo el día, para que pueda realizar las ventas que planea. Una dificultad, es la competencia que tiene en su calle, ya que aumentaron las bodegas, por ello, Marcelina se las ingenió para seguir adelante, innovando siempre la forma D. atención y mejorando su tienda.  Además D. esto, junto a su esposo, tiene un carro D. carga que lo alquila, esto también les genera ganancias.  Marcelina trabaja para ofrecer a sus hijos el sustento diario y educación.  Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá adquirir mercadería y también comprar un par D. llantas para su carro D. carga pesada.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 47 years of age, she lives with her husband and her 4 children. After many years of constant effort, two years ago, she opened her small store, an establishment selling foodstuffs. She is very happy because this allows her to help with the household expenses which is why she works every day, all day, so that she can make the sales that she plans to make. One difficulty is the competition she has on her street now that there are more stores. Because of this, Marcelina has devised a way to get ahead by always innovating the form of her service and by improving her store. In addition to this, with her husband, she has a loading cart that she loans out. This also generates earnings. Marcelina works to offer her children daily sustenance and education. She asks for this loan with which she will acquire merchandise and also buy a pair of tires for her heavy loading cart.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her shop and also buy a pair of tires for her loading vehicle.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl tiene 42 años y vive solo.  Trabaja en las labores de la cerrajería, tiene un taller y ofrece servicios de fabricación de puertas, ventanas y demás objetos de metal, con este taller, ya lleva más de un año y medio. Además, también es músico, por lo que todos los fines de semana, realiza presentaciones para todo evento social, es integrante de una banda musical, de esta manera, puede sostenerse y disfruta cada día de lo que realiza, por lo que seguirá adelante.  Su motivación de trabajo es sobresalir y mejorar cada vez, su calidad de vida.   Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá adquirir materiales para su taller, los que servirán para cubrir los pedidos que le soliciten.
texts.en:
Saul is 42 and lives alone. He works in a locksmith's shop and offers services of door and window making and other metal work services, he’s had this shop for more than a year and a half. In addition, he is a musician and every weekend has presentations at social events, he is a member of a band, this way he can support himself, enjoy what he does and get ahead. His motivation to work is to get better and improve his quality of life. He requests this loan, with which he will be able to acquire materials for his shop to carry out future orders.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incrementar los materiales que utiliza en su cerrajería, para el cumplimiento de los pedidos que tiene.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé en 1957, Mme A. Afi est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. En plus de ces derniers, elle a également deux autres enfants de sa sœur aînée à charge. Très dynamique et appréciée dans son quartier pour sa bonne moralité, Mme A. Afi vend les produits de première nécessité et des beignets.
 
La qualité de ses beignets lui a valu une clientèle assez nombreuse. Son chiffre d’affaire étant bas à cause du manque de moyens, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire tout le monde. 

Elle sollicite un crédit pour s'approvisionner en  produits de premières nécessité et en matières premières
texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1957, Afi A. is married and the mother of five children. In addition, she cares for her sister’s two children. Very energetic and known in the neighborhood for her good character, Afi sells the basic necessities and fritters. A large number of customers are drawn to the quality of her fritters, but due to a lack of resources her sales are low and she is unable to meet the demand. Afi is requesting a loan to stock up on merchandise and ingredients.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on basic necessities and ingredients

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.  Desde hace 5 años, trabaja decididamente en administrar su propio negocio que instaló en su propia casa, se trata de una bodega, donde diariamente ofrece productos de pan llevar, se esmera en la atención que ofrece, trata de dar siempre los precios más cómodos para asegurarse la clientela, por ser su local propio, puede percibir mejores ganancias. Rosa está satisfecha por esta labor, porque obtener ingresos económicos y solventar la educación de sus 2 hijos, a veces, lo difícil es cuando el precio de los productos sube, lo que le deja menores ganancias. Rosa se esfuerza porque desea superarse cada día más y también porque la clientela la anima a seguir con este negocio.  Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá invertir en mejorar su bodega, adquiriendo más mercadería, Rosa se ve en el futuro con un negocio emergente, convirtiendo su bodega en un autoservicio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47-years-old and lives with her husband and 2 children. For 5 years, she has worked resolutely at managing her own business, which she started in her own home. It is a grocery store where she offers products daily to her customers. She works very hard to attend to her clients well and tries to offer the most comfortable prices to secure her clientele. Because she has her own location, she can make better profits. Rosa is satisfied with her work because she earns an income and can pay for the education of her two children. At times it is difficult when the prices of the products rise because she earns fewer profits. Rosa works hard because she hopes to improve herself every day and because her clientele motivates her to continue with this business. She is requesting this loan so she can invest in improving her store and acquire more merchandise. Rosa sees herself in the future with an emerging business and converting it into a supermarket.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise in her grocery store.

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Leyla M., es una cliente de nuestra institucion que tiene 45 años de edad, es casada,tiene dos hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad respectivamente, uno cursa el cuarto año de bachillerato y el mayor va iniciar en la universidad, su compañero de vida trabaja como mecanico, uno de sus propositos es seguir siendo cliente de la institucion, para poder ir mejoradno su inventario, su deseo es poder llegar a tener una minidistribuidora y mejorar sus condiciones economicas, su sueño es poder ir creciendo economicamente en su negocio y poder ver a sus hijos con una carrera coronada como profesionales, su deseo es poder realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, por consiguiente darle condicioens de vida a sus familia. En cuanto a su actividad economica ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso y consumo diario del hogar como es una pulperia donde ademas de ofrecer estos productos tambien ofrece cosa de horno un producto tipico de nuestro pais, teniendo cinco años de dedicarse a la pulperia, el cual da inicio como una necesidad en vista que su marido por el tipo de trabajo muchas veces no tiene un ingresos fijo, de ahi surge la idea de poner un negocio que en la actualidad es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos, con el credito pretende adquirir productos como arroz, azucar, detergentes, verdura, gaseosa entre otros productos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leyla M. is45 years old, she is married and hast two children who are 16 and 18 years old, and are studying in school, the oldest one will start university soon. Her life partner works as a mechanic. Her goal is to keep on growing her business and have one day a mini-distribution company and see her children graduating as professionals, and improve her family’s living conditions. She works at her grocery store for the last 5 years and also offers “cosa de horno” (oven thing) a typical dish from Nicaragua. She started this business because her partner’s job sometimes doesn’t bring constant income, so currently her store is their main source of income. The loan she is requesting is to buy products like sugar, detergent, vegetables, and sodas, among other home products.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Mme  A.  Akoua est   née à Kpete  menpeassen au GHANA. Mariée, elle a pour activité l'alimentation générale. Les revenus qu’elle en tire, ne suffisent pas pour la prise en charge de son foyer, son mari étant sans emploi. Etant pratiquement la seule dans son quartier à faire ce commerce les demandes deviennent de plus en plus fortes. 

Elle nécessite alors un crédit pour appuyer et renforcer son commerce d'alimentation générale. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akoua A. was born in Kpete menpeassen in GHANA. She is married and she runs a general food store.
