The income she derives from it is not enough to cover her family's expenses because her husband is unemployed. Being practically the only one in her neighborhood to run this kind of business, the requests are becoming ever stronger.

Thus, she needs a loan to support and strengthen her general food store. This way, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General food store

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 24 años, vive con su madre y su hijo pequeño de 4 años.  Es una joven madre de familia que tiene deseos de superación, hace 3 años, decidió asociarse con su tía  para  atender juntas su restaurante, desde ese entonces, atiende todo tipo de bufetes, de pedidos para eventos sociales y ceremonias diversas. Su trabajo es diario, y lo disfruta, porque le permite disponer de su propio tiempo, además de atender a su hijo, aunque a veces, lo difícil es lavar gran cantidad de platos, después de cada venta en el restaurante.  Mónica trabaja cada día, motivada para dar lo necesario a su pequeño y para que ella misma pueda sostenerse.  Solicita este crédito, con el que podrá cubrir los pedidos de buffet que tiene, ya que primero brinda el servicio y después cobra, por lo que tiene que tener un capital previo. Mónica desea en el futuro tener sucursales de su negocio y expandir su mercado de trabajo.
texts.en:
Monica is 24, lives with her mom and her small 4 year old son. She is a young mother that wishes to get better, three years ago, she joined her aunt to work together in her restaurant, since then, she serves all types of catering, orders for social events and various ceremonies. She works daily and enjoys it, because it allows her to do it on her own time and take care of her son, even though some times it’s hard to wash all the dishes after every meal at the restaurant. She requests this loan, to cover some catering orders because she gets paid after providing the service, reason why she needs the money. Monica wishes to have more locations of her business and expand her sales market.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incrementar su capital de trabajo para el servicio de buffet que ofrece.

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es: Clelia tiene 48 años, vive con sus ancianos padres y sus 2 hijos.   Trabaja  cada día con su propia herramienta de trabajo, que es su máquina fotocopiadora, en un pequeño espacio que alquiló en el centro de la ciudad, todas las mañanas se dirige a su puesto para dedicarse a sacar copias de los pedidos que le hacen, de esta manera, consigue lo que necesita día a día, para conseguir el sustento diario, ya lleva 2 años con esta labor, antes se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, pero las constantes caminatas hicieron que prefiriera cambiar de rubro, a pesar de que este mes la entrada ha sido baja, ella no desespera, porque el resto del año tiene mejores temporadas.  Clelia trabaja de esta forma para poder educar a sus hijos.   Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de papales al por mayor para sus fotocopiados, en un futuro, desea alquilar un stand en un local más céntrico y visible al público.
texts.en:
Clelia is 48-years-old and lives with her elderly parents and 2 children. She works every day with her own tool for work, her photocopier. She goes to a small space that she rented in center of the city every morning where she makes copies that people order from her. In this way, she makes what she needs every day to cover her daily living expenses. She has done this work for 2 years. She used to sell cosmetics, but the constant long walks made her want to change jobs. Even though her income this month has been low, she isn't giving up hope because the rest of the year will be a busier season. Clelia works to be able to educate her children. She is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of wholesale paper for her photocopies. In the future, she hopes to rent a stand in a more central location that is more visible to the public.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of paper for her photocopies

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina tiene 43 años, vive con 3 D. sus 6 hijos y su esposo.  DesD. hace más D. 20 años, se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, nació en una familia netamente agricultora, L. cual fue una formación importante para su vida presente, cultiva L. papa, olluco, mashua, habas y tarwui; adicionalmente, cría animales; como toros y vacas, los hace engordar para luego venderlos, D. esa manera, con estas diversas tareas, sostiene a sus hijos, este trabajo, lo realiza con su esposo y 3 D. sus hijos, Justina y su familia trabajan diariamente, están acostumbrados a estas tareas y no significa para ellos, un gran esfuerzo.  Su motivo constante, es su familia, ya que desea lo mejor para ellos. Con el dinero que solicita, incrementará L. cantidad D. sus animales, comprando 2 toretes y 15 cuyes, además D. 12 sacos D. abono para sus tierras D. cultivo.
texts.en:
Justina is 43, lives with her husband and with three of her six children. For more than twenty years she has worked in agriculture activities, she was born in a farming family, where she learned important things for her present life, she grows potatoes, beans and other root vegetables; in addition she raises livestock such as cattle, which she raises and then sells, this way, with diversified activities she supports her children. Her husband and three children work with her everyday, they are used to this labour work and it doesn’t represent a huge sacrifice for them. Her main motivator is her family, because she wishes the best for them. With the loan requested, she will increase the amount of livestock she has by buying 2 bulls and 15 cuyes (guinea pig) and 12 sacks of fertilizer for the land.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Rosita Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Rosita tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, que cursa el segundo grado de primaria, su compañero de vida es de oficio transportista, su proposito es poder manteniendo su negocio, de esta manera poder persivir sus pròpios ingresos y no estar a la dependencia de la ayuda de su compañero de vida, su mayor deseo es poder llegar a covertir su pequeño negocio en un rancho de comida tipica, donde se oferte un servicio tanto a domicilio como en el establecimiento, su sueño es poder llegar a tener su propia casa ya que en la actualidad vive donde su señora madre, su deseo es pode seguir manteniendo la unionde su familia, poder ayudarle a su señora madre en lo mas que pueda, e ir creciendo en clientes. Actualemnte su actividad economica es la venta de sopa, comida corriente, cerveza y gaseosa, en dicha actividad tiene siete años de dedicarse , dio inicio como una manera de obtener sus propios ingresos y como toda mujer luchadora puso en practica esta idea de negocio que espera poder ir mejorando con la ayuda de los creditos, esperando contar siempre con el apoyo de nuestra institucion y su programas para consolidad su idea de negocio.
texts.en:
Rosita is 37 years old and single. She has a 6-year-old son who is attending the second grade of primary school. Her domestic partner works in the office of transportation. Her goal is to be able to maintain her business and thereby be able to continue providing her own income and not be dependent upon her domestic partner. She very much wants to be able to convert her small store into a local eatery. Here she would make her clients feel as much at home as at a business. Her dream is to be able to have her own home given that she now lives with her mother. She wants to keep her family together, to be able to help her elderly mother as much as possible, and to keep growing her clientele. Her business actually consists of sales of soup, fast foods, beer and soft drinks. She has dedicated herself to her business for seven years. She started in the business as a way to generate her own income, and like all women with a fighting spirit, put her business ideas into practice. She hopes to continue improving with the assistance of loans, hoping to always count on Kiva field partner Fundación Leon 2000 and its programs.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 33 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.    Es una persona muy  trabajadora, por ello, hace más de 2 años, decide vender todo tipo de accesorios para damas; como aretes, pulseras, monederos, carteras y maletas de distintos precios, en un inicio, salía diariamente a recorrer las calles principales de la ciudad, pero en la actualidad, por su bebé, solo sale los fines de semana, este es un negocio rentable, además que la mercadería no es perecible como los alimentos y no necesita de preparación previa, ya que solo es comprar al por mayor su mercadería, por lo que Jessica está muy animada de seguir en este rubro, su mayor dificultad es cuando no consigue un lugar estable para poder vender, por la cual seguirá ahorrando para tener su propio espacio comercial.  Jessica realiza todos estos esfuerzos para ayudar en el sostén económico de su hogar, para que sus pequeños tengan un futuro estable.  Con el préstamo, viajará para adquirir más mercadería, que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias, su meta es ser una gran comerciante, hasta ser proveedora de accesorios para mujer.
texts.en:
Jessica is 33, she lives with husband and two children. She is a very hardworking person, more than two years ago, she decided to sell accessories for women; such as earrings, bracelets, wallets, purses and bags of different prices. At the beginning she went out to sell everyday in the main streets of the city, but now, with her baby, she only goes out to sell on weekends. This is a profitable business, with merchandise that is not perishable and doesn’t need previous work, such as food, she only has to purchase the merchandise. Jessica is very willing to keep this type of business, the most difficult part is not having a stable location to sell, for which she will keep saving to afford her own store location. Jessica makes all these efforts to help with the expenses of her home, for her little ones to have a stable future. With the loan, she will travel to purchase merchandise and have more income. Her goal is to be a great vendor and become a supplier of women accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rose Namiti's Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 32-year-old married woman with 3 children, aged between 14 and 10. All of the children go to school. She resides in and rents a single-room house, where she is staying with 5 people. Rose doesn't take care of any additional family members. They do have electricity but no piped water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. Rose resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Rose operates a bar in Namungoona, one of the city suburbs. She purchases from suppliers who purchase from the villages. Rose works 7 days a week and rents her business premises. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, electricity, medication, food, and school fees. Rose sells to an average of 20 customers daily and sells both wholesale and retail. She has been with MCDT for 3 years and is servicing her eighth loan. She wants to invest this loan in this business. Rose is aspiring to build her own commercial room and stop renting.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Jacob

texts.fr:
Né à Aného en 1966, Mr d’ALMEIDA est marié et père de 04 enfants. Résident à Kpémé , il exerce le métier de mécanicien chauffeur. Son  sérieux dans le travail lui a valu la confiance d’un client qui lui a confié  sa voiture pour faire le transport  en commun (taxi). Le salaire qu’il perçoit de ce job étant médiocre, il n’arrive pas  à subvenir aux besoins essentiels de sa famille. 
        '
Son rêve aujourd’hui est de pouvoir bénéficier au maximum des atouts et faveurs de ce métier de  chauffeur de taxi qui est très prometteur dans le milieu.
  
Il sollicite alors un crédit  pour réaliser son projet qui pourra l'aider à améliorer son revenu et mieux prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Aného in 1966, Mr. D. is married and the father of four. A resident of Kpémé, he works in the driver-mechanic trade. His serious attitude towards work has earned him the confidence of a customer who has entrusted him with his car for use as a taxi. Because the salary he receives from this job is mediocre, he is unable to meet the essential needs of his family. Today, his dream is to be able to maximize the assets and added benefits of working as a taxi driver which is very promising in the locale. He is therefore requesting a loan to realize his project that will help him improve his income and to care for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Union Hace La Esfuerza Group 8

texts.en: This is a group of 10 women looking to receive loans to help grow and start their own business. This is 10 women from a larger group of 30. Katiana is the representative and leader of this group. Katiana is a very energetic 22 year old who wants to get a early start on bettering her life. She does not have any children, which is abnormal for her age in the area she lives. She also is not married, but told me she feel like she has kids because she has young brothers and sisters she takes care of. She is a very hard working women, and is extremely excited to have her own business. She is ready for this new challenge, and she is excited to call the business her own, and have something to work for. On behalf of Katiana, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!!

loans.use: Perfume Sales

loans.name: Soedinou

texts.fr:
Né à Agbodrafo en 1974 Mr A. Soedinou est marié et père de 03 enfants. Il a quitté très tôt les bancs de l’école  car ses parents ne pouvaient plus supporter les frais de l’écolage. Le métier de menuiserie qu’il a apprit lui a permis de vivre jusqu’alors.
       
Sa famille étant grandissante il n’arrive plus à subvenir à leurs besoins essentiels .Le commerce de planches étant une activité qui rapporte beaucoup en ce moment, il décida de se lancer dedans afin  de pouvoir joindre les deux bouts.
        
Il sollicite alors un crédit pour l’achat et vente de planches. Cela lui permettra certainement d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Agbodrafo in 1974, Mr. Soedinou A. is a married father of three. He quit school very early, because his parents weren’t able to pay for his schooling. He learned woodworking, which has been his livelihood. He is no longer able to provide for the essential needs of his growing family. The business of selling planks is currently strong, and he has decided to get into this business to be able to join the two ends. He seeks this loan to buy and sell planks. This will certainly allow him to improve the conditions of his family’s life.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy and sell planks

loans.name: Ayéle

texts.fr:
Agée de 36 ans, G. Ayéle  est une femme qui se bat pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et surtout pour veiller à l’éducation de ses enfants .Très appréciée dans son quartier,  elle se  lança dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires.
      
Les maigres revenus qu’elle en tire s’avèrent insuffisants  pour la prise en charge de ses enfants  du fait du manque de moyens pour améliorer qualitativement et quantitativement ses produits de ventes. 
      
Elle a vivement besoin d’un crédit pour rehausser son chiffre d’affaire et pouvoir offrir à ses enfants une éducation scolaire et professionnelle qu’elle même n’a jamais pu recevoir.
texts.en:
Ayéle G., 36, is a woman who struggles to support her family and especially to see to the education of her children. Greatly esteemed in her neighborhood, she has opened a shop selling foodstuffs.

The meager income that she makes from her shop proves insufficient to care for her children because she lacks the means to improve her inventory either qualitatively or quantitatively.

She greatly needs a loan to raise her turnover so that she can offer her children an education, both in school and for a profession, something she herself was not able to have.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Hasfa Nalugya's Group

texts.en:
Hasfa is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is 29 years old and divorced with 2 children, aged 10 and 5 years, who go to school. She rents a two roomed house where she stays with five people and takes care of her brother and his daughter. She gets some financial assistance from her former husband to look after the children. They have electricity, but no piped water at home. The family gets four meals a day.

Hasfa resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells farm produce in the market in Kasubi, one of the city suburbs. She uses public transport and purchases farm produce from the villages. Hasfa works seven days a week and incurs small transport costs for transportation of food for her customers' convenience. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, electricity, medication, food and school fees. Hasfa sells to an average of 30 customers daily. She has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her seventh loan for a small eating joint. She wants to invest this loan in her business and aspires to see her business expand.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, Mme A. Adjo est née à Aného et réside dans le quartier dégbenou . Agée de 32 ans environ elle fait le commerce d'alimentation générale.

 Les revenus de son mari étant insuffisants pour la prise en charge de  leur foyer, Adjo décida d’aider son mari à travers les maigres bénéfices qu’elle réalise. Elle pourra gagner un peu plus d’argents si son chiffre d’affaire était un peu plus haut 
     
A. Adjo  sollicite donc un crédit pour mieux s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi elle aidera son mari dans la gestion de leur foyer.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of two children, Adjo A. was born in Aného and lives in the Dégbenou district. She is 32 years old and in the grocery business. As her husband’s income is not sufficient to support the household, Adjo decided to assist him by means of the small profit she makes. She would be able to earn a bit more money if her turnover were a little higher. Adjo is requesting a loan in order to stock up on merchandise for the purpose of better meeting her customers’ needs and increasing her income. In that way she will help her husband to support their household.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Yaricza Ivania

texts.es: La señora Yaricza Pérez tiene la edad de 29 años habita en el km. 21 carretera a Masaya junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos los cuales estudian en primaria y el marido de la señora trabaja como chofer para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa. La señora Pérez trabaja en cobranza ya que su papá  tiene buses que hacen recorrido y se encarga del dinero pues para ella es de gran ayuda la que le brinda la familia al darle este trabajo pues a veces el bus se llena de pasajero,  otras veces va vació, y abecés es poco lo que le pagan pues no tiene una cuota fija, a parte de que las carreteras están bastantes malas, y hay que hacer otros gastos en las unidades de trasporte. Con la solicitud del préstamo doña  Yaricza quiere hacer anexo a  su vivienda ya que esta es  pequeña. A futuro es poder tener una pulpería en su casa, hacer más grande su vivienda, y apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yaricza P. is 29-years old and lives off Highway 21 to Masaya with her husband and two children who are studying in primary school. Yaricza’s husband works as a chauffeur to help with the expenses of the house. Mrs. P. works in collections as her dad has a tour bus and she’s in charge of collecting money, which is a big help to the family, because sometimes the bus is packed to capacity, other times it’s empty, and earnings are low as there is no fixed rate. Portions of the road are bad enough and often require other expenses just for transportation. With this loan, Yaricza wants to make improvements to her house as it is small and in bad condition. In the future, she would like to own a shop in her home, have a bigger home, and support her children with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to her house

loans.name: Karla Banessa

texts.es: La señora Karla Banessa  U. Pérez  tiene la edad de 31 años, habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijo los  niños están estudiando la secundaria, su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como  conductor de las rutas urbanas de la capital de Managua. Mientras ella se dedica a su negocio  que es la venta de ropa nueva y usada  tiene más de quince años de experiencias en las ventas de ropa, lo cual hasta ahora le ha ido bien, inicio con dinero propio que su esposo le dio. Con la solicitud de préstamos es para comprar inventario de ropa variada para niños y adultos. A futuro sus sueños es llegar a tener un tienda en la cual pueda ofrecerle al cliente las variedades de productos, a si como captar mas clientes, y hacer mejoras a su vivienda, como apoyar en los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Banessa U. P. is 31-years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe, with her husband and child who is studying in secondary school. Her husband works as a bus driver for the urban routes in the capital city of Managua. Karla is dedicated to her business of selling new and used clothes and thus far it is going well, with the money her husband has given her. With this loan she would like to buy an inventory of clothes for both children and adults. In the future, she dreams of owning her own store where she can offer her customers a variety of products, and attract more clients. She would also like to make home improvements and support her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children and adult clothes

loans.name: Yohana

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, madame Y.  Yohana est mariée et a 05 personnes à charge. Etant donné que les charges de son ménage augmente au jour le jour, ses maigres revenus de vente de  produits de beauté et divers ne lui permettent plus de subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants.

C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit  pour augmenter son pouvoir d'achat afin de maximiser son bénéfice et d’assurer une meilleure condition de vie aux membres de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yohana Y., age 43, is married and has five persons to support. Since the daily expenses of her household gets higher day by day, the meager revenue she makes from selling beauty products and various items, do not enable her anymore to provide for the basic needs of her children. This is why she's seeking a loan to increase her purchasing power, in order to maximize her profits and to insure better living conditions to the members of her household.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and various other items

loans.name: Nubia Elvira

texts.es:
La Sra. Nubia tiene 43 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, casada y con tres hijos mayores de edad de 18, 22, y 28 años, los cuales ya trabajan y apoyan en los gastos, su esposo trabaja independiente como albañil y abecés también trabaja por contratos es un trabajo que desgasta físicamente pero genera buenas ganancias. Doña Nubia su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos tiene cinco años de experiencias en las ventas, e inicio con fondos propios para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos hasta ahora le ha ido bien, pero desea surtir mas el negocio, con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la compra de mercadera de ropa y zapato, comprar variedad de estilo para grandes y chicos.
A largo plazo es crecer en su negocio, y poder vender otros productos a si como captar más clientes, y  ayudar a sus nietos con su educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nubia is 43-years old and lives in the South Laureles neighborhood of the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is married with three children of the legal age of 28, 22 and 18-years old, who are already working and helping with the family expenses. Her husband is an independent mason who works on contracts that are physically straining but generate good profits. Mrs. Nubia has five years of experience in her business of selling clothes and shoes, that she started with her own funds and with the help of her husband they have managed their expenses well, though she desire to gain more business. With this loan request Mrs. Nubia will invest in the purchase of clothing and shoe stores and purchase a variety of styles for adults and children. In the long term, she would like to grow her business and be able to sell other products to attract more clients. Also, she would like to help her grandchildren with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for children and adults

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 37 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, por lo que vive sola.  Es natural  de la Isla Flotante “Los Uros”, se ha venido dedicando a elaborar artesanías desde hace ya 27 años, para poder solventar sus gastos económicos.  Es independiente, ya que aún no ha decidido formar una familia, esto ha hecho que se dedique íntegramente a su trabajo de elaborar y vender artesanías para los turistas que frecuentan esta Isla. Empieza desde las 7 de la mañana arma el puesto donde ofrecerá las artesanías que elabora, hasta las 6 o 7 de la noche, que es cuando se oculta el sol, a Hilda le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le gusta intercambiar conocimientos con los turistas que frecuentan su isla.   Hilda quiere seguir trabajando para alcanzar todos sus sueños y quien sabe, formar una familia.  Con el dinero del préstamo, quiere comprar material para elaborar sus artesanías y en un futuro expandir su negocio, para poder mantener viva la cultura de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Hilda is 37, single with no children, she lives alone. She is originally from the “Los Uros” island, where she has made crafts for more than 27 years to be able to support herself. She is independent, since she hasn’t decided to form a family, this allows her to concentrate on her work and sell more crafts to tourists that visit the island. She starts at 7 a.m. with the stand where she will offer the crafts she made herself and stay until 6 or 7 p.m., when the sun sets. Hilda really likes her job; she enjoys exchanging knowledge from tourists that visit the island. Hilda wants to keep working to achieve her dreams and who knows, maybe form a family. With the money from the loan, she will buy material for the crafts and in the future, she wants to expand her business, to support the culture of her town.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make local crafts

loans.name: Mady

texts.es: Mady es natural del pueblo de Urcos, tiene 32 años, es soltera, vive sola en la casa de sus padres.  Al no poder estudiar la secundaria, desde muy joven, se ha dedicado a trabajar en diversidad de oficios, hasta que hace ocho años, incursiono en la venta de emoliente (mates calientes ) en su triciclo, de manera ambulatoria, negocio que le ha funcionado bien hasta ahora y del que ha obtenido muchas gratificaciones.  Mady trabaja desde que sale el sol, vende emoliente a las personas que empiezan su jornada a primeras horas del día,  hasta promedio de las 9 de la mañana, tiempo en el cual la demanda disminuye, volviendo a reincorporarse al trabajo a las 5 de la tarde, hasta las 10 de la noche.  Los más difícil, es trabajar en el imperante frió que hace por las mañanas y las noches, pero son limitaciones pequeños a comparación de las gratificaciones que recibe, como las amistades que hace, gracias a su trabajo.  Mady trabaja muy duro para poder tener una estabilidad económica que le ayude a realizar sus sueños y metas.  Con el dinero que solicita comprara más utensilios y algunas sillas o bancas para poder mejorar la atención de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mady is originally from Urcos, she is 32, single and lives alone in her parent's house. Not being able to go to highschool, at a very young age, she had been working in different activities, until 8 years ago, when selling hot drinks in her three-wheeled bike, the business has worked until now and from which she has obtained many satisfactions. Mady starts working when the sun rises, she sells hot drinks for people from the beginning of the day, until about 9 a.m. then the demand slows down and she starts work again from 5 to 10 p.m. The hardest part, is to work with cold weather that is felt in the mornings and evenings, but those are small limitations compared to the satisfaction she gets and the friends she makes through work. Mady works really hard to have economic stability that helps her achieve her dreams and goals. With the loan requested she will buy utensils, benches or chairs and pay better attention to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase utensils and furniture for business

loans.name: Neo Club Group

texts.fr:
Créé en 2004, l’association NEO-CLUB est un groupe de sonorisation très sollicité dans le canton d’Aklakou et de ses environs lors des manifestations aussi bien heureuses (anniversaires, baptêmes, sortie de nouveau né, fêtes….) que malheureuses (décès). 

Cependant l’association ne dispose pas de véhicule pour assurer le transport des matériels de sonorisation. Ainsi, les dépenses occasionnées par la location de véhicule ne permettent pas aux membres de NEO-CLUB de dégager beaucoup de bénéfice devant leur permettre d’améliorer leur niveau de vie.

C’est pour plus de rentabilité de son activité qu’elle sollicite un crédit afin de se procurer de moyens de transport.
texts.en:
Created in 2005 in Aklakou in Togo, the group MIAWOGNOIN has 6 members. Its goal is to facilitate the access to credit and improve living conditions for its members.

In response to the ardent wishes of its members, the group has requested a loan that will serve as funds for making small loans to those members. Please note that since the creation of the group, they have never failed to make a repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: access to credit for utility services

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: La dame Absa D. est mariée, mère de 05 enfants avec 06 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle tient une petite boutique de vente de divers articles et souhaiterait augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer ses condition de vie et de subvenir aux nombreuses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Absa D. is married, the mother of five children, and has six more under her care. She has a small shop where she sells various items and she would like to increase her sales. This business would enable her to raise their standard of living and to meet their many daily expenses.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and retail sale of various products in a small shop

loans.name: Miawognoin Group

texts.fr:
Créé en 2005 à Aklakou au TOGO, le groupement MIAWOGNOIN compte trois membres. Il a pour objectifs de faciliter l’accès au crédit et d’améliorer les conditions de vie  de ses membres.

Pour répondre à la forte demande de ses membres, il sollicite un crédit qui servira  de fonds de crédit à ses membres. Soulignons que depuis sa création, le groupement n’a jamais enregistré d’impayé.
texts.en:
Created in 2005, in Aklakou, Togo, the MIAWOGNOIN group is composed of three members. Their goal is to facilitate access to credit and to improve the family living conditions of its members. To meet the strong demand of its members, the group is requesting a loan that will serve as funds for lending to its members. Let's emphasize that, since its creation, the group's records show it has never missed a payment.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Access to credit for general services

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira tiene 42 años de edad,  habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Reconciliación, tiene  cuatro hijos de 1,15, 20 y 21 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad, el negocio de doña Yadira es la venta de de perfumes, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos, tiene siete años de experiencia en las ventas e inicio con dinero propio con ayuda de su esposo y su hijo. Con la solicitud del préstamo lo quiere para infraestructura pues su deseo es hacer mejoras a un cuarto para alquilarlo y así tener otros ingresos, para eso desea comprar materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, hierro. A largo plazo es hacer mejoras en la infraestructura del negocio, comprar vitrinas para que los productos estén mas alusivos a los clientes, también desea tener mas inventario, que le generen mas ganancias, ayudar a sus hijos con la educación de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yadira is 42-years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She has four children ages 1, 15, 20 and 21 and her husband works as a security guard. Mrs. Yadira has a business where she sells perfumes, cosmetics, clothes and shoes. With the help of her husband and children, she has been in business for the past seven years. With this loan request, she wants to make improvements as she desires to build a better room to rent as another form of income. She will need construction materials like: sand, cement and iron. A future goal would be to make improvements to the business, purchase showcases for very allusive products, build up a sizeable inventory and generate more profits. Additionally, Mrs. Yadira also wants to help her children with their educational studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and make a room

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa N. est mariée, sans enfant mais elle a en charge 03 membres de sa famille proche.
Elle s’active dans l’achat et la revente de poisson frais. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt augmenter son capital afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Awa N. is married and has no children, but she is responsible for three close relatives.

She works at buying and selling fresh fish. She hopes with this loan to add to her working capital so that she can improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of fish and re-sale

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou D. est une femme mariée, mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut, avec ce prêt financer un commerce d’habillement. Elle souhaite acheter en gros et revendre en petit détail spécialement des tissus, quelques chaussures et des sacs à main, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Bintou D. is a married woman and the mother of 4 children. She wants to use this loan to sell clothing. She would like to buy wholesale and sell retail, especially cloth, some shoes and some handbags, which will allow her to increase her earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth and various other items such as shoes and handbags

loans.name: Fabineta

texts.fr: La dame Fabinta N. est mariée, mère de 05 enfants avec 02 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour améliorer son activité de vente et de confection de divers parfum (de chambre). Ce financement lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille et ainsi d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fabineta N. is married and the mother of 5 children with 2 other dependents for whom she is responsible. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business selling and making and selling various sorts of room deodorizers. This loan will permit her to help pay the daily expenses of her family and thus improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase, fabrication, and sale of room deodorizers

loans.name: Ndague

texts.fr: Ndague S. est une femme mariée, mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle veut prêt pour augmenter son capital. Elle s’active déjà dans le commerce de légumes sur petit étal au marché. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndague S. is a married woman and the mother of three children, whom she supports as well as herself. Active in commerce in vegetables and already having a small display at the marketplace, she wants a loan to increase her capital. Her objective is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy in bulk and resell various vegetables

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Florence G., célibataire sans enfant est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Rural depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter de l’huile de palme et du citron pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Florence G., single and without children, has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba Rural for 2 years. She wants a loan to buy palm oil and lemons to bolster her business. Her earnings allow her to improve her living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of palm oil and lemons

loans.name: Oulèye

texts.fr: Oulèye B., 41 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Centre depuis 5 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des produits comme le tabac, l’huile, la pâte d’arachide et des oignons pour renforcer son petit commerce. Elle a une étale au marché de Grand Dakar. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer une partie des charges familiales. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Oulèye B., 41, married and responsible for 4 children, has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Centre for 5 years. She wants a loan to buy such products as tobacco, oil, peanut butter, and onions to bolster her little business. She has a table at the market of Grand Dakar. Her earnings allow her to help out with family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables, tobacco, oil, peanut butter, and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Ramona Justina's Group

texts.es: La señora Ramona es una señora de 58 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos menores de edad, ya estan casados, su esposo es taxista. Su proposito es poder continuar trabajando, mantener su actividad economica que es lo que le ha ayudado a salir adelante con su familia,Su actividad economica es la venta de carne en su casa de habitacion hasta donde llegan los proveedores a entregarle dicho producto, en esta actividad tiene mas de 20 años de desarrollarla, la cual se ha quedado ejerciendo desde que inicio como producto de la necesidad de tener un empleo y en ese momento las condicones se lo permitian ya que su esposo es matarife es decir trabajo en el rastro municipal de la localidad en el destace de res, y vio una alternativa de ayudar y mantener un empleo. En la actualidad tiene ademas de la venta de carne en su domicilio tambien es propieatria de una unidad de transporte taxi que es la que opera su esposo. Doña Ramona es una mujer emprendedora y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de los diferentes programas que le puedan hacer realidad sus ideas como microempresaria
texts.en:
Ramona is 58 years old and married without any young children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her goal is to be able to continue working, maintaining the economic activity that has helped her family to get ahead. The aforementioned economic activity consists of meat sales from her home, which is where suppliers deliver her product to her. She has more than 20 years of experience in this field,which she began doing out of the necessity to be employed. At the time, her husband was a "matarife," or a person who worked in the town's cattle headquarters, and she saw an alternative means of helping him and also maintaining employment. In reality, she does more than just sell meat from her home. She is also the owner of a taxi transport unit that her husband operates. Ramona is an enterprising woman and hopes to continue counting on the help of various programs that can make her microindustrialist ideas a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mariama Néné

texts.fr: Mariama Néné Dramé, 44 ans, mariée, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Centre depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des légumes, des arachides, haricots, oignons, pommes de terre et des denrées alimentaires diverses sur une étale au marché de Grand Dakar. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer une partie des charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Mariama Néné Dramé, age 44, is married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Boucotte Centre for five and a half years. Her work consists of buying and selling vegetables, peanuts, beans, onions, potatoes, and various grocery items. She displays her merchandise at the Grand Dakar marketplace. Her income enables her to ensure that a portion of the family expenses is covered. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell vegetables and various groceries

loans.name: Xiomara De Jesus

texts.es: la Sra. Xiomara tiene tres hijos, de 16,18 y 20 años de edad, los cuales los tres estudian, tiene 40 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte,  es madre soltera pues le ha tocado esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos con los estudios, logro poner una pulpería desde hace seis años con dinero propio, luego comenzó a prestar en Afodenic y este solicitud que esta haciendo es la sétima pues desea comprar inventario para la pulpería, surtir de productos de consumo, también desea  surtir de cosmético y productos escolares ya que se venden bastante, y de esta manera captaría mas clientes pues, ha sido de gran beneficios los préstamo ya que ha podido salir adelante con su negocio. A largo plazo es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida para poder dar los estudios a sus tres hijos ya que seria un orgullo y sastifacion de madre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara has three children who are 16, 18 and 20-years old, who are all studying in school. She is 40-years old and lives in the North Laureles neighborhood of the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. As a single mother she has struggled much to push her children to study. She has successfully run her store for the past six-years with her own funds and now has started requesting from Afodenic. And with this seventh request, she would like to purchase an inventory of supplies: supplies for consumer products, cosmetics, school supplies at a fair price, so as to attract more clients. These loans have been a great benefit as Mrs. Xiomara has been able to move her business forward. Her long term goals are to improve the infrastructure of the business and to have better living conditions for her three children to study as it would give her much pride and satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and baisc grains for her shop

loans.name: Armenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria Armenia del Socorro Pérez Montalván tiene 48 años de edad es casada con dos hijos que estudian en primaria y secundaria en esta ciudad de Bluefields. Esta microempresaria tiene desde hace 15 años  una pulpería la cual ha ido surtiendo poco a poco y la que le sirve para sufragar parte de los gastos de estudios y alimentación de la casa. Habita en uno de los barrios más viejo de esta ciudad llamado Nueva York. La microempresaria manifiesta que uno de los productos que mas se venden es el carbón el cual se utiliza para como combustible para la preparación de los alimentos.

También los titiles de pollo ya que son un poco mas barato que el pollo mismo y otro producto que es muy comprado es el coco el cual se utiliza para darle sabor a las comidas típicas de la región.

Sin embargo requiere se le financie para comprar lo siguiente: 

2 Quintales de arroz americano a US$ 48 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a US$ 33 dólares cada quintal, 2 bidón de aceite a US$ 35 dólares cada bidón, 50 libras de pollo entero a US$ 1.90 dólares cada libra, 50 libras de titil de pollo a US$ 1.20 dólares cada libra, 5 cajillas de huevos a US$ 3.00 dólares cada cajilla, 6 bolsones de papel higiénicos a US$ 8.00 dólares cada bolsón, 20 sacos de carbón a US$ 10.00 dólares cada saco, 50 unidades de cocos a US$ 1.20 dólares cada coco,  y  100 plátanos a US$ 0.40 dólares cada plátano.
texts.en:
Armenia del Socorro Pérez Montalván, a small business owner, is a 48-year-old married mother of two school age children in the city of Bluefields. This small business owner has run a general store for 15 years. She has been stocking the store little by little, and it helps her defray some of the costs of education and of food for the household. She lives in one of the oldest neighborhoods in the city, called Nueva York. The small business owner says that one of her most popular products is charcoal, which is used in preparing meals. Other popular items are chicken gizzards—since they are cheaper than chicken itself—and coconuts, which are used to add flavor to the regional dishes. Nevertheless, she needs funds in order to purchase the following: two 100-pound sacks of American rice at $48.00 USD each, two 100-pound sacks of sugar at $33.00 USD each, 2 drums of cooking oil at $35.00 USD each, 50 pounds of whole chicken at $1.90 USD a pound, 50 pounds of chicken gizzards at $1.20 USD a pound, 5 boxes of eggs at $3.00 USD each, 6 large packs of bathroom tissue at $8.00 USD each, 20 sacks of charcoal at $10.00 USD each, 50 coconuts at $1.20 USD each, and 100 bananas at 40 cents each.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, chicken gizzards, eggs, bathroom tissue, charcoal, coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta Cissé, 42 ans, mariée, 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Alwar CMT depuis 6 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter de l’huile de palme et aller le revendre à Dakar ou elle dispose d’une clientèle très fidèle. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Fanta Cissé, 42, married with 2 children, has been a member of the village bank of Alwar CMT for 6 years. She wants a loan to buy palm oil to bring to Dakar for re-sale since she has a faithful clientele there. Her earnings allow her to improve living conditions for her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of palm oil

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Auxiliadora D., tiene 65 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos a su cargo, sus tres hijos ya estan casados, no tiene compñaero de vida. La actividad economica de doña Auxiliadora es un pequeño taller de costura el cual tiene mas de 44 años de ejercer, y es a traves del mismo que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes le ayuan y le apoyan en sus proyectos, sin dejar a un lado el crediro que es con los cuales ha salido adelante, Su proposito es poder continuar sirviendo a su clientela, su mayor sueño poder acondicionar dicho taller y ser reconocida como una modista . Su deseo es poder llegar aadquirir una maquina industrial de esta manera darle un mejor acabado a los trajes que confecciona. Doña Auxiliadora da inicio en este negocio desde muy joven ya que su mamá le enseño este oficio. con el credito adquirio tela, hilos, entretelas es decir materia prima relacionado con su taller de costura.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora D. is 65 years old, lives alone, and has no children currently in her care. Her three children are grown and married, and she has no domestic partner. In terms of economic activity, she has a small sewing shop which she has run for 44 years. It is through this shop that she has been able to get ahead financially for her children, who have helped her and supported her in her projects, and without letting her loan obligations lapse. Her goal is to be able to continue serving her clientele. Her greatest hope is to have air conditioning for the shop and to be recognized as a seamstress. She would like to be able to acquire an industrial machine in order to be able to give the suits she makes a professional finish. Auxiliadora started in this business at a very young age given that her mother taught her the trade. With this loan, she will buy material, thread, and other raw materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 48 años de edad, casada y con cinco hijos mayores de edad, de 14, 21, 22,26 y 27 años de edad, tres son independientes y están casados y dos estudiando, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Reconciliación de la Kativo 8 c al sur, su esposo trabaja y se desempeña como supervisor de vigilancia. Doña Maria vende joyas y ropa de segunda desde hace nueve años esta en las ventas inicio con dinero que su esposo le dio, lo cual ha podido hacer crecer su negocio y captar sus clientes pues la ropa de segunda de vende bastante mas la de niño. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar ropa nueva y joyas ya que tiene muchos encargos pues da al crédito y al contado. A futuro desea tener mejores condiciones para invertir más en su negocio a si  como ayudar a sus hijos que estudien.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children of ages 14, 21, 22, 26, and 27. Three of her children are married and living independently, and two of them are students. She lives in a neighborhood of the capital called Villa Reconciliacion de la Kativo 8 south. Her husband works and acts as the community security supervisor. Maria has sold jewelry and second-hand clothes for nine years. Her business was started with money that her husband gave her and enabled her to grow the business and gain customers that prefer second-hand children's clothes. The purpose of this loan is to buy new clothes and jewelry and she already has many orders to use the credit and cash. Her desire for the future is to have a better ability to invest in her business so that she can support her children while they study.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry and clothes

loans.name: Aramata

texts.fr: Aramata Mané, 39 ans, mariée, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Alwar CMT depuis 6 ans. Elle compte avec ce prêt renforcer son commerce d’huile de palme, citron, nététou et autres produits forestiers. Elle va se ravitailler en Guinée Bissau et revendre à Dakar. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Aramata Mané, 39, is married and raising 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Alwar CMT for 6 years. She hopes to use this loan to bolster her little business of palm oil, lemons, nététou(a condiment made from tree seeds) and other forest products. She is going to do her purchasing in Guinée Bissau and sell in Dakar. Her income will permit her to improve her living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be reinbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of palm oil and other forest products

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres D. Fe" (Women of Faith) is a new group of 10 women who are all living in extreme poverty and don't have steady incomes. Maxima M., the representative of this group, is the mother of 3 children, who are her main concern. She wants a better life for her children more than anything else in the world.

Maxima plans on taking her loan and starting a small business selling used clothing. She also loves to paint and wants to try and sell her paintings as well. Her goal is to have a thriving business, and she dreams of being able to travel. This group is all excited about this new challenge and opportunity! On behalf of Maxima, the group, and Esperanza International------- Thank you for your support!!!!

loans.use: Start a used-clothing business

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
La señora Aida, socia del Grupo del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Región San Martín,  provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos y confección de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el Jr.  Apolonia S/N, Barrio el Porvenir, en este lugar es donde elabora los quesos para luego salir a repartir en el mercado de la ciudad. Igualmente sus confecciones las vende de manera ambulatoria a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares.  Se inicia en el negocio porque le gusta manejar su propio capital.  

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará madera para la confección de moldes para quesos, leche en cantidades, así como telas de diversos colores, hilos, elásticos, blondas, etc., además de todo lo que necesita para la preparación de sus productos y confecciones para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. 

Aida tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus actividades. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante su negocio. Desea, más adelante, implementar y mejorar los ambientes con una mesa donde preparar los quesos ya que depende de la presentación de su local y de sus productos para hacerse muy conocida.
texts.en:
Aida, a member of the Virgen del Rosario communal bank group, lives in the San Martín region in Bellavista province and district. She devotes her time to the manufacture and sale of cheese and the sewing of articles of clothing. The business is located in her home in the Apolonia neighborhood of Provenir district. This is where she produces the cheese for later distribution in the city marketplace. She also sells what she sews door-to-door to her neighbors, friends and relatives. Aida began this business because she likes to have money of her own. With this loan of $400 (1200 nuevos soles), which will be repaid within six months, she will buy wood to make cheese molds, milk in bulk, as well as fabric in various colors, thread, elastic, lace, etc.—everything she might need for the manufacture or construction of products to meet the customer demand. Aida is 53 years old, and lives with her husband, who assists with her endeavors. She is a very diligent and responsible woman, who wants her business to be a success. In the future, she would like improve the ambience by setting up a table for preparing the cheese, because a nice location and good product presentation are good advertising.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, and fabric in various colors

loans.name: Alexa Doris

texts.es:
La señora Alexa Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de jugos de frutas naturales, sándwiches y refrigerios. El negocio lo realiza en un lugar muy concurrido llamado Brisas del Huallaga, lugar donde espera a sus clientes para atenderlos con mucha amabilidad.
 
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de frutas para la preparación de los jugos como papaya, naranja, manzana, guineos, maracuyá, betarraga, azúcar en saco, así como panes, huevo, jamón y queso. También comprará vasos descartables, servilletas, sorbetes, entre otros, para poder dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

La señora Alexa Doris tiene 30 años de edad, es una mujer muy optimista, y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Le gusta el negocio, el cual desea ampliar más adelante, colocando más mesas, y de esa manera dar una buena atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Alexa Doris belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Rosario" and lives in the region San Martín, province and district of Bellavista. She is dedicated to selling natural fruit juices, sandwiches, and snacks. The business is conducted in a popular place called Brisas del Huallaga, a place where she waits for her clients to take care of them with lots of friendliness. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will invest in purchasing fruits for the preparation of juices like papaya, orange, banana, passion fruit, beets, and sugar, and also bread, eggs, ham, and cheese for sandwiches. She will also buy disposable cups, napkins, among other things, to be able to offer good service to her clients. Señora Alexa Doris is 30 years old, a very optimistic woman, and above all a hard worker. She likes the business, which she wants to make bigger by acquiring more tables, and in this way offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruits like papaya, orange, apple, etc. Also disposable cups, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y golosinas y el negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, en el Jr. Lamas C–12.  Se inicia en el negocio  ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir a la economía de su hogar.  

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará agua mineral, gaseosas de diferentes marcas y tamaño personal, mediano y familiar, así como golosinas como galletas, caramelos de diferentes marcas y sabores, chupetines, plátanos en racimos para luego ser vendidos al menudeo. Estos son productos muy requeridos por sus clientes. 

La señora Betty tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante su negocio para el bienestar de ella y la de su familia. Desea más adelante implementar, con más productos, el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Betty, member of the "Virgin of the Rosary" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, province and district of Bellavista. She is dedicated to sell carbonated beverages and sweets. Her business is located on her home. She started her business out of the need of generating her own earnings and contribute to the household income.

With this 1,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be paid in 6 months, Betty will buy mineral water, different brands and sizes of carbonated beverages (personal, medium and family size) and also different sweets like cookies, an assortment of caramels and candies, lollipops and suckers and banana bunches to be selled at retail. These products are highly requested by her customers.

Betty is 33 years old, lives with her husband and a child. She is a very perseverant and responsible woman, with great enthusiam to see her business growing for her family's welfare and hers. She wishes in the future to establish and expand her business with more products.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy mineral water, carbonated beverages and also sweets

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal  “Las Margaritas”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de Agua Blanca. Se dedica a prestar servicio de cableado tanto para el alumbrado público como para casas y habitaciones. Está aprovechando que ella es la encargada de la cobranza de este servicio en su distrito y ahora que están cambiando las redes no tuvo mejor idea que brindar este servicio a quienes lo requieran, sus clientes son los moradores de su distrito. 

Con este crédito de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará cables de diferentes marcas y números, enchufes, tomacorrientes y todo lo que se requiera para este tipo de trabajo. Carmen pone todos los materiales para que sus clientes no se preocupen de estar saliendo a la cuidad para adquirir  estos materiales que les generaría mayores costos.

La señora Carmen Pilar tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y uno de sus 02 hijos que aún depende de ella. Es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora, la cual tiene como meta construir una casa para poder poner un negocio y formalizarlo.
texts.en:
Carmen Pilar belongs to "Las Margaritas" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, El Dorado province, Agua Blanca District. She provides cable installing services for the electric public utility as well as houses and rooms in the community. She is taking advantage of the facr that she is in charge of collecting the payments for this service on her district and now that they are changing the grid, she had the great idea of offering this service to anyone that may need it. Her clients are the inhabitants of her district.

With the 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy different brands and numbers of cables, plugs, electrial outlets and everything that is require for this type of work. Carmen provides all the materials so that her clients don't have to worry to go to the city to get these materials which will generate higher costs for them.

Carmen Pilar is 35 years old, lives with her husband and one of their 2 children that still depends on her. She is a decisive and happy woman as well as a good administrator. Her goal is to build a house to establish a business and formalize it.


Translated from Spanish by Maria R.-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy different kinds and numbers of cables

location.town: Agua Blanca - El Dorado - San Martín

loans.name: Charita

texts.es:
La Señora Charita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, vive en la región San Martín,  provincia de El Dorado, distrito de Agua Blanca. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  desde hace bastante tiempo y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Arica C-03, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, los cuales son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, juguetes, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para poder surtir bien el negocio y que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Charita tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando para hacer crecer el negocio y además porque le gusta lo que hace. Su meta es continuar con el negocio, seguir creciendo y tenerlo bien surtido para la satisfacción de ella y la de sus clientes, así como también terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Charita is a member of the "Las Margaritas" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, El Dorado Province, Agua Blanca District. She has been in the business of selling groceries for a long time and is going good. The business is located out of her home located at Jr. Arica C-03. Her customers, who are mainly her local neighbors, come on a daily basis to shop at her store.

With this 1,700 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be paid back in 6 months, Charita will buy products of basic need like: rice, sacks of sugar, boxes of preserves in different sizes, toys, packs of toilet paper, detergents, different brands and sizes of soaps among them. She want s to have a good assortment and variety of products so her clients can find what they are looking for.

Charita is 32 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children. She is a working and charismatic woman with a great desire to continue working to see her business grow and also because she loves what she does. Her goal is to continue with the business, continue expanding it, and offer a good assortment for her satisfaction and her customers as well. She will also like to finish building her house.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy basic need products like rice, sugar and others

location.town: Agua Blanca - El Dorado - San Martín

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La señora Clara, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Zamaritanas”, vive en el Departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, sobretodo para damas, también vende cosméticos y sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria visitando a vecinas, amigas y a personas que son recomendadas por los clientes que tiene. Clara vende al crédito dando facilidades de pago a sus clientes de manera diaria, semanal, quincenal y mensual.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes, esmaltes, labiales entre otros productos que tienen buena acogida entre sus clientes y así atender sus pedidos que le hacen las personas quienes son la razón de su negocio.

Clara tiene 42 años de edad, es natural de Lamas y vive con sus 03 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante a pesar de los obstáculos, más adelante piensa comprar un local en el mercado para vender verduras porque está analizando que este tipo de negocio tiene más salida por ser ingrediente principal en la dieta diaria.
texts.en:
Clara, a member of the Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto "Las Zamaritanas", lives in the region and province of San Martín in the district of Tarapoto. She sells clothing, women's overcoats, and cosmetics and she achieves her sales by visiting neighbors, friends, and people referred to her as clients. Clara sells on credit, allowing her clients to pay daily, weekly, bimonthly, and monthly. With this $275 loan, which she will repay in six months, she will buy women's clothing like polo shirts, blousers, trousers, and beauty products such as perfume, nail polish, lipstick among other products that her customers prefer and address their requests. Clara is 42 years old, a native of Lamas, and lives with her three children. She is a a woman eager to move ahead despite obstacles. Later, she is thinking of buying a place in the market to sell vegetables because she has determined that this type of business has more output since vegetables are the main ingredient in the daily diet.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy women's clothing such as polo shirts, blouses, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Cidia

texts.es:
La señora  Cidia, socia del Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en la Región San Martín,  provincia y distrito D. Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor D. la Libertad. Se dedica a la venta D. comida y chicha D. maíz, que es una bebida regional muy agradable y solicitada, venD. en las afueras D. su casa.  Se inicia en el negocio porque tenía la necesidad D. generar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos D. sus hijos, sobretodo los gastos escolares.  

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  productos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, condimentos, harina D. maíz y otros ingredientes para la preparación tanto D. sus platos como D. la chicha y D. esa manera poder satisfacer las exigencias D. sus clientes que en su mayoría son los trabajadores D. las obras que está ejecutando la Municipalidad D. su caserío. 

La señora Cidia tiene 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y 03 D. sus 09 hijos que tiene. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas D. sacar adelante a sus hijos, quien desea, más adelante, complementar su negocio con la venta D. ropa usada.
texts.en:
Cidia, a member of the La Libertad Communal Bank, lives in the San Martín region, in the province and district of Bellavista, in the lesser town center of La Libertad. She sells food and chica D. maíz, a very popular and pleasant local drink, outsiD. of her house. She started this business because she needed to generate some income to settle her children's school expenses. With this loan of $325, which she will repay in six months, she will buy products like rice, sugar, oil, condiments, corn flour, and other ingredients to prepare dishes like chicha and satisfy her customers, the majority of whom are municipal workers in her town. Cidia is 46 years old, lives with her husband and three of her nine children. She is a very persistent and responsible woman eager to move her children forward, who later hopes to complement her business by selling used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, condiments, corn flour, etc.

loans.name: Delidia

texts.es:
La señora Delidia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Rosario”, vive en la región y provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica  a la crianza  de  aves de corral, entre ellos pavos, gallinas, patos en la huerta de su casa y lo vende en el mercado central de la cuidad a las amas de casa y dueños de restaurantes.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  gallinas, patos, pavos, alimento balanceado para criar sus aves, así como vacunas para prevenir las enfermedades y así mantenerlos en buen estado para tener buenas ventas, obtener mejores ganancias y que sus clientes queden satisfechos.

La señora Delidia tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 04 hijos. Es una mujer responsable y sobre todo preocupada por la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delidia belongs to the Our Lady of the Rosary Communal Bank and lives in the region and province of Mariscal Caceres in the district of Juanjui. She raises poultry, including turkeys, chickens, and ducks in her garden and sells them at the city's central market to housewives and restaurant owners. With this $500 loan, which she will repay in six months, she will buy chickens, ducks, turkeys, balanced feed to raise her poultry, as well as vaccinations to prevent illness and maintain their health for good sales, better earnings, and client satisfaction. Delidia is 35 years old, lives with her husband and her four children. She is a responsible woman and above all worried about her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, ducks, turkeys, and balanced feed.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La Señora Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la región y  provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 4 años y esta muy contenta. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Tarapoto Nº 504. Sus clientes son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, así como juguetes, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para poder surtir bien su negocio y que sus clientes encuentren  lo que buscan. 

Domitila tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo. Es una mujer muy  trabajadora, que quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio. Su meta  es ampliar el negocio con la venta de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Domitila is a member of the Our Lady of the Rosary Communal Bank and lives in the region, province, and district of Bellavista. For the past four years, she has sold groceries and she is very happy. The business is located in her home at Jr. Tarapoto Nº 504. Her neighbors are her primary customers. With this loan of $275, which she will repay in six months, she will buy products of primary necessity like rice, sugar, milk, and oil, preserved in boxes of different sizes, as well as toys, toilet paper, detergent, various brands and sizes of soap, among other things, to be able to stock her business so that her customers can find what they are looking for. Domitila is a 37 year old, single mother and lives with her only son. She is a very hard-working woman who wants to keep growing her business. Her goal is to expand her business by selling clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products like rice, sugar, and milk, for her grocery store.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Hernández García tiene 60 años de edad, es casado con 7 hijos todos adultos y viven en sus propias casas. Este señor se dedica hace más de 30 años a la actividad de transporte selectivo (taxi) y con dicha actividad a mantenido a todos sus hijos. Actualmente solo dependen el y su esposa. Sin embargo por las constantes alzas en los precios del combustible la ganancia solo ajusta para los gastos del hogar y por otro lado por el mal estado de las calles deterioran rápidamente las piezas del vehiculo. Sin embargo al vehiculo se le debe dar mantenimiento para que pueda tener mayor vida util,  lo que consiste en compra de repuestos. 

Por tal razón esta solicitando para comprar las siguientes piezas de repuestos:

Un par de llantas R-1365 para carro las que cuestan US$ 110 cada par, 1 plato de presión para carro el que vale US$ 35 la unidad, 1 batería para carro que vale US$ 90 cada batería, y 1 disco de clotch para carro que cuesta US$ 90 cada clotch.
texts.en:
Carlos Hernández García is 60 years old and is married with seven children, all of whom are adults and live in their own homes. This man has dedicated more than 30 years to taxi work and, with this job, he has supported all of his children. Currently, he supports only his wife and himself. Nevertheless, due to the constant hikes in fuel prices, his income covers only household expenses. At the same time, due to the poor state of the roads, pieces of his vehicle quickly deteriorate. Nevertheless, he wants to repair his car so that it can have a longer useful life, which requires the purchase of spare parts. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase the following parts: One pair of R-1365 car wheels that costs US $110 per pair, one pressure plate valued at US $25, 1 battery worth US $90 each, and 1 clutch that costs US $90 each.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase  car parts: 1 pair of R-1365 car wheels, 1 pressure plate, 1 battery, and 1 clutch.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “San Marcelo”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de frutas y leña. Desarrolla la actividad en su domicilio ubicado en el Jr. San Marcelo  Mz H – Lt 07, lugar donde atiende a sus clientes con la amabilidad que la caracteriza. Decide iniciarse en el negocio para generar sus ingresos y estar en contacto tanto con sus amigos y como con otras personas. 

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará frutas como plátanos de seda en racimos, naranjas, madarinas en sacos, piñas, paltas, entre otras frutas, además comprará leña en tercios para luego venderlos al menudeo.  

La señora Doris tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos quienes son la razón de su lucha constante para poder sacarlos adelante, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y poco a poco está creciendo en su negocio. Espera arreglar su casa para implementarse con abarrotes.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the San Marcelo Grupo de Credito Mientras Tanto and lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the distract of Tarapoto. She sells fruits and firewood. She started this business from her home, where she attends to her clients with her characteristic kindness. She decided to start the business to earn income and to be in contact with her friends and other people. With this loan of $275, which she will repay in six months, she will buy fruits, including bunches of bananas, oranges, mandarins, pineapples, avocados and other fruits. She will also buy firewood in thirds to later sell them retail. Doris is 36 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. They are the reason she struggles constantly to get the family ahead. She also counts on the support of her husband and little by little she is growing her business. She hopes to fix her house in order to sell groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits (bananas, oranges, mandarins).

loans.name: Bertha Francisca

texts.es: Doña Bertha D. tiene 61 años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos que ya no dependen de ella ya que estan casados, su esposo trabaja en conjunto con ella, su deseo es poder continuar trabajando y salir adelante ahora con un nieto que tiene a su cargo, ya que es su voluntad desear ayudarle ahora en su educacion, Doña Berha, se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, pan, golosina, frutas, ella tiene un triciclo donde comercializa en los diferentes puntos del municipio de malpaisillo, el cual tiene mas de 15 años de ejercer, dando inicio como producto de la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar ya que su trabajaba como jornaleo y no tenia un ingreso fijo, por  lo que decidio poner su pequeño negocio, que en la actualidad es su unica fuente de ingresos, con el financiamiento pretende invertirle a su negocio especificamente en la compra de materi prima como azucar, frutas, colorantes, entre otros productos, esperando contar con el apoyo nuestro en el mejoramiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha D. is 61 years old, married and has five children who are out of the home and married. Her husband works with her. Her wish is to be able to continue working and to prosper. She now cares for her grandson, and wishes to help with his education. Bertha sells carbonated beverages, bread, sweets and fruit. For 15 years, using a three-wheeled cart, she has sold at various locations in the town of Malpaisillo.
